rTD2Vc-xoRKEEyL-836Y9w.text: I take no pleasure in handing out low ratings and reviewing harshly, but in some cases its necessary. From the onset, I felt a certain unease as we, a group of six were seated by the door which I clearly asked not to be. The center piece of design was in the other sitting area and our guests were unable to observe the Buddha even though I asked the host to be seated elsewhere. Vegetable Spring Rolls were low quality and filled with some form of shredded kelp seagrass, nothing else. This item can be more readily accessible in aisle six, the frozen food department at your local grocer. The Vietnamese Shrimp Rolls, only fractionally better as the peanut sauce was good and the Almond Wontons lacked any form of flavor.  The entrees had a peculiar oder, from the spare ribs to the crab fried rice (an horrid upsell by the server, $26.00 for six ounces of rice and low quality, canned crab meat.) The Duck in Orange sauce was skimpy, just one pathetic sized leg and thigh for $26.00. The House Sake was atrocious, the garnish for all dishes was so sloppy and poorly plated. There seemed to be little or no professionalism from front of the house to the back of the house in their entire approach. They tacked on a 20% gratuity which is not uncommon for parties of five or more. Is an automatic tip a good reason to work your tables in such an uncaring and unprofessional manner?  Striving for a higher total bill cost is NOT the emphasis, but it was ay SEA the culinary experience from hell. After two hundred dollars and grumbling bellies I walked out mortified.

JBtWes5N06vZH3h_f5744A.text: The food was good but I would only rate it as okay compared to other Thai resturants I have eaten at.  The service was very slow.  I do not think they had enough help. Our server was trying hard but had too many tables to wait on.

ar1FVVmxP80wCjzEk5C4YQ.text: This is the most expensive Thai restaurant on the Strip. $21 for a fried rice, and was very salty. Service was ok, but the food leaves a lot to be desired considering spending over $100 on two meals, and tea.

Eph9CNJBPlIcAbnluX14QA.text: Recent visit for lunch. Service is acceptable. Crab rangoons are okay, not great. Surprisingly the pho is yummy at this thai restaurant. Pricey, but as expected for Vegas! Will try other options next time.

z3-knQ5fzdQa-caGf3SvFg.text: I write this with mixed feelings...dining in Vegas can be complicated...I've always thought of Thai food as delicious and relatively inexpensive. Our party of 4 was there for a celebratory family dinner. We had reservations, although I doubt from the empty tables that we needed them. In our reservations I mentioned our reason for celebrating, but it was never acknowledged. We were seated by the water feature, which is a nice touch. However, there is a bright light that ruins the mood, coming from the kitchen, as well as clanging sounds of dishes getting washed. Additionally, the bus station was about 5 feet from our table. In a restaurant of this attempted caliber, I expect a better ambiance. Both situations could be easily and simply remedied with screens or curtains. Service was almost too good; wait staff kept trying to take away plates that were not yet finished. The food was good, not over the top, not overly generous in portion, but tasty. A party of 4 with 2 beers, 1 soda, and 1 water plus 4 shareable plates added up to $178, with tip. It seems a little pricey, even by Vegas standards.

FqCfWQFyamx8f7WDLpIpxg.text: Place is difficult to find. It's INSIDE of Bally's. Once you're inside Bally's just keep walking straight ahead towards the Casino and look for signs.   When I went with my friend in October for Halloween weekend, we were depriving ourselves of real food all weekend so we decided to try this restaurant out. It's a bit pricey than what I'm used to for Asian cuisine. I enjoyed that they served Vietnamese and Thai! Score. The decor is beautiful as well. There's a small swing the size of a ball you can rock back and forth (I don't know if that is allowed).  In the middle of the room there is a buddha sculpture with a nice "japanese" like setting pond around it. REALLY great atmosphere. It was kind of romantic, especially when they dim the lights and the candles are lit. I wish I was on a date.  The food was good enough, not amazing, but not terrible.   They seem to have specialities as well which is good for me since I don't want to spend 20+ per entree if I can get the same entree/presentation elsewhere.  I can't remember the other dishes we had, but we got this shrimp eggroll cocktail looking appetizer and it was TO DIE FOR! it was very cute as well.   I'll be back. ENJOY!

7xr2iPj3ubNXksO8UkpWUA.text: What a treat; an absolutely extraordinary experience! From the moment we arrived we were seated promptly, given exemplary service and dined on fantastic food. It was not real busy as we were here for lunch, but there were two servers always waiting in anticipation for a customer's needs. We were checked on multiple times at our table. As for the atmosphere, SEA is intimate with water everywhere. After a long day of traveling to Vegas and waiting in lines this was the perfect place to come and relax. I don't think I have ever had such Thai food. My friend Denise wouldn't shut up SEA for the rest of the trip. I actually had to convince her that we needed to explore the rest of Vegas, or we would have eaten every meal here. We ordered a yummy cocktail, the pad thai and the panang curry. It was all perfect down to the white rice that came out sculpted into a little pyramid. Can I give SEA 6 stars? Read more Las Vegas and Los Angeles reviews at my blog: rescuelashelters.wordpre...

XbLjXRO5-sVqkp-CdBaN-Q.text: Online says they close at 12 AM on Wednesday (everyday). We came at 11:20 and it may be close to closing time, but we don't take long and either they should fix their website or change their hours. Waste of time navigating through the hotel only to be turned away. Also the door was still open with no close sign. If it was policy to turn people away, it felt more like my business was not wanted because they were almost closed. I'm a very unhappy non-customer. Reach out to me at xxperencexx@gmail.com if desired.

IfxVxo2RZt6fioALUOLuig.text: I have to start off by saying that this is not a traditional Thai food place.  They have a very interesting spin on their Thai dishes.  But surprisingly, it works out well.  We enjoyed everything we ordered.  The lettuce wrap was ok, not my favorite but not bad.  Chicken satay was tasty and not dried out.  Shrimp & walnut was definitely not what we expected but really good!  It was battered & fried but really light & crispy yumminess.  And then there was the drunken noodles with shrimp, spicy and delish!!!  We did have 1 person that hates anything Asian, so she ordered the ribeye steak, for $42 it had better be good, and it was.  She said it was perfectly cooked and seasoned but she hated the ginger sauce that it came with.  I did try it and agreed with her.  Thanks for our Groupon, our meal didn't dent us too bad in our pockets, and we were told we're allowed 2 Groupons per table!  That's awesome!  Service was 5 stars!!  Very sweet server and attentive!  And the place is just beautiful with the water feature in the center of the restaurant.  I'll be back!

ZToGIJSgzpr8tm-Uq0DMsA.text: Everything taste good but execution was poor. They over cooked the noodles!!! Plate was a mess of mushy noodles.

gwSoGmXChKRcSl1u0OUfwA.text: The place was awesome, it had very cool lighting and seating we got to sit by the water it was pretty sweet. The food and service were great as well! We got the crab wantons, coconut spring rolls, shrimp pad thai, and the beef pad seew(sp?) everything was delicious the crab wanton had a lime vinaigrette that could put on anything! The pad thai was yummy as well although I would have preferred the chicken. The beef padsew was the best one i've ever tasted!! Overall great atmosphere, service and food!

KVo2X2iLmMtN7cDrTAYJZg.text: Sitting here as I write this as we leave tomorrow. I wish we had tried this place first as would have tried more things. The Sea is in Ballys in a beautiful setting. The food is fresh, delicious and unique. Very well priced and generous entrees of spicy seafood and noodles plus more. Love the sea food salad.  We tried the most wonderful chefs special called the Hawaiian seafood tart it looks a bit weird but it's like a Korean pancake covered with a tempura batter over generous varieties of seafood. I would just come for that with a wine or cocktails to relax.  This will only be featured  here for a limited time. The other chef special are geyser prawns. The most gigantic prawns you have ever seen in a pot with perfectly done silver noodles. Don't want to bore you but our stomachs are so happy.  Closed between 230-5. Bar is next to them.

31tnLPv-IanIty6t94V1ng.text: The food was yummy and the decor was very beautiful. I just think the entrees should be $5 cheaper. I think $18 for pho or fried rice is just too much.

rsDIpirFvzOCRhHJI_b4zw.text: A little place squirreled away near the Paris / Bally's crossover.  Seek it out and you will be rewarded!  The decor is beautiful and is more effective if you're there early.  The candles, water, and subdued ambiance are quite effective in combination.  The food is a win in every way.  Portions are on the large side, well prepared, and delicious!  I started off with the summer rolls from the Vietnamese side of the menu.  They were very well prepared; fresh and crispy, with grilled pork, mint, and rice noodles inside.  I had the Drunken Man's Noodles for the entree - they were flavorful, spicy, and full of meat and vegetables.  I can highly recommend this dish - have them spice it the way you like it; it's a real crowd pleaser.  When all was said and done, it was about $31 with drinks ($5 for a big thai iced tea).  That's pretty cheap for Vegas.

g7gib5DQgypK0dhiQf-d5Q.text: We were at a Continuing Legal Education seminar that was being held in Bally's.  We only had a short time for lunch.  We saw SEA and thought it looked like just the thing.  It was.  I had the Drunken Noodles and was very happy.  Great flavors, fresh ingrediants and just the right amount of spice.  I would certainly come back to SEA the next time I am in Vegas.  Thank you.

OACtIXIZIZzgGjQ0Ml0-Qg.text: When you're walking the strip at midnight you can't be too picky, and this place tucked in the back of Bally's definitely exceeded my expectations for a midnight meal.  Good portions, not bad prices for Vegas, modern trendy decor. The set up almost feels like a bench and picnic table around a lake.

voDIl4q46zprGGty-l3Rtg.text: Unseasoned and bland. Waste of money  I ordered the duck confetti and was looking for Thai spices and rich noddles. The duck was dry and no seasoning.

5YY4PlxdrnRDtevTO4KpUA.text: Love me some great Thai Food...Came here with my hunny we had a great experience. The food was wonderful and very tasty. The seating was so relaxing. This place made my day....Will definitely come back.

ejlVefsXuCRW771ijujPFQ.text: We're huge fans of the SEA in Brooklyn. They've transported the hanging chairs, rectangular pond, the statue, the caged area, the wood accents, and menu to Vegas now. No deejay, though, at least on weekdays.  Prices are much higher (about twice as much) and service is slower (even though the place is a third the size of Brooklyn's). The entrees were $16 - $18/each.  Their menu is Vietnamese on one side and Thai on the other. Ingredients are fresh and dishes are well-balanced. Good-sized portions and the kitchen is good with custom orders. Stand-out dishes are the drunken noodles, pad thai, and pineapple fried rice.  Unfortunately, the smoky smoky smoky air brought this from a 4-star down to a 3. The water also tasted chlorine-y, which should bring this down to a 2.5, except that the servers are extra-courteous (e.g., rushing to get a to-go cup so I could bring my iced coffee with me when I left).

uVu4_n02OjQIFFUa8EB0xQ.text: If I were rating this on food alone, I'd give it 4 stars. Definitely one of the best options in either Bally's or Paris LV, and genuinely tasty food. If you ask for very spicy, you indeed will get very spicy.  I had an excellent tom ka soup - thicker than most, and very satisfying. Drunken noodles for the main course, which were typical but not exceptional. A second visit included fish cake appetizers that were nicely crisp on the outside but tender and very flavorful.  *However*, like so many places in Vegas, the service is somehow both friendly and incompetent. Many of the staff speak English so poorly that you cannot be assured you will get what you want. On my first visit, I ordered spice level '3' and instead got a '5', which significantly changes the experience. My dining companion also ordered '3' and got about a '2'. The actual spice level is irrelevant - the point is we ordered the same thing and got wildly different results.  On the second visit, our dinners simply did not materialize at all. We watched for 45 minutes while diners arrived, were seated, and began to eat. No food. We spoke to our waiter, then another (since ours was not very fluent with English), and got several reassurances. We had indicated that we needed to depart at a certain time, and were again reassured. But that time arrived and still our dinner was "a few minutes" away. In the end, we had to leave without eating it at all! We got one curt "sorry" and that was it.  I don't know (or care) whether that was a communication problem, a kitchen problem, or a management problem. Likely several at once. But the result was a *serious* problem for any restaurant. Beware.

ILI-gEAVLnGcQGa7RV_eXA.text: I've always sided with thai more than anything, but this place is fonominal! Highly recommend volcano chicken or Pho for risk takers, or the spare ribs for those who want something simple and delicious. Trendy yet high class, this place is amazing for a night out with the family. Beautiful scenery and great customer service. Statue, fountain, decorative blue candles all in the same place, would highly recommend.

sBdMBUCDtRppg5m-WtmakA.text: Omg! I'm so happy we decided to check this place out for dinner on our last night in Vegas.  It was so clean, quick, friendly and some of the best Thai food I've ever had!!   We stopped in at 8:15pm and we're finished within an hour, including getting 2 apps.  Our waiter was so accommodating and nice.    I ordered the drunken noodles, seriously the best!  Such good flavor!  I was with 3 other people and between the 4 of us we tried pad Thai, pad see ew, walnut fried rice, crab rangoons, drunken noodles and shrimp chicken dumplings.  Everything we had was phenomenal!   This is my 7th time in Vegas but my first time here.  I expect to make this a regular stop!

upfT6ApZm8EBr0nqCcWq3g.text: Entertained clients at this Thai restaurant.  Out table for 5 was towards the rear...away from the rest of the patrons.  It was reminiscent to a private dining experience.  The entrees were awesome.  The curries, fried rice, Pad Thai Noodles, appetizers were well prepared.  My only hiccup was not enough attention to beverage refills.  It took longer than expected to have someone come by to refill the beverages.  And considering the dishes were prepared "Medium," our tongues were on fire hence we needed multiple refills.

04mPoHSYHmDoOeqX18bMSg.text: Overly priced and not the best  Thai food I ever had . I actually throw it out because it wasn't great .  For the prices they charge they should change the quality of the food . The food had no taste and was not as good as other Thai places I've had .

L3hP5P8Rg1nxFyUA7VU1UA.text: Great service and delicious food with nice atmosphere. Alway look forward to my visit here when in town.

3BmgXo5Pc8U-AJoeFPI1tg.text: She sells seashells by the seashore yelp.com/biz_photos/sea-... 30% off via Tix4Tonight deal of $2/person Living out our inner Katniss & going through our "Hunger Pains", we needed something yummy to fill our tummies. Not being in the mood for a burger or whatever fried crap available, we thought Thai food sounded good. SEA:The Thai Experience is located back in the boonies of Bally's Hotel & Casino. The cuisines served are both Thai & Vietnamese. The ambiance was rather nice, with the center of the restaurant having a fountain pool with a Buddha statue, surrounded by wood tables. On the periphery, standard tables to dine at, with a private area for large parties. Being Vegas, we knew we shouldn't expect prices similar to the local haunts back home. I was almost taken aback as to how much things were, but with 30% off, it helped sweeten the sour taste of overpriced food. Fried calamari($12)- yelp.com/biz_photos/sea-... Lightly breaded calamari, fried to a nice texture, accompanied with sweet chili sauce. Nice & chewy, these were really good. I'm a big squid fan, and I enjoyed each fried piece from the sea. Pad Thai, with beef ($18)- yelp.com/biz_photos/sea-... Sweet, sour & filling, the pad thai had fair portions & was as good as any that I've had dining at my favorites. Honey walnut shrimp fried rice ($18)- yelp.com/biz_photos/sea-... Winna, winna! The highlight of our meal, the honey walnut shrimp fried rice made me want to pop a wheelie in a Tuk-Tuk down Las Vegas Blvd. Crunchy walnuts & bell peppers, a pleasing amount of deveined shrimp with a medley of vegetables wok-tossed with seasoned rice. The portions were great, and I relished this dish, since we only had appetizers for dinner the night before. Service was on the slow side. The place wasn't too busy when we arrived, so I didn't understand why our food took longer than necessary. Our drinks were kept filled & we had a nice meal, enjoying Thai music & the sound of falling water from the Buddha fountain. In summation, we had a nice Thai lunch at SEA:The Thai Experience. Would I dine here w/o the Tix4Tonight deal? Heck no! Way too expensive for stuff that's 3 times more costly than restaurants I usually go to. However, the food was good & we were happy. Furthermore, the ambiance was a nice respite from the frenzy of the Strip. Recommend with the 30% off Tix4Tonight deal

AZE_KTTSQ-CvStQ2vsJneA.text: This is a nice place. Menu is nice. All entrees were delicious. We dined on a Thursday evening. It was not crowded but the service to the three tables in our area was slow the entire evening. Not simply waiting for a properly prepared entree slow (which we totally don't mind), but slow to the point of each table having to catch any worker passing by and ask for drink refills because our server was missing in action.

tgzes4fn9wcHF4_9wHglZw.text: This little place is tucked away inside Bally's. I didn't go in with very high expectations, but the food was fantastic - perhaps the best Massaman curry I've had. The cocktails were good too. Recommended!

Hrpi3VwLubzgG40KBokwrQ.text: Husband took me here for my birthday dinner. The restaurant absolutely beautiful. Sat in the Buddha section & made 2 wishes (even though I have everything I want in life :). The food is delicious definitely worth the high price. Service was great & quick   I recommend the honey walnut shrimp appetizer & the fritter.   Pad Thai is average (a little on the dry side) masamun curry is delicious & a must try is the pork chop!   We will definitely be coming back soon!

Cbqtdr4qjai8NbqIpJSeUQ.text: "I will take the short ribs home and can cook them!".  This is what my girlfriend said to me after one bite.  I purchased a rather expensive Groupon (50 for 78).  Complete waste of money.  The place itself is nice.  What you would expect from a casino restaurant that considers itself on the mid to higher end.  The service, although a little aggressive, is decent.    The beer - I thought they would have at least one Thai beer, but we are told they share the beer menu with BLT...ok not the end of the world.  The food is awful, when considering how much this meal cost me.  If we had paid 20 for both of us we would have given 3 stars.  Our Groupon gives us 2 appetizers (up to 14 each) and 2 dinners (up to 25 each).  One of the appetizers that appealed to us didn't qualify for the amount given, but we can pay extra and did. It isn't much money but the nickel and dime train is coming.  We ordered steamed dumplings and Honey Walnut Shrimp.  The dumplings came out luke warm and very dense, not pleasant.  We actually keep pushing the plate toward each other saying "you eat it". We ate them but only because we paid for them.  The Shrimp dish, recommended by the server, is decent and maybe the star of our meal. They came hot, didn't have a ton of favor, but a nice spice.  Our dinners (UGH) - Short ribs and at the server recommendation Panang Duck (4 dollars above my 25 threshold). "Rice doesn't come with your meal.  Would you like some?"....Tooot Tooot! Sure, we will pay extra for rice.  The meals come out and as my girlfriend takes the first bite she says "They aren't cooked.  I will take the short ribs home and can cook them!".  The girl is Filipino and her family lives for short ribs.  I take a bite of my duck - white un-rendered fat with rubbery skin.  I stopped after taking a second bite of the dish.  What appear to be frozen vegetables used in the dish aren't real tasty. No carry out box needed.  I would have thought the server might ask about why I didn't want to take it home or why we were finished 5 minutes after it came out but as goes life.  So -  The Groupon was 50, we did have 1 beer and 1 Coke, plus upsells brought me to another 30 dollars plus tip on the 80, bringing our meal to almost 100.  We ended up going to Earl of sandwich at Planet Hollywood after to eat.  Don't waste your money here. Much better can be had for far less money.

Ktl7wPHOCsODxjZMt5Y8uQ.text: The food was disappointing as we really love Thai food. We got the Malay curry which was the best thing on the menu but had very little curry and too much other items in it. We also got the pineapple fried rice, pad Thai, chicken satay and honey walnut shrimp. Nothing really stood out except the Malay curry and the prices are expensive even for Vegas prices.  One thing I thought was horrible was we had one baby 8 months old a 3 year old and 3 adults. They automatically put on 20% gratuity due to party of 5. It's listed on the menu but a baby really?  I now realize why the service was none existent as they already got the tip.

pr_IcY6ugcoFes5dewLFEg.text: Needless to say I don't give much 2 stars out there.  I came here with high hopes since it seem like a swanky Thai joint.  My buddy and I wasn't really hungry so we shared some dumplings to start and the Siamese Fried Rice.    Truthfully, in my point of view the dumplings were like Siu Mai from dim sum.  It had a good pork flavor, but the soy sauce it was sitting on was over salty.  I would start by changing the dumplings since it really wasn't in my viewpoint.  As for the sauce place it on the side and some spice needed.  The Fried Rice was nothing spectacular.  Rice that's fried with dried chicken.  I'm surprised they didn't ask me for the spice level!?  Needless to say, I was highly disappointed.    I would say service was good and so was the ambiance.  However, I'll walk to a new Thai joint next time around. - Enjoy!

p5liarVogEa6kqtdcWd7aA.text: I have been to this restaurant several times but have never left a review. I give it 4 stars only because of the price of the dishes. It's a bit pricey, but hey, it is in Bally's and this is the Las Vegas strip. On this visit, I had the spicy papaya salad, the honey walnut shrimp appetizer and Thai teaAll were delicious and I highly recommend! The ambiance is is dark and the music is chill/down tempo. I arrived as soon as it opened at 11:30 so it wasn't very busy which made service quick. I highly recommend this restaurant if you're on the strip and cannot make it to China Town. I will definitely be back!

9i1g9Aq4a4Dn1J6Syo5p5Q.text: The worst thai food ever! So we had $50 voucher to this restaurant, so we decided to give this place a try. The biggest mistake made. The decor is pleasant but the food completely overpriced did not match the ambiance. $22 for pad thai noodles and $22 for red curry. Initially we ordered drunken noodles. Seriously the cook must've been totally drunk when he made it. lt was super salty!! Same goes for the curry. We had to return the drunken noodles because it was too salty. Ordered pad thai and again SALTY!!!  We had a show to catch so we decided to just eat it. It was truly painful experience. The quality of the food also was not fresh. It tasted like they were food from the day before and were just reheated. We clearly felt we were treated like 2nd class because we walked in with a voucher. The total came out $50.86 not exactly sure.  When we got the check, they did not even apply the $50 voucher. A different waiter comes back with the same check. I was like ummm.. please apply the $50 voucher and adjust the receipt.   And the waitress who waited on us conveniently was out of sight. Did they seriously think we'd forget about the voucher?  Our water was not refilled. No one came back to check if the food was alright. When we asked for a refill on the water... the waiter took my husband's glass to the kitchen. I've never ever seen this before. Hubby didmt feel comfortable drinking that water. You don't deserve a tip from us.  Total of waste of a good voucher. Please don't eat here! It's bad food & bad service.

5-2WXJ1uO3q9fBt3rmyYzw.text: This restaurant can be hard to find bc its tucked away in a corner of Bally's Casino. However, it's very modern, romantic, and charming. Food is fantactic, with large portions for the entrees. The pot stickers and satay appetizers are both tasty. The chicken curry and shrimp fried rice are 2 of my favs as well. Drinks are meh...

jXl4aiX5zxBJLaeaNhpHIw.text: Loved the ambiance of this place!  It is small, so there is a need for reservations.  Took the kids with us and we would again, there are some kid friendly dishes.  We were sat promptly which we appreciated because a lot of places on the strip still have a wait even with reservations.  Staff was very friendly and efficient even with the restaurant being full.  We had several different dishes, the Calamari was very good and tender.  Honey Walnut Shrimp was delicious and very fresh tasting not like it was pulled from a freezer.  My only complaint was the Ribeye salad, although the steak itself was flavorful and tender, the dressing was a bit over powered with fish sauce.  It is a bit in the expensive side but the portions are reflective of the pricing.  Had a great experience......we will be back! Keep Yelpin Y'all!

vfvBDBAPCg312pGoTTFn9A.text: Located in the Bally's casino, all the way in the back, you can find this small Thai restaurant.  Nicely decorated with a small decorative pool in the middle where you can be seated around it.  The prices are higher than your local Thai place, but what do you expect?  You're in a casino off the strip.  I determine if I like a Thai restaurant by ordering the Chicken Basil, so of course I ordered it.  However, I saw that duck was an option, so I opted with that instead. I was pleased with the results and concluded that I could eat here again.  With so many places in Vegas and this place was in Bally's, I doubt if I return.  If you are in the mood for Thai and in the area, then by all means, come give this place a try.

However, the cost of two glasses of wine were $34???. We will only revisit this restaurant with a Groupon deal.

Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Good however more meat please

9RUPKeNFKvM7EVVVgEM5eQ.text: Our second visit to see the type experience was exceptional. My wife and I both had the softshell crab appetizer and it was great. It's large enough where it could have been the meal. My wife had the sea pot and enjoyed it for a second time. This time I had the duck con feet which was among the best duck I have ever eaten. A little bit on the pricey side but the food is exceptional.

mxXSFcNCrKcSWKWxP1yanw.text: The food at SEA is definitely good.  I don't know if it really is worth the price you pay for it though.  I never thought I'd pay $16 for Pad See Eiw ever.  Most Thai places only charge about $8, and in Thailand $1.50.  Seems like an overpriced Thai restaurant to me, kind of like P.F. Chang's is to Chinese restaurants.  In any case, the food here is delicious, price may not be a deterrent if lady luck is rolling with you in Las Vegas.  The decor of this place is surprisingly trendy, especially since it's located inside an older Bally's casino.  There are nice tables beside a pool of water that centerpieces a nice Buddha statue.  Pretty cool for a Buddhist, like myself, to see such a remembrance of belief.  The restaurant looks very much like a few Sukhumvit restaurants and lounges I've gone to in Bangkok.  The bubble seats, in particular, that hang from a ceiling mount at the entrance reminded me of the trendy & cool Bangkok nightlife.  Personally, I just like sitting on them.  My family and I ordered:  Pad See Eiw w/ Chicken - $16 Chicken Wing Lollipops - $9 Green Curry w/ Chicken - $17 Queen of Thai Basil w/ Beef - $16 Tamarind Whole Fish (tilapia) - $32  Everything tasted great.  Even, what I thought, was an overpriced Pad See Eiw had my mouth drooling for more.  The tamarind-chili sauce from the tilapia was exceptionally tasty.  I poured a lot of that saucy goodness all over my white rice.  Combining the sauce to an already aromatic jasmine rice made it even better.  A note of warning though, SEA charges 20% gratuity for parties of 5 or more.  I didn't really like that since I thought the service was mediocre at best.  Fifteen percent would have sufficed since our waters were not refilled even once.  And, I'll be damned if I order another $5 Thai Ice Tea.  Anyways, I'll come here again if the dice are rolling my way or if I want to bring a date to a nice looking restaurant, otherwise I prefer to go to a more reasonably priced Thai restaurant on Spring Mountain Road that's just as good.

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. SEA Chicken Wing Lollipop

SxOWPhV5Pik8sQ6UH6AWJQ.text: I love SEA Brooklyn, I hate SEA Manhattan. My level affection is based --absolutely-- on their Po-Pia Sod (Vegetable Summer Roll): Brooklyn's are fresh and vicious. Manhattan's are dry and sad. But when it comes to Vegas, there are no Po-Pia Sods on which to base my entire review on! Instead I had to order the boringly named Crispy Spring Rolls with lime and mustard vinaigrette.   The rolls: Good! Not special, but good!  The dipping sauce: OMG AMAZING! Super tart and sweet, littered with aromatic mustard seeds! Did I slurp it directly from the shallow bowl after I finished my rolls?! Only I (and my dining companion... and waiter) know for sure.  The restaurant looks like a tiny knock off of the Brooklyn location. Which is appropriate since my opinion of the Vegas branch is akin to the beloved North 6th outpost! But, unlike the bougie Brooklyn location, this place is never crowded... at least not yet!

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy Spring Rolls with lime and mustard vinaigrette

ysSsHEHWQdPPAh45uKbO-Q.text: Service was great, we went for dinner before a show.  We were about 20 minutes early for our reservation and were seated no problem.  I ordered the Spice Soba with chicken, it was awesome.  I will refer people to visit this restaurant.

wWSXtPDoZMjYhqiO7BEy3w.text: The restaurant is just ok. Ordered a beef noodle soup and its ok... a big serving but nothing special about it. Ambiance is nice but service was a bit slow. Bally's is very limited on food selection and that's more the reason why we decided on this spot. Nothing great here. If you have the time, there are tons of other great restaurants on the strip!

8hzeC9v1Yp1OTQbd9VyJhg.text: Horrible! Don't be tricked by the beautiful decor. Service is bad and food is bad. We came there with a travel zoo certificate and told the waitress at the time of ordering. We also ordered a separate crab dish aside from the certificate and discussed what the dish included. Dishes arrived at the table and none tasted good. We didn't complain although we should have. Then arrived the much awaited crab dish. No crab? I'm sorry where is the crab? "Oh the kitchen forgot. Let me take your plate." Return with 2 crab claw halves. "I gave you more shrimp." I'm sorry but the shrimp wasn't what was missing and the dish was $38. It also didn't taste good. To make things even worse, we were given our bill that was $18 over what it should have been. Luckily we looked at the bill before paying. There was a charge on the bill that said open table. We questioned a waiter who walked by about what this meant. He said he didn't know but would get our waitress. She came over and became argumentative. "Your certificate didn't include everything. You still owe $3 on this dish and $10 on another..." I'm sorry but that's not what the Travelzoo said. She then walks away with the bill and comes back and all of a sudden the open table charge had disappeared and we were charged appropriately.  She says, "It was the manager's fault. He thought you had another certificate." First of all, we never saw a manager and you scanned our phone so knew exactly what our offer was. She never apologized and I do believe that she was trying to pocket the extra cash. We will never go back there. The food was subpar and the service was slimy!

Db2FtwSZPZQSXPCI7tyb5Q.text: I have loved Sea since it open in Brooklyn many years ago.  It has been a while since I have been so it was a treat to go ... after a recommendation from Niki C.  My friend and I order basics ... the Chicken Pad Thai, Crab Rangoons and the Tup Tim Fritters (two fried goodness dishes).  All was delicious and the ambience was cute, resemling the amazing set up in Brooklyn.

vVh4lLlvt35PaEH8Wxr5uw.text: Delicious. Definitely recommend the Drunken Man Noodles with a side of Peanut Sauce. I've eaten at many Thai Restaurants. This one is exceptional! =D

GrRKSpYHDhtg3ur7NcSCcA.text: We visited SEA during our last trip to Vegas solely because I'd bought a voucher on Travelzoo for a $45 dinner for two. This turned out to be about the best purchase I've ever made. Our meal was excellent, the service was good and the ambiance was excellent. We were lucky enough to be seated near the back and you could almost forget that you were in a casino.  Our appetizers - coconut crusted shrimp and crab rangoon - were delicious. Similarly, our entrees (macademia crusted salmon, which I highly recommend, and a daily special calamari pad thai) were very flavorful and the portions were huge. My only disappointment was the dessert, a coconut ice cream sandwich that I found to be a little lacking.  This place had probably the best Thai food I've eaten in Las Vegas. I'll be back.

xQnq-QdNUKH3NIoTityPpg.text: We came here to celebrate a birthday. Didn't know it, but there aren't a lot of thai restaurants on the strip.   We came in and were at the front for about 10 seconds before a server came up and let us know that someone would be right there to help us.  Since we were celebrating, we ordered a bottle of chardonnay to go with our meal. Our server came back to tell us that they were out of bottle we ordered, but would give us the next best wine at the same price of the bottle we ordered. I thought that was really nice of her.  Now for the food: Crab miso soup was awesome but came out warm not hot. Still great though. Chicken and shrimp dumplings were amazing. Best food item we ordered. Once again... Dumplings are a must have. For dinner, my wife and I split 2 entrees: the spicy soba noodle and shrimp fried rice. As a precautionary, we went with a level 2 spice. Holy God it was spicy. Just be careful when choosing your spice levels here. For me, I loved it. The wife, not so much. But it was still so good it forced her to power through. The white wine was a nice balance for the spicy dishes.

6sJqTKOsC39EEabgCfBC_w.text: Recently, my husband and I had a coupon for this restaurant.  It is highly overpriced ($5 for a side of rice!), and only average in flavor and variety.  As we were walking down the strip, my husband became violently ill!  He is highly allergic to cashews, and we suspect that a dish we had was contaminated with them.  They could have been part of the chopped "peanuts" that were sprinkled over the Pad Thai.  Rather than return to the restaurant, my primary concern was to get him home, where he was ill for more than 24 hours.  Be careful what you order if you decide to eat here!  Let them be aware of any allergies!

6mtuo8CeGyHaH0jCeTY54w.text: The name of this restaurant is Sea - The Thai Experience. However, the cuisine is more than just Thai, it also serves Vietnamese dishes. The 4 of us came here to try it and we ordered the following: 1) Tom Ka Kai (Coconut Chicken Soup) yelp.com/biz_photos/jVD0.... This was quite good with lots of white chicken meat, mushroom, and baby corn. 2) Pad See Ew yelp.com/biz_photos/jVD0... - I personally didn't try it but my guest liked it. It looked good, so I'd take his word for it. 3) Pad Kee Mao with Tofu yelp.com/biz_photos/jVD0.... This dish is also known as Drunken Noodle. It was quite spicy with good flavor. However, I didn't care for the tofu that was used. Instead of fried tofu which has softer texture, it was the firm tofu (aka bean curb) which didn't take up seasoning well, therefore, tasted really blend. 4) Pad Thai yelp.com/biz_photos/jVD0.... A huge disappointment. Although it looked promising, the sauce was totally off. It had a funny sour taste to it. My guess was that the vinegar used was too much. My fiance who is usually is a big fan could barely eat it. He ended up ordering Chicken Fried Rice below. 5) Chicken Fried Rice yelp.com/biz_photos/jVD0.... You wouldn't think an Asian restaurant could mess up fried rice, would you? Ha. Second disappointment. It was bland and tasteless, according to my fiance. I don't think I'd be able to convince him to come back here after having 2 bad dishes. The restaurant is kind of hidden in the back. The decor is quite nice and staff is very friendly. I think you can get better Thai food outside of the casino, but if you are too lazy to go out, this is not a bad alternative. Just don't get the Pad Thai. =)

Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pad Thai
Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pad Kee Mao (with Tofu)

et5Xoli06hHMfrgo9VEu8Q.text: Ambience was great but food was pretty average. A little too classy (and hence too pricey) for me personally but it was ok since I went there to celebrate an important occasion.  What threw me off was the fact they charged 20% gratuity for 2 of us since it was the holiday season.

okrWYCb68W8sBEJLpWATbw.text: Very good, incredible atmosphere and massuman curry was great.  But lets be honest, this is mislabeled.  Definitely a $$$, not $$.

Psi3-Tu07pEykrqv0EGRdA.text: We had a reservation for 7 pm And were seated promptly - that was nice. The service was painfully slow. We finished dinner at 9:00pm because of the delayed service and mix ups on serving. The food is overpriced with a hint of Thai...the desserts menu is a joke... Never going back.

r0_CRyTMagr2TLdXAWOqlg.text: We really liked the ambiance of the restaurant, Buddha status adds extra Asian feel. We ordered Tup Tim Fritters( Crispy shrimp-chicken dumplings), Drunken men's noodle, Crispy pork belly, Pineapple curry duck. Drunken men's noodle was very tasty(Stir fried broad noodle) and pineapple curry duck was good also. But it doesn't come with rice unless you ask for it. Crispy pork belly was very salty, didn't enjoy that much.   Our problem was service, we ordered bottle of wine before we order the meal. It came out when we almost finish the meal. We'd been asking about the wine to be served to waitress several times during the meal but no responses made until we speak to the manager. Still I cannot understand why serving bottle of wine delayed so much.

aegufkrOeWhIUPVWCFAgPA.text: Had lunch there this week.  I had the Rama the King with chicken. It was spicy from the red curry but not overly so. The peanut sauce was the star of the dish and the veggies were cooked well.  It was simple, cooked well, and tasty. It may not be the fanciest place on the strip but the price is good and the food and atmosphere are worth the visit.

cit0h1sn9h1TplaYda9ZkA.text: My family and I had dinner here during the week night, and it wasn't too busy.  We were seated right away at a table near the water fountain and had a nice view of the Buddha statue and with a pretty lotus flower sheer screen backdrop.  The restaurant has a nice tranquil ambiance with romantic dim lighting and modern Asian design. The service was friendly and attentive.  We had the tup tim fritters appetizer which were crispy chicken & shrimp dumplings with a chili sweet-sour sauce for dipping.  For dinner, we had pad thai with chicken and shrimp, brown rice and the tamarind seafood combo with crispy fillet of tilapia, shrimp, scallops and squid in a spciy sweet and sour sauce.  Our Thai appetizers and entrees were delicious but pricey.

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tamarind seafood combo, pad thai with chicken &amp; shrimp and brown rice

LOg3tENBijJx6EtovciefQ.text: We just let Sea and the experience was not a Thai experience. The food was over priced for a piece of salmon and veggies for $28 and then charge $5 for a small bowl of rice. Being half Korean I've never heard of being charged rice at any spot in my entire life! The appetizers were dry with no flavor. Not impressed. Would never eat there again. One star.

O8HAx6Rxa5ZJ2FsenZpDng.text: Went there during new years eve weekend for lunch. They didn't have much wait time so my husband and i decided to try it even though it had only 3 stars. We were so delighted that we did. It was definitely one of the top 3 meals we had there in the 4 days we were there. We ordered their coconut spring rolls, garlic mixed vegetables with tofu and spicy thai herb fried rice. We also got the mango sticky rice for dessert. All dishes were delicious. The ambience was perfect for a sit down meal and a break from the sounds of the casinos and the strip. Would totally recommend it if you are craving thai/Asian and want veggie choices. The prices were comparable to other restaurants in casino resorts and on the strip.

cFJqJx8lo-ewiBt0sfnu_A.text: Staff was very friendly a little hard to understand with a language barrier. Have a Groupon for 2 Apps ($14 ea) and 2 Entrees ($25/ea) we ordered the Calamari App and Tim Tom(burnt) App. Surprise no Entree for$25 so you either pay more or lose the difference. The food isn't any better then anywhere else we've been. I hope they find a way to improve, I won't be back.

IgocVOlMd7-BPeTSyhsgUQ.text: We used Groupon $40 for 2 appetizers and 2 entree's, lot of food! We shared the SEA Caesar salad and Tom Ka soup. Both excellent. Soup with coconut milk base was very flavorful and loaded with chicken. The salad had crunchy wonton strips and a light tasty dressing. I ordered the cashew stir fry with shrimp. Great variety of fresh veggies, about 8 good sized shrimp and loved the brown gravy. My husband ordered Massaman Curry with beef, he really enjoyed it. Loaded with beef strips and sweet potato that he thought was cooked perfectly. The service was top notch as well, our iced tea glasses were never empty. Would definitely recommend, but could be pricey without the Groupon.

LlCEujEDHlSpgZSuQ8pO5Q.text: Went in for lunch and was told it was closed. Website indicated lunch was until 3:30pm and the person agreed that it does, but still said they are closed.  There were people still eating. Sadly, I will not be returning...

3V4u6e95RGUwPJBONB2aVQ.text: This place is so terrible. Their egg noodle is actually ramen noodle, which any Asian knows is NOT egg noodle. I ordered the Korean spicy seafood.  It tasted like a miso broth and the ingredients inside did not go well together. Nothing like I expected. The pad thai is overly sweet. The worst, overpriced, Asian food I have eaten. The server although friendly did not pay attention to details. I told her at the beginning when I placed my order the table is doing separate checks. She failed to do separate checks.

TE80ZZr7qzy20MGAVmHT0w.text: The food is not up to par with Vegas food standards, meaning it was not very good at all. The staff was nice but didn't really understand English 100% so they're were some miscommunications with the food. Sent back and appetizer and they just brought back the same thing when I asked for it to be taken off the bill.

htvTon2XL6_Q9QRjyW6BDg.text: My husband and I went to dinner using the groupon on a Sunday night.  There were only 3 tables of diners in the restaurant.  With the groupon, 2 teas, and a tip, the total came to $75, way too much for the quality of food.  I had to ask for soy sauce and after about 10 minutes of it being on our table, 2 different waitresses came to ask if we were finished with it.  It was as if they only had 2 condiment trays for the restaurant, which was very strange.  Mediocre food, oddly cold service, and way over priced.  We will not be returning and I would not recommend.

VNpAi5kAxXxDGSB4FcMEtw.text: Oh MAN. This was a GREAT FIND!!! Loved the ambiance. The food was delicious. Both my boyfriend and loved what we ordered. The food came fast, the service was attentive... we are thinking about coming back even though we are only in Vegas for three days!!! Also, the Groupon made this even sweeter!! 5+ stars!! Thank you!!

jlqylsTMYW-WSWP1aiCg_w.text: We came back tonight to celebrate our 21st Anniversary. They made it extra special with an amazing dessert. We enjoyed coconut crusted shrimp and crab Rangoon for our starters and Mango Salmon and Duck Confit for our entree. Everything was amazing. Truly our favorite Thai restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States

iVVrolPxyXUfb1E3KMwxPQ.text: Situated in Bally's, this restaurant looks promising when looking at the menu. From the outside, the ambience looks really dark but there is a pond in the middle of the restaurant that makes the decor looks inviting. Price is a bit on the expensive side: $14 for appetizer and $23 for an entree. We ordered the crab rangoon, crispy calamari and a pad thai. But when it came out, portion were a bit small and flavour was just "meh". Being a more upscale restaurant that charges a premium for pricing, I expected a lot more. The crab rangoon only came with 6 deep fried wontons that were placed on top of sliced cucumbers among a sea of sweet/sour sauce. The calamari was heavily battered and a bit overcooked. The pad thai also lack flavor and had tons of scallions in it. Overall, it was up to par to what they are charging. You may be able to fool someone who is not familiar with thai cuisine but for the seasoned diner, the SEA Thai Experience fell way below expectation.

bkd2i5jcTKm5PyJKkGo-Sg.text: Atmosphere was calm and peaceful, a reprieve from the hustle and bustle of Vegas. Service was among the best I've seen in my four trips here. We got the mild curry and a rice noodle chicken dish. The latter was savory, but a bit too far on the salty side for my liking. Mild curry was delicious, with coconut milk coming through clearly. Definitely a great place to slow down for a bit, have some actual conversation during a meal without the music and crowds drowning you out. Love the water feature as well...priced reasonably for large portions.

D7KVADEeZcLIlLk_iME6uw.text: The Thai experience you do not want. Food is not good, lighting is poor (I swear I was blind for my whole meal cause of flickering lights), our server spoke Chinese much better than English, which was fine for my Chinese speaking friends and family but I can imagine it can be difficult for other parties. Overpriced, I know Vegas is expensive but this doesn't even taste good so yes, overpriced af.  Maybe I came here on a bad night, but I don't think I'll return next time I go to Vegas.  I'm giving a star to the not horrible service (but also nothing to rave about), cute water pool thing in the middle and the cute hanging chair at the entrance.

Zh3cq8U8_Xj-N_lmuyuszA.text: Beautiful interior, friendly staff, and very delicious food. It's pretty pricey but I felt it was a good value.

-yu8Nvb7D4vYSlVGrjgxog.text: Had no reservations, but couldn't give a clear wait time (even though the restaurant was half empty) and we were in line before others with no reservation. After being seated and ordering we were given small plates, table next to us got bigger peculiar size plates. Upon asking for bigger plates manager replied "no you can't" , may have not been serious in intent but was offensive that the table next to us received proper sized plates and were sitting with small plates to eat off.   Table next to us sat after, ordered after, yet they received ALL their food first. As we had to sit there and watch them eat what we ordered and had been waiting for. The waiters were attentive and nice but the fact that they were served first was unacceptable.   The only positive outcome for dining here was the service and help from the waitress who was in charge of our table. She heard our complaints and did her best to serve our table despite all the negative  the food was ok but the waitress was the bright spot. The manager in charge did very little to serve or help us but went out of his way to have the table next to us served first.   Do not recommend dining here unless you want to wait for them to serve them.

2k3xQzIZr4jz7ZQGN9VRwQ.text: I ordered the panang curry with beef which was pretty good not spicy, someone else got the basil with shrimp n beef and it was tasty. Two others had the pad Thai and they all enjoyed it.

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef panang
Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Basil combo
Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken pad Thai

ux4m9uQZgs_hsW4GlRjEqg.text: First thing First... This restaurant will charge you for booking a reservation through any reservation system, Especially not Open Table unless you are ok with being charged after your meal (they don't tell you upfront). It is listed on your dinner receipt, very shady and deceptive.  While the charge is only $1.00 it is really the of it.   I would no recommend purchasing their Groupon they treat you as if will be "cheap" even though you really end spending almost the same about if you did. Or purchase it. In total with our Groupon purchase we saved $8.00  Not let's talk about the food, portions are the smaller side for a Thai restaurant but was perfectly fine for us. Appetizers: Tom Yum soup was good, Steamed Dumpling App was good.  Entrees:  Green Stir Fry lacked all flavor, Drunken Noodles were decent but nothing to write home about. Drinks:$4.00 for a hot tea WOW.. at least it should have been a good loose tea blend then not a tea bag!!! Talk about raping your customers!  I won't begin to tell you what the food did to my wife and I...  The servers were nice, service was quick. The place is cute, we were seated next to a room they put a large party into, our server left to take care of that party and we ended up with a new server. She was nice although did not speak English as well. Personally I think I can think of better Thai restaurants to go to.  May your experience be better than ours.

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VPiuJoHw2jZF94Ap1-M8Aw.text: Upscale Thai dining. The wait staff was courteous and welcoming. The menu was uncomplicated and we enjoyed everything that we ordered. The drunken noodles were delicious and the seafood salad was perfect for a lighter fare. It was nestled in the heart of Bally's but worth finding.

Ftg4inTry9oOhjE-At-KoQ.text: I went here twice and I had high expectations for this restaurant, but it is always disappointing.  FOOD: The Malay Curry is highly recommended here because it was voted #1 on CNN. The flavor was great, but the sweet potato was undercooked and too hard to eat. The Pad Thai was also recommended, but this time the noodles were undercooked. I tried a few other dishes, but everything failed to impress me. The food is overpriced, food is not cooked properly, and presentation is okay.  DRINK: Bottle service is very popular here among customers.  ATMOSPHERE: The seating area around the pond is beautiful, but if you end up with a regular table it is cramped and the table is plain. The service here was horrible. It is categorized as a find dining restaurant, but everyone is unfriendly. Many of the larger dishes should have a serving spoon to share, but they did not provide it. When I asked for a serving spoon, they gave me attitude and returned with a small spoon making it difficult to scoop the food. My table had ordered a soup that is served in an open flamed pot, the flame kept going out from the draft of the wind, so when we asked the manager to light the pot again, he was unwilling to help.

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Malay Curry (Voted #1 by CNN)
Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tom yum soup
Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pad thai with shrimp

slDnrRUnQbXl1PsVoDiwlA.text: The waitress in the front is horrible. The Asian one with long black hair, that seats you and takes your order. dumb bitch. That's why you're a waitress.  Completely ruins the Thai experience. Loved sea in ny, but who knew Sea in Vegas was so bad. Even the girl that cleans up the tables were better than her. Smh.

hysY21zkLtgX57_Gy6Q_xw.text: $29 for fried rice.... most of the food is way over priced. And for a restaurant in a strip hotel they don't serve alcohol. They have to get it from a bar next door, but they don't open till 4pm, so don't expect a beer at lunch.

84jBbhjDod62f5LwjSlVdw.text: Nice decor with a large Thai Buddha waiting for you in the seating area.  All the servers humbly  helped each other out on every table making it a wonderfully calming "Thai Experience". The soup was deliciously cooked traditional lThai style.  After our dinner we order a couple of the Mango Sticky Rice dishes for dessert and it was delicious!  The check came to $250 for a family of five which was not the Thai Experience!

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Thai Buddha in the Sea restaurant photo by Nancy
Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Tom Yum Soup with fresh tomatoes. photo by Nancy
Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The lettuce wraps in the Sea. photo by Nancy

DBI8Cy8Bvy8kuCla__0gRQ.text: Food was good And the price is what you would expect in Vegas. Like that they stay open longer then the other restaurants in the hotel

PbhLbun6_HkMjdim7Rl6wA.text: SEA had a fun ambience. They had a beautiful fountain with a statue and had an area where the wall changes colors. It had a modern touch to the restaurant. They had EDM going on and the music was fairly loud  Honey walnut shrimp - yummy clean taste  18$ Pad Thai: Could've had better. It was pretty bland. Not good or bad.   26$ Crab Fried Rice: This was really good. I love crab fried rice and this would be the reason why I would come back, along with the honey walnut shrimp.

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 26$ Crab Fried Rice
Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Honey Walnut Shrimp. Yum~

TRdkWgCr5VgNivxN5FePuw.text: Went with the family. Super expensive, 30 a dish, but great service  super expensive

FGg2dVyBdrLYGbvAai2KpA.text: Boring ! Uneventful ! Told the server we were unhappy with Massam curry dish they said was rated "top 10" They did nothing to resolve the problem. ALL dishes were overpriced . Nothing tasted unique & nothing seasoned well . Bland as can be on EVERY Entree. They are a huge waste of calories and pleasure .

SjS5DLjVaEbyQelkKm9w6Q.text: I'm the biggest lover of Thai food and this place did not disappointment. My girls and I were in Vegas for a bachelorette party and decided to eat here for lunch. The food was very good and the portion sizes were large. The place was a bit pricy for Thai food most items were over $20, but I think most places on the strip in vegas were pricy.  But I highly recommend to try this place  if  you are in Vegas and love Thai food. You will not be disappointed!

UiWCgH4pnP4ypbKRB3O-ww.text: Got a Groupon for the five of us for dinner - food was decent, came here cause I was craving Asian and didn't want to go far. I think I'm spoiled by good, cheap NYC Thai food because this was very mediocre. I would never pay for this in the city, but when you're in Vegas you tend to shell out $$$ for food that is just okay.  My brother ordered the curry (which was already $21) and then we had to pay $3 for the rice. The Asian in me was like "man this ain't right" but I did it anyway cause rice is life. I got the pad kee mao, it was decent, nothing to write home about. Cute decor, I was with my family so didn't get to sit next to the fountains, but I think that would have been nice.

dXwR7RbipVr0QMSj8ngWlw.text: Below average in all areas (but the shrimp). The pho had decent flavor but the texture of the scallops and squid was below average, however the shrimp texture was great. The peanut noodle my girlfriend got was okay. I would never pay for the quality they offer and the poor service they provide.  The waiters didn't ask how the meal was and did not ask if we wanted to take home the leftovers (I was barely able to muster the courage to eat half). The only truly good thing about this restaurant is the decor. I am leaving a restaurant unsatisfied for only the second time at any restaurant in my life..

HO_igy3Z-PxgzxInNy3j3Q.text: This a small restaurant located in the rear of ballys I recommend making reservations. The food was excellent and so was the service. We had a blast everyone was super nice from beginning to end

_DXz93ggRhpIZrcTvjVDSw.text: I would rate Sea as an average restaurant in Las Vegas. The pricing was reasonable, and the food was average.We wanted a light meal so we went with a couple of appetizers. The honey walnut shrimp was tasty, the appetizer portion had about 10 shrimp, but there was way too much breading on them. The spring rolls were good, especially the sauce that they were in. This was also a decent size portion. My friend that got the pad Thai, she said it was average.  I would recommend this restaurant if you want something low-key.

uAVxUonjYMz0aaBOymlMYg.text: Made reservations, made us wait. Ordered 3 dishes, only got 2. Canceled the 3rd. Asked for a glass with our beer, had to ask for it again 15 minutes later. Never refilled water or soft drink. Never came to check on us at all. Had to flag someone down for everything. When we got the bill, there was a party tip included.  We were a party of 2. Really?!? Food was okay, tasted better. Service needs to improve. Probably won't return.

Z6WvzB_1Sv_vONPTy1ZsXw.text: Great food and amazing customer service!!!!  Manager "O" was very attentive and took the time to help me find the perfect meal. Came and checked on our meals when they were served. Will definitely come back!

kAhCbgy3hlzmifKxDGwa1g.text: The service: Absolutely amazing! The waiters Gong and Mutty were very attentive, friendly and so professional. I was very impressed by their level of service. Such a rare find on the LV Strip.  The food: The quality was exceptional and the food was authentic- quite possibly the best crab Rangoon I've tried! The mango sticky rice was delicious and the presentation was so lovely.  The ambiance: The restaurant is beautiful and tranquil. We were seated by the pond and it was a relaxing dining atmosphere.   A well-deserved five stars - Sea exceeded my expectations!

S-U7Jjj9Cy3LDvoh53xpfw.text: The Island Red Curry is delicious. I had it with beef at the level 3 spice level.   There is nice seating around the pool, but no seat backs. Ask for a regular table if you want to sit in a chair with a back.  The atmosphere is pleasant; it can be a little loud, but is much quieter and smells better than the casino.

mKpmwPCcCbglsPjUxE7mHg.text: I give 5 stars mostly for the service, prices, and ambiance. I ordered the Pad Kee Maow (I think that's how it's spelt?), it's always a favorite of mine. Here it was only ok. Everything on the dish was great, except that there was hardly any sauce so it was pretty dry. I think because I ordered it "mild", and I guess different places have different views on how hot that is, so here mild is no sauce no spicyness.

m25D6wu9aEvnVL3DxF5XFQ.text: A MUST TRY....the food is delicious, and the staff is amazing. Can't wait to go back to Vegas just to eat this.

YKQGp317bsYPNQg53gyFnA.text: Your average Thai.  Walnut shrimp: Shrimp cooked well but batter too thick. Papaya Salad: Good but the papaya sliced too thick. Spring Rolls: Nothing special. Green Curry: Very good, only saving grace. Lava Chicken: Not spicy at all !! Cooked well but nothing volcanic about this. Drunken Noodles: Good.

7dJe_07fXlg-3XxQHrxkKQ.text: I'm so happy we stumbled upon this restaurant the night before we left Vegas. It is a serene escape from the craziness that is Vegas. My husband had Pad Thai, which was perfectly seasoned and a large portion. I had seafood Pho, which was much better than what we get here in Philly. Not oversalted or overseasoned, and loaded with seafood. A great experience, not cheap, as nothing is in Vegas, but good authentic Thai cuisine with great service.

49moKZ04KVJZCcY5jCt7EQ.text: I've had amazing Thai food in many different places. I've never actually been to Thailand, but I've eaten Thai food in Singapore and Australia, as well as here in America.  I have to say the Thai food I ate here is the MOST like the Thai food I ate on that side of the planet. They really have the flavors of authentic Thai cuisine down in a way that most American Thai places don't.  The waitstaff were great. We actually went here three days in a row because the place was so good. Considering it's one of only two options actually inside Bally's (Where the other choice is an over-priced crappy steakhouse), they get an A+ in my book.

8IvRpq2QZX56eLKJZdE1Nw.text: The pineapple fried rice was good but nothing to write home about. I don't think it stands out from any other Thai restaurant but more expensive. Quiet atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pineapple fried rice

Opwvas7Zg9_YOST_YjN8EQ.text: Prompt service. Attentive staff. Tasty food and sauces. They brought out 4 different sauces to taste. We had the pad tai and sweet and sour shrimp. We will return.

4F5QEYAo4GyZzDu7pMvJdg.text: Purchased a groupon online. (Remember to tip on the full value of the dinner.) The staff were friendly and honored it. Appetizers were a generous size. My boyfriend and I ordered two appetizers and two entrees and found it more than enough food. The flavors were a pleasant Asian fusion style. The decor was very zen. We were seated at a table along the fountain in the center of the restaurant. They had floating lanterns and lotuses on the water.  Very nice place to bring a date!

oZIRJzwSubSzv_If41u-mA.text: Foods are great.  People are very friendly. Every time we go to Vegas this restaurant is always my first choice

LWQNAebsUBIDL9hVKH247A.text: My husband and I came here for our anniversary. We got a groupon before hand which made our experience even better since this place is more expensive than what we usually pay for dinner.   We had the chicken lettuce wraps and they came with a delicious peanut sauce. My husband ordered their most popular curry, according to the menu, and was very happy with it. It was amazing. I wish I had gotten it too! I got a chicken basil dish which was ok. The basil flavor was too strong for me and I couldn't finish.   We sat by the little water stream. It's a nice little touch. The restaurant is quiet considering it's located in a loud casino. It was good experience.

dYy9XR1drwyjgPVZiq3mgg.text: The best Thai food in Las Vegas! I was in Vegas for a week and came to this restaurant three times. The pad Thai is amazing! This dish was full of flavor. I definitely recommend this restaurant!!

ry_ocb75y38TPhC64mYbIg.text: Really good thai food! I had the seafood Rad Na and hubby had grilled chicken and chicken fried rice. Their portions are quite worth the price. Too bad I have to wait a year to try this place again!

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood Rad Na

D4vriBP7c7IpK_JtsTq2lA.text: Got a Groupon for this one and visited this place. We ordered coconut crusted shrimp and tup tim fritters in appetizers. Both the items were delicious and worth a try.   Island red curry and spicy thai herb fried rice were the main course. In both dishes the vegetables were cut in big pieces and had to chew hard to eat; though the taste was good. Next day i had upset stomach ...

r8O_Rn4jqcpWDT9CYNn8JA.text: Food was good but didn't knock my socks off. Wouldn't have eaten here had we not had a groupon. But service was good and ambiance/decor is beautiful.

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Slow night. Whole restaurant to ourselves

bJascmerPjaFJFiLPaXdQg.text: I got a table by the water it was great.  We both had the seafood salad. It was great. I loved all the different seafood and vegetables in it.  Mine was a little too spicy but that was my fault.  The service was very attentive.  We will go back.

VXZeERgKS3Duh-1ByblT7A.text: We had quite a good experience here! The ambiance is really lovely and perfect for a date. If you can, grab a table beside the fountain and throw a couple pennies in for luck.. how fun! Service was friendly and very efficient (we immediately had our drinks refilled without having to ask), and our food arrived quickly.   I personally really enjoyed the food. The highest praise I can give it is that it's better than your average NYC Thai food. The flavors were perfect and I love how specifically you can control the level of spiciness. I recommend medium, which was ideal for us since we enjoy spicy food but not when it's overwhelmingly hot. The red curry was outstanding, but I also kept dipping rice into my boyfriend's prik king, which was equally delicious.   My main gripe is with the cost. Firstly, the menu link hasn't been updated with the new prices. You should expect to pay somewhere between $22-$25 dollars for a typical curry, rice, or noodle dish. Sadly, this doesn't even include rice which is $3 extra for a small plate. The quality is obviously better than a cheaper Thai restaurant but it's hard to stomach how overpriced this is for noodles and rice. NYC Thai runs you $10 a dish on average! The portions of the entrees were decent and we left very full, so at least there's that. I would recommend this place if you're not concerned about sticker shock.

zBi4Aobq3BW7q2eKOR90VQ.text: Pho was not even hot.  How do you mess that up? Our meat could barely cook in it..    40 dollars for lukewarm pho and cheese ragoon???  Waste of money

YQSQRYHANIL0oRLtjzQ8xw.text: Overall, I would never go back to this restaurant again.  We ate with a party of 6 and for 6 entrees, two appetizers and a normally "cheap" bottle of wine, ended up spending $310.  The food was meager at best, and I would almost classify it as a rip-off. I ordered a caesar salad for an appetizer and it was lettuce, fried wontons and carrots. Nothing else.  10$ - and probably had $1.50 in ingredients. I ordered duck confit for my entree and I was not asked how I wanted it prepared and it came out well done, if not a little more so. Avoid at all cost.

43Fy_B3I9gtMvROSOZ_P7A.text: The food was excellent!! The service was fast! The ambiance is perfect!! Perfect date nite pick!!

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Drunken mans noodle

sGmJ4rk7yXftbdVIWxomSQ.text: The drinks were good, but that's all.  Food was mediocre and service was terrible.  Not worth the price tag.

5Vy7NdAJl_Dr73XHpm0c6w.text: Loved the Brooklyn location so was happy to see one here. Much more intimate than the original location but food was just as great as I remembered. This restaurant, like many in Sin City, was tucked in the back of a casino. I'm not a gambler, so no temptation there. Unfortunately you will have to contend with cigarette and cigar smoke on the way there, but inside the restaurant itself, no issue. Meal was great, servers were friendly and I thought the prices were reasonable.

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mango margarita

JBVhJi2vyFOyDag_ZcIb_Q.text: Not bad. Although the decorations portay tranquility, but the ambience is far from tranquil. Noise level is medium high. Not a fine dining. Food is meh... even the chef special. We have an okay experience except when a server talked while standing closely between me and my husband. His saliva spray onto our faces and to our drinks. We asked for another drinks. He brought the drinks and food and talked to us while holding them under his mouth....yuckkk .... Helpless... I didn't want to hurt his feeling by telling him but at the same time.... Yaiiikkksss....

qowwLzUPcjl71HEOU4avQg.text: I had really high hopes for this place. My boyfriend and I were in town and I wanted to have a nice dinner (reasonably priced of course). I found a travelzoo for this and we walked in about 9 pm. In Vegas, 9 pm is early. We were promptly seated and our waiter was attentive. They seemed to had just had a rush, I don't know, but good turned to not good. The waiter went on break and I almost thought they went to find a live chicken for our plate. It took that long. They then came and I had to remind them of our order. By the time the dishes got to our table, they were cold. We didn't even eat them. I felt bamboozled and I really would have liked a refund.   The thai coffee was nice and good. Other than that, I wouldn't recommend this place.

uyr-kihaWWypES6tVCJvQQ.text: Yelp's 365 Review Challenge 2015 #14 - #365  My family was craving for some Asian food and did not want to walk too far from the hotel. So we found the SEA Thai Restaurant just across from rj hotel elevators. I never heard of this restaurant in Bally's so I'm assuming it just recently opened. The wait was around 15-25 minutes and the inside looked full, so it must be that good. The decor was modern and also had a small fountain inside the restaurant.   I love love Thai food with their different uses of curry on their entrees and chicken barbecue. Lighting was pretty dim and I see they were going for an intimate setting. Flat screens were around the dining area and was Putin the Vevo channel with no sound. The food had taken about 30 - 45 minutes because it was so busy. Speaking of food, the chicken barbecue, curry beef, spicy rice and pad Thai were all a hit. It reminded me of the small Thai restaurant not too far from our place that serves good food. Our waitress forgot to fill up our waters and we were so thirsty after eating he spicy curry beef.   The prices were typical for a Vegas strip hotel at $$$. I wouldn't call this place fancy and I have eaten at fancy eateries in Vegas. I would rate SEA Thai in the middle. I prefer to go to China town for some cheap eats compared to eating in the strip.

wOzbkez8LpjbO9g6PQGCPA.text: Pretty bitchin seating area! Came here for lunch on our last day and it was delicious. My boyfriend had the geyser prawns and I had a peanut soy noodle. We both got appetizers to share, ginger calamari and chicken lettuce wraps. We also ordered a pitcher of green tea and it was some of the best green tea I've had. It tasted so fresh.

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States

x7oix1FGJeYCuROn0sN6Cg.text: Was craving Thai food but was too lazy to drive the 10 mins to real Thai off the strip. Ultimately regretted that decision and wondered why I didn't listen to the Yelp reviews, which are pretty much spot on in this case.   Overpriced menu offering mediocre Thai food in a glorified warehouse (maybe I'm exaggerating but that was the feeling I got). Ordered pad thai with prawns, green curry with duck, and something else so tasteless I have unremembered it altogether.   The service was very friendly, which counts for a lot, but probably wouldn't be enough to make me eat here again. Skip SEA and go to any off-strip Thai restaurant for the real deal. I've been to a few and they never disappoint!

2ayi6kNGWrWUmKh1f_89jg.text: Sea is the hidden gem of the Paris/Bally's compound. The stand outs at this restaurant are the entrees, the ambiance, and the staff.  We have tried many different appetizers here and have not found a favorite yet. That being said, we have tried the drunken noodle entree, the red curry, and the green curry. Each dish is absolutely delicious. The jasmine rice is the perfect amount of sticky and is always served in generous portions.  It is certainly not cheap, but it is essentially a fine dining Thai restaurant in Las Vegas, so that is to be expected. It's absolutely gorgeous inside and the hostess is the nicest person working in a Las Vegas restaurant.  Ask for Grace, you won't be disappointed.

jHEBub-kigAaHh0TqY9YIg.text: Good decor and decent Thai food. Saw it on Groupon and decided to try it out. The ambiance was similar to a miniature version of TAO, the Tom Tom seafood was spot on. Satay chicken skewer and fried calamari was sublime. Unfortunately my favorite dish pad se ew was under-seasoned and generally underwhelming. It overall a good dining experience.

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. SEA

w8WSnac3WfTET_3eX5jxYA.text: SEA is located in a far corner of the Ballys Casino.  Upon entering, the restaurant is uniquely decorated and had a calming and peaceful atmosphere, in contrast to the bright lights and noise of the casino.  I was seated at a table on the reflection pool which made for a nice backdrop.  The drunken man noodles were interesting with the combination of flavors and textures working well.  The crispy garlic prawn was full of taste and done very well.  The Panang curry was good as well.  I had it over sticky rice.  Overall, everything was pretty good with the drunken man noodles standing out for me.  Service was good as I never had to wait long for anything.  If you'd like a change from the normal Vegas buffet or need a change from all the fine steaks offered in Sin City, SEA would be a good choice.
