Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Reflection Pool Seating

od-f1ccS3TnS1k-L3YcDlg.text: Tasty noodles but a little pricey for lunch (even for the strip). Plus you can't buy alcohol at lunch, which is odd in general and crazy for Vegas!

uPnELQkoOQmdiBKlG4ITgQ.text: My favorite place to eat at Bally's. The staff is friendly and attention. The atmosphere is quiet and calming. Try the Crab Rangoons and Calamari - they are both delicious!

NHQ_sME4nNNm3-SYyGuMnQ.text: The sticky rice was undercooked and over price for amount that was served. The papaya was absolutely delicious however, it was tiny. It was filled with fillers instead of actually shredded papaya.

WLvpz5RkRP22ZShAYa-W1w.text: Like Jodie Z said..."the Thai experience you do not want"... For the price, this is not a good place to go. There are other Thai locations that advertise a "Thai" experience without the fusion that this place had. I asked for a Singha or a Tiger... nope... budweiser or Stella....? Not even a Heiniken... the food was subpar with what I've had at other Thai restaurants, not spicy enough, too much coconut, too much cream, small portions. . .   The waitress was nice, but it's not worth going again. I had other friends go back (not sure why) I think because it's in the casino and it's not gastropub or a burger.   I've noticed a trend in the reviews and who says yay and who says nay, and I am definitely part of the nay group.   Maybe next time...

mmgc4LsxS-yygvo22wGK5Q.text: Very good Thai vegetable stir fry's with choice of meets or tofu.  I picked the tofu since I am vegetarian.  Service was fast and very good flavors.  I also got hot tea, very good.  Very nice atmosphere but a bit noisy. (All of Las Vegas is a bit noisy)  Good four stars.

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uLMDI8OuCWwyWD4ktefcdA.text: Such a cute restaurant. I loved the walking Buddha over the small pool of water. We sat next to the Buddha. The appetizers are amazing. I highly recommend the seasons roll for appetizer and the calamari were also very yummy. Order your entree with shrimp and you can't go wrong

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cNuRbJgycurCiunZb6Ah9g.text: We came here for lunch with a group of 9 for a friend's bachelorette weekend because of a Groupon deal - 2 appetizers ($14) and 2 entrees ($25) for $47. This made the prices OK, but the original prices are definitely on the high end. The decor was nice with a pool inside, and the place was rather small and intimate.   We all enjoyed our appetizers and meals, but not the best Thai I've ever had. Crab rangoon was on the sweet side, dumplings were good, four season rolls were nice and fresh. The spice level varies depending on what you get. The pad Thai level 4 was pretty mild, while the spicy green curry level 4 was definitely on the way to a legit Thai hot level 5. The portion sizes are very generous and we all ended up taking leftovers home. I would recommend this place with the Groupon, but not without.

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab rangoons
Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy green curry with tofu and sticky rice
Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Four season roll

ZzW6S5tHYErYoZBDGbbxgw.text: Super cute place, great service but outrageously overpriced. Purchased a Groupon for $100 worth of food for 4. I understand prices are jacked up in Vegas (I paid $12 for a slice of pizza and a bottle of water...) but really $28 for shrimp drunken noodles?    We got in for a 6pm reservation and requested to sit by the water feature - the place is nicely decorated and has a very serene cool vibe. We started off with the pork taro eggrolls, papaya salad and chicken tom yum soup. Eggrolls were ok, papaya salad was fresh and crisp just enough heat and the soup was good. For dinner we ordered the shrimp drunken noodles, chicken pineapple fried rice and beef garlic veggie stir fry. All in all, food is ok but portions are small for the price you pay. I've paid $8 for pineapple fried rice at 1 1/2 times the portion I got here. Before Groupon, our entire meal cost $133 - just a tad it high for what you get.  If not for the Groupon, I'm not sure if I would come back. Flavors of food were just ok but nothing to rave about. Don't get me wrong, I didn't leave hungry but for what's charged, I'm expecting phenomenal. I do have to say what they lack in food to price ratio, they sure make up in service! Service was excellent : friendly, fast and efficient.

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken pineapple fried rice, beef garlic veggie stir fry and shrimp drunken noodles
Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggrolls
Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken tom yum soup

8GRwEHTsTqV_Z2y-pKH9rQ.text: Took me 4 days to figure this out.   I ended up going to multiple places for food and having to throw away what I could only partially eat.   Much better price/healthy options @the SEA than anything on the strip.   Brown rice + steamed veggies at $15.00 with much larger portion sizes than what you can get at Pan Express in the Bally's food court. I cheated and got an order of the coconut spring rolls and used the delicious lime dipping sauce for my steamed veggies.   Need a detox after 3 days of Rao's/Joe's/Morimoto's. Steamed veggies have no oil and no salt. Can add salt via the provided hot sauce. Reasonable price at $10. Couldn't finish the portion size.   They have Vietnamese menu in addition to a Thai menu. The vietnamese noodle soups aren't as salty as the Chinese Beef Noodle soups.   Thank You SEA for listening to customers and being reasonably priced so as to not being insulting. And thank you for not trying to trick me to maximize profit!!!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great spot for takeout

lFUih29ijvayq1qZyU5p5A.text: This was one of my favourite dining experiences of our Vegas vacation. Aw heck, one of my favourite dining experiences ever!  The ambiance and decor are spectacular. Hidden away off a corner of a busy, loud casino, this tranquil, calm, quiet oasis makes you feel as though you've stepped into another world. The still pond is lovely. The tables are comfortable. The entire place is lovely.   The service here is fantastic and attentive. We were seated immediately. Menu questions were answered thoughtfully. We were checked on regularly but unobtrusively. Everyone quietly ensured we had a wonderful experience.   The food?  Oh. My. God.   I didn't know that the curry we ordered was on CNNs top ten restaurant dishes anywhere til later, but yes, yes it deserved that distinction. Our table ordered a few dishes to share and everything we tried was simply phenomenal.   I cannot recommend this restaurant highly enough. A perfect experience start to finish.

9njpdt6_XdZImlDgf2N0tg.text: I was not impressed at all with the food here. I ordered crispy calamari a simple dish and at the price point of this restaurant I would expect a quality product. Half the pieces were so chewy they were almost inedible. The sauce was good and my husband enjoyed his soft shell crab and curry. There is a lot of great Asian food in Vegas so look elsewhere.

hJ-JlZPA4k9oiabMVdStEA.text: I bought a Groupon for this place and it had good reviews through Groupon.  It was just okay.  The service was very good and the appetizers were good, but the main dish just wasn't the best.  I ordered the cashew nut stir fry with tofu.  The dish was good, but the tofu was terrible.  It was dried out on the outside and really chewy.  I eat tofu often and have never had it come out like that.  My husband got the black noodle dish.  I tried some and didn't care for it at all.  We got coconut egg rolls and crab Rangoon for appetizers.  Those were good.  I'm glad we had a Groupon because the prices are very high which is to be expected in Vegas, but the food was just not up to par for me.

LS-f4gz4WT-FufdBthY6Kw.text: This is pedestrian Thai food that is Vegas expensive.   I wouldn't mind paying the high prices if it was great Thai food, which it is not.   Seriously, I've had better Thai food at shopping mall food courts.   But the worst part, and capper to our 1 star experience was when we got the bill there was a 20% 'Party Gratuity' added.  There were only 4 of us and a baby that didn't eat anything!   I've never heard of an added 'party gratuity' for only 4 people, usually its for larger parties of 8 or more in a group.  Pass on this place!

3gdUwb8oWc64fEw3cIgN1A.text: I loved this restaurant. It was a last minute choice simply based on walking by. Wow. Yes, it is pricey...this is Vegas, people. The interior is a welcome oasis of calm and serenity EXCEPT for the obnoxious music. But, this is Vegas and where is there not obnoxious and loud music?  The very friendly waitstaff gave us recommendation and they were right on.  I ordered a curry dish with a 4 level and it was perfectly hot (I think 5 is the max).  Food and service were excellent. Will definitely return.

S4w71sxQI4E4s_MymmYa0Q.text: Had a Groupon and it was worth it. We had a little extra for soup. The crab miso soup was very good we started with steamed dumplings and calamari as apps. Honey had sea food pot and I had broiled Salmon. Food was excellent and the atmosphere relaxing. The service was too notch. I recommend this Restruant if you are tired of the regular ones..

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lS3TCml33IKI6f5zRwyEZw.text: This is a great place on the strip to have a nice and quiet dinner. The food and service is great! The fam and I ordered the beef jerky, seafood soup, seafood salad, steak salad, shrimp fried rice, and some sticky rice. Everything was on point!. I just wish that the steak salad had a little more steak, cus last time we came like a year ago they gave the perfect portion so I don't know what happens but I still enjoyed everything. If you are in Vegas make sure to come try this place cus u won't regret it!

0QO6d4AfmHokzNb1sxkTLw.text: Overpriced and below average food. Thankfully we got the Groupon. Definitely not the best thai food at its price point (or a even at a lower price point). Look elsewhere for better.   Here's what my boyfriend and I had:  Appetizers:  These were actually pretty good but can probably get something similar/better in other places.  Tup Tim Fritters (4/5) Stuffed Crab Rangoons (4/5)  Entrees: Terrible, I ate like a tenth of my pad thai dish and my boyfriend, who will eat just about anything, couldn't finish his volcanic chicken.  Volcanic Chicken (1/5) Entire dish tasted like it was soaked in rubbing alcohol.  Chicken Pad Thai (1.5/5) Just not good. Too dry.  Ambiance: Great, beautiful restaurant. Sucks the food didn't match.  Service: Ok, server wasn't the friendliest.

REG-1EvP1FOqqMmHCBA8gw.text: Our second visit-still so consistent and amazing! We came here in 2015 and came back again today thanks to the groupon we had! The food was amazing back then and it's still amazing!  We are vegetarians and this place is one of the best Thai foods we have ever had.  1. They are open to customizing food for vegetarians(veggie broth, no fish oil etc.), which only very few places are able to do 2. The entree quantity and quality are on point 3. The service is amazing- all the servers are polite and quick 4. The ambience is great- simple and clean  Cons: The only down point is that if not for the groupon, the place might be a bit too overpriced.  Their website reports half the prices that are actually mentioned on the menu- seems to be some confusion there.  But will definitely come back if we get another deal/groupon ;)

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Interior

U7Q1UvsXSOtcTzQx_SRx8A.text: Nothing like the original SEA in Brooklyn, Ny.  Food was terrible.  Visited January 17th of this year with high expectations.  The only thing high was the prices, almost 3x that of SEA in New York.  Ordered the volcanic chicken, which is as simple as it gets; that was a disaster

j97DSYMPM5grrsEH7_5qoA.text: Delicious food. Pork rolls are amazing. Green curry dish with shrimp. Yum. I like it spicy. 5. Too hot for most people. Excellent service.

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp with green curry.

C-0uH4rGlTbFjRGPUcTDaQ.text: Was not impressed with the food. I barely ate any of the pad Thai. The crab rangoons were pretty good.. But I've had better at other restaurants. Certainly way over priced for the quality of the food.

-uP9_VGqD-K21ozNZwYhGA.text: Don't know why the haters hate. The food here was good, and the only thing to criticize is that the heat is a bit weak  Order hotter than you normally would.   Had the spicy basil chicken. Amazing. Opened with the original Tom Ka soup. Great flavor but ordered medium, it lacked heat.   It is relatively peaceful. Not by most standards, but certainly by Vegas standards.   Best compliment I can give it is that I'd eat there again.

_27chV7SCeCjz6z0h72LEQ.text: I went to SEA Thai with reservations. We arrived and all the tables were full. The Manager "O" said that all the tables that were seated had the same reservation time. I was told there would be a 20 to 30 min wait... We had show tickets.  Not only did he argue but he proceeded to insult myself and others in our party with sarcastic comments. Honestly, I have never experienced this level of disrespect and rudeness from any service provider and I have traveled all over the world. Don't  spend your money here. I won't be back.

pEZlVKr2w77m8VaXIRJJKQ.text: Great food, quick service, a little noisy for my taste.  We had Pad Thai and Pad See Yew, which were both done correctly.  Nothing particulary remarkable, but no surprises either.

hnIVxeNyOuVZSt9A9hxmfA.text: SEA is simply lovely. The decor is beautiful, simple, and peaceful. Staff members are attentive and gracious.  Unfortunately, all of this can't make up for the disappointing food. My dinner companion had the pad thai. I had the jungle curry. Both were some of the most lackluster Thai food we have ever had.   If you want to enjoy a peaceful place, SEA will do just fine. If you're looking for good food, I'd probably look elsewhere.

-wCBGQgOika32DWMujlU_Q.text: Omg love this place i came from California to eat here love service the staff is so friendly the price is right the food is excellent .. Best place in town

B1cTlPs_cdI5IBBaWqZOjg.text: Solid service in this hidden on the strip Thai place. Ambience and quiet are the highlights here. Food was pretty good. I chose the cashew chicken which didn't seem real spicy at level 5. I'll likely come back due to location and room noise isn't high which is rare on the strip. Lol.

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cool vibe in SEA.

jhlM3CsHErG2MKVq4DxgTA.text: Food was ok. Extremely pricey for what you get. We ordered curry and it does not come with rice which I've never experienced. Rice always comes with curry. They made us pay extra for rice. There was hardly any chicken in the fried rice and at $22 for fried rice you'd think they would add more than a few pieces of chicken. We had a party of 4 adults and they added 20% tip to the bill without giving us a choice or warning. When we asked them they just said that's the way the computer is. Really. The computers are smarter than you.... I feel completely cheated and robbed of good service, good food, and value for the money paid. $200 later and we will never return. Please beware. I'd go somewhere else and let them know that they are in poor practice of culinary experience and service.

Dtq8AWi6WoYdkXsOIAagew.text: One word: yes!  The entrees we ordered were perfect.  We also loved the decor. You really can't go wrong at this restaurant. Highly recommended.

aVlSyfdbghYdr3olIhrwhw.text: Well, yelp nailed this one: "meh" is right. After one too many dinners at a bar, I was craving some Thai, and SEA was close by and reasonably priced. The decor was beautiful, the ambiance was nice, and the glass of Riesling I had was perfect. It went downhill from there. (Speaking of the wine... There is no bar at SEA. So, if you order a drink, be prepared to wait until they fetch it from the abyss.)  We started with a shared appetizer of spring rolls, which tasted like... nothing. I mean, I guess it could have been worse and they tasted bad, right?  Next, our waiter. I got the distinct impression he was making fun of us, like we've ever eaten Thai before. Not cool, dude, not cool. My friend ordered a dish, but asked that, on a scale of 1 to 5 (with 5 being ridic hot), her meal was between a 2 and a 3. I asked for green curry, with a "4." Apparently, this was hilarious.   The meals finally come out, and.... my friend's dish has NO heat, and if my green curry was a "4" on the heat level, then that's just sad, y'all. I can't remember the last time there were peas and portobello mushrooms in a curry, but it didn't taste bad... Just sad.   Other than being affordable and pretty, I'd stay away if you're a real fan of Thai.

HKG3QE27C2R41ajspMWX5Q.text: Small little place inside Ballys.  So cute. The tables are designed next to the pond inside to give you an outside garden feel.  The food was fantastic.  The extra spicy is right on point.  Next time I will not need to order thai spicy as extra spicy for them is hot but you still get all the flavor without the burn.  Well without too much burn.  Will visit again for sure.

GmHRS4wyKJ0ZelUGfEmMEA.text: This is a chic Thai restaurant that has a really nice South Beach ambience.  The food is just ok and we've had better at smaller hole-in-the-wall places. I recommend asking for a table next to the water feature and the big Buddha.

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uYArl-11F3w8UhXCR43yXg.text: There weren't many dining choices in Bally's so we decided to try SEA. Ugh, not good.  Cheap wine is way over priced and the food was not very good. I ordered the Drunken Noodles with Chicken and it was bland and sloppy wet. My wife had a seafood bowl that was just as tasteless and looked more like soup than a noodle dish. And if you want rice, better order a bowl or you won't get it. For What it cost to eat here, I'm not impressed.

5GaSkbFRXospU3DvMT5WNg.text: I was so craving for thai foods one night in vegas. So i found this rest from yelp. Omg, foods were so tasty, friendly staffs and rest interior looked fancy too. But price of menu were expensive than you expected..i think compared to other rest in vegas, this prices were reasonable. I will go back if i had a chance again.

mRe1LhYKRdQX4rEw8mxIRg.text: I had the SEA noodles with the mixed fish. It was good. The noodles were well prepared, the fish were diced nicely. The sauce had a nice tangy flavor.  They have a nice drink selection.  The ambience of the restaurant is very nice. A fair amount of these restaurants on the strip are way too loud. This place was a nice get away from the noise of the slot machines.

2blaFdcXAsPqZf2mxBxwbg.text: An excellent, highly authentic Thai restaurant on the Strip. What a surprising treat. The Pad Thai and Pad Woon Sen were incredible.

F150o5dqxJitIqPvyxMM0w.text: One of the best Thai restaurants i have been in. The food quality was very good and the service has been excellent. The lady was very friendly and attentive, even to a group of 6 people. The lightning however, has been a bit too dim as some of us were struggling to properly read the menu. But despite that i would definitely recommend paying a visit to this place if you love Thai food.

6B0NFG9lDwLZ4y6fsxr_Yw.text: If you are In vegas and really craving some pho or Asian food it's going to cost you $18 for a bowl of pho. The good thing is that it is a large bowl and tasted pretty good! The way I see if you don't have a car to get to Chinatown then this will do!

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho

MpsryoQbHAq_g_TkIbgkAA.text: Came here for the first time and it was absolutely amazing! The restaurant has a very cool and relaxed vibe! The pond and the statue in the center are absolutely beautiful! Came here with my boyfriend, and we had one of the best dining experiences ever. Our server Jenny was so sweet and very helpful! The manager Anne was extremely attentive and very nice as well! Would highly recommend this to any thai food lover! Will definitely be coming back!

nNsClofozh0sY6YsVTJ7ug.text: When you are in the mood for Thai, not much affordable choices around the Strip.  The dreaded "resort pricing" applies to Sea: The Thai Experience.  A glance at the menu and you would have to pay around $22 or pad thai, curry, or fried rice dishes which should be half the price outside the strip.  I ordered the shrimp tom yum for $16 which is the best "deal" in the menu and it's alright, competently done but nothing close to pay an extra $5 or more for this dish.  I would only recommend this place if you got comps to use and don't have a car to drive out.

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp tom yum

qcgM0SlLTXuPtN8j14kLTQ.text: We stopped in for lunch and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves.  We were seated by a water feature with a Buddha statue.  I ordered a lovely jasmine tea along with vegetable spring rolls (with mint & cucumber) and my sister ordered lettuce wraps, then we shared the chicken pad Thai, which was probably the best I've ever had!  Great atmosphere, great food... where the waitress was slow the manager jumped in!   I will be dreaming of this Pad Thai for a long time to come!

joy-XjB-XhrAV5yyx9G73w.text: Oh my god. This is bad. They hardly speak English. The food tastes like somebody with no idea threw it together. But the highlight: they charge you a 20% Tip for their bad service. Hey! I'd like to choose how much I tip. They just take 20% from you! Didn't like the service? No problem they charge you 20%. Absolute scum! Stay away from This business! You have been Warned!

lxPD-wJiz_r7atQa57KcNA.text: First off... this place is absolutely gorgeous! I've seen it on Groupon forever and finally made it out to try it. It's hidden in the corner of Bally's little restaurant row. The music surprisingly had no Pacific Islander reference, but it wasn't over powering.    Our server Mutty engaged in fun conversation and gave us genuine recommendations. I decided to choose a cocktail out of my norm "Bee Gee's", and the honey taste was too strong for me and had to trade that in for the BLT cocktail which didn't disappoint at all!   On to the grub!  Crispy ginger calamari- lightly battered, served with a sweet cocktail sauce. Sauce threw me off, just a little too sweet like me  Crab Rangoon- served on a slice of cucumber. Cream cheese galore  Fritters- had and still have no idea what this is, lol, but it's served on skewers with sweet Thai chili sauce   Spicy basil shrimp fried rice- I licked the bowl clean, enough said  Malaysia curry- this won a reward from Food by CNN! So we had to try it! I also finished this clean! Doesn't come with rice, maybe it's served a la cart.   The serving sizes are small for the price, but tasty to say the least. I'd like to try a few more things on the menu next time. I'll make sure I have a Groupon for that too!

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States

oM8410ZHQuopra7u_GWiJQ.text: So glad we found this. Staying at New York New York and was craving something zen and Asian.  Yelp saved the day to decipher through all the best places around. 20 minute walk on the strip to Bally's with a little help from AppleWatch and opentable. Wasn't very busy which scared me.  Not to worry it was AMAZING.   We started with fritters!  Best ever.  Nice crispy dumplings on a slew with some sweet Thai sauce. For dinner we had pad Thai and Panang Curry.  Both great. Come with an appetite.  Hope this helps get through all the hundreds of great places in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum

XAhHNmOrnx3csfvPyGlPTQ.text: Amazing food and service!!!  I had pad Thai,  crab rangoon, and steamed dumpling.   Shut up I didn't eat it all by myself!  It was delicious.  That's the only word to describe the food.   Quality and bursting with flavor.  Go go go go

KReO37YDhOOOzx8yKNgHnA.text: Omg I love Thai food.. this place was so yummmyy.. It's dark and quiet and very nice date place.. the service was good.. food was fast..

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jXBhFV7EMSTVvfEinaWERg.text: Went here w/my wife on a recommendation from a friend. Fantastic Thai restaurant. I loved the little coy pond in the middle. I didn't even know my main course was soup-style, but it was very good. Perfect mix of everything I love: Shrimp, mussels, octopus, so good. Perfect Thai Iced Tea too. Would definitely go back.

c4ia9RcG3ORAecMwVCDRJA.text: Our experience with the food was very good but we didn't like their hospitality, staffs were least concerned about taking orders. After waiting for long we got seat somewhere at the corner and after 20mins food arrived but there was no plate and spoon for serving. We literally had to ask three staffs for providing those. We didn't feel to order anything else even though we wanted to...

CBc6fklO1v3EVoTZZW2A0g.text: During a recent trip to Las Vegas, my friends and I purchased a Groupon deal for SEA and I must say that discounts like that are the way to go when dining on the strip due to the horrific prices. I really do like Thai food quite a bit, but at the time I wasn't sure that would be my first choice for a Vegas weekend as there are so many great cuisines in the city, but SEA far exceeded my expectations. One of the girls and I decided to split a Pad See Ew plate because we never finish a full order anywhere else and knew that we would not be eating leftovers that weekend. We ultimately decided on beef at the suggestion of our waitress and she did not steer us wrong. The beef was so tender that it all but melted in my mouth and the noodles had just the right amount of soy sauce flavor. The bok choy were wonderfully cooked as well, though I do prefer it when there are other veggies as well. I will say that this was the smallest portion of Pad See Ew I've ever received (and the most pricey), so that part was a little disappointing since I was sharing with someone.   The service was wonderful, but did slow down a bit towards the end of our meal. One of my friends ordered a Thai Iced Tea not realizing that it is made with cream. She is lactose intolerant and our waitress had no issue substituting the already prepared Thai Iced Tea for a regular Iced Tea and that was much appreciated.   The ambiance was very cozy with a little darker lighting, which would make for a wonderful date night dinner on the strip. It did get crowded toward the end of our meal, but our 7:30PM reservation came with a more calm atmosphere.   Overall, I'd highly recommend SEA, but try to get the Groupon deal!

KPYiL3lX6ewRcmp8UU0nPg.text: My meal here exceeded any Thai dish I've ordered anywhere else... ever.   I came here with a group, and after making a reservation for 7:30, we learned we could have gotten away without one. It was fairly empty at 7:30 and didn't start picking up until about the time we were leaving.   It seemed appropriate to order the Drunken Man's Noodle (Pad See Maow) with vegetables and it was absolutely heavenly. Everyone at the table tried some and really loved it. The basil in the sauce is just perfectly balanced.  Ambiance was dark and upscale. This would make a perfect couples/date spot. Service was great - a little slow once we got to the end of our meal, but overall very good. I hope to one day find a Drunken Man's Noodle that compares to this one.

Ti5C-EBUcdNXt3p4NewQAg.text: SEA had a Groupon that brought us in to visit.  I didn't expect much but was pleasantly surprised.  Service was fast and friendly.  Most of the food was very good.  The only exception being the Chicken Satay, I would recommend passing on that.  Ordered: Chicken Satay Vegetable Spring Rolls Chicken Fried Fries (4 out of 5 Spicy) Shrimp Pad Thai  Overall: I had low expectations visiting and was very pleased with the food and our experience.  Decor is great and the Thai food is the best Asian food I've had on the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Fried Rice
Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Pad Thai
Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegetable Spring Rolls

ZRSP5g_0v_4Vi3wSvnPO7w.text: For a restaurant in Vegas, I was expecting something more over the top.  If this were anywhere else I'm sure I'd have different thoughts, but in the city that never sleeps, this seemed as ordinary as any "Best Thai" in the suburbs.  Alright, the prices are still very Vegas.  My almost $20 pad see ew tasted like many others I have had except it was covered in baby bok choy and adorned with a lemon wedge.  The level 4 spice was more of a three and I was in insane eating beast mode to even really care.  I probably would have never seen this place because it is in the back corner of the casino.  If it were instead some kind of Thai Las Vegas buffet, then it would definitely be worth the trip inside Bally's.  Since it's as ordinary as takeout, I suggest you spend your penny slot winnings at a place you can really gorge at.  It was good, but not Vegas good.

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pad See Ew

pgz1WXoQizR01gn7iNvMiQ.text: the ambiance & service & food. Modern decor with a beautiful central pond  & floating dollars on lily pads ! Made a wish & left a buck ! The CALAMARI was perfect. Crispy, not too dry & seasoned well with a lovely sauce. I've never had COCONUT SOUP with such huge TOFU chunks ! Perfect ! partied so much & ate so much fried food it was nice to have a plate full of veggies and shrimp!  I'll definitely go back. Thanks Vegas for a great Thai fix! One of my fave food genres !

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Cr_2UFQcgP0JZsWjKjv9uA.text: Just okay.  Very okay.  The thing that makes me question this place is the fact that their pad thai was marginal.  What kind of thai restaurant messes up a signature dish like that?!  Aside from the pad thai, the best thing I ate was the Malay curry.  It was not too spicy, and full of flavor.  Of course, I would be happy with pretty much any curry - but after trying their lack-luster pad thai, this was great in comparison.  We ordered it with tofu, which was a great decision in my opinion.  Tofu and curry are a perfect combo!  Make sure to order a side of rice with this though - it doesn't come with like you may expect.  The calamari was okay - nothing to brag about.  Same goes for the chicken lettuce wraps - they were not that great.  Really not that great.  I usually would eat 2 of these, but I had to force myself to finish one.  Don't order them, especially if you've ever tried PF Changs (which are 10x better, sadly).  The service was good, and the ambiance was the main redeeming quality.  It's a romantic setting, with modern, clean decor.  We were a very large party (around 15) and had our own private room with a TV.  Waiters and waitresses were quick to bring our food and clear the table.  I would definitely not come back here if I were in Vegas, there are so many other better restaurants to check out.

cZgkoeyidz4JyDb6SoV9yg.text: Just want to start off by saying that my dad is Vietnamese and a chef so I grew up in kitchens and the love and appreciation of food was instilled in me at a very young age.   I ordered the chicken malay massaman curry and it was PERFECT, that alone deserves 5 stars. It was so good I asked the waiter to give my compliments to chef, so if your looking for curry this place will not disappoint. Me and my girlfriend shared an order of 4 egg rolls and they were tasty, they however come with a small amount of sauce for dipping. My girl ordered the chicken classic teriyaki which she really liked, I tried it and it tasted ok. Just as a heads up none of the dishes come with sides so we both had to add sides of white steamed rice. For some reason the prices from their online menu don't seem to match the actual prices from what I can remember seeing in the restaurant.   The vibe of the restaurant was really nice, it was tucked away in a corner of the Paris Las Vegas Casino so it was away from most of the crowd. There's also some seating in the middle that surrounds a water pond with water lilies and a beautiful statue of Buddha. We were sat away from this and when asked if we could sit by the water they moved us with no hesitation.

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VXZmW5Q0nr5nwRJPQuBb1A.text: A great dining experience!  A girlfriend and I dined here after finding a Groupon for the restaurant that included two appetizers and two entrees for a reasonable price.  The atmosphere of the restaurant is very zen; it is not a huge space, so I would definitely recommend making a reservation.  We had made a reservation using Open Table, and once we arrived we were seated very quickly.    Service was great.  I seem to always base service on how quickly my water glass is refilled throughout the meal--because I drink a lot of water!--and my glass definitely stayed filled.  Our waitress was very nice and friendly, as well as the other staff was very helpful as well.    We both ordered the pad Thai for our main entree and the chicken lettuce wraps and coconut spring rolls for appetizers.  Everything was delicious!  The portions were very reasonable (if not too much), and the tastes of everything was great.  I would definitely recommend everything we ordered to anyone!    Price for the restaurant seemed kind of steep, but for a nice restaurant in Vegas and the amount of food given, it's actually pretty reasonable.  Make sure to look on Groupon to see if they still have a special.  Next time I am in town I will definitely be going back to SEA, whether there is a Groupon or not!

zcKfGhJLcw9liKPGr_ycLQ.text: Amazing food and atmosphere and very accommodating to vegans! Would definitely visit again!

za77FTXZAIIS_lZw61LLsA.text: There are a ton of okay restaurants on the Strip but this place is definitely a hidden gem in the back of Bally's. When you walk in most of the tables are around this fountain/small pond in the center of the restaurant that gives a laid back vibe.   The food is excellent, with the spring rolls having more flavor than most with some lemongrass and weren't greasy at all. The Panang curry with beef was likewise top notch with lots of meat and string beans in a sauce that has some spice but isn't burning a hole in your tongue.  The service is very friendly and fast here and it wasn't too packed on a weekday night but I made online reservations since I wasn't sure.

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Panang Curry
Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spring rolls

yVX5f7367r0eewb7rThkjA.text: Despite not being super popular, the food was superb. The red curry was so good we ordered a second one! I also really liked sitting next to the water fountain.

O5R4hiUMT91PO5mkO_-VOg.text: Average thai food at an expensive price. The decor and ambience of the restaurant was the most appealing part of our experience here. We ordered the grilled chopped chicken lettuce wrap for appetizer, which was average in taste. We then ordered the volcano chicken for the entree. According to description on the menu, the dish is supposed to made using spicy sauce, however the dish was sweet! We couldn't taste the spice at all! It was so difficult to eat sweet, bland chicken. Overall a disappointing experience and a big hole in my wallet.

QH2I2jxvVOWDJkygrt6WUw.text: It's located in Bally's.  We ordered take out Sunday afternoon Sept. 7.   Crab rice- was 3.5/5  okay to good.  Tom yum soup-  solid flavor. Seafood noodle soup- spicy. Not very much noodles provided.  Mango sticky rice- good.  Total $73  You can only get away with this kind of overpricing in Vegas.  Many Thai restaurants elsewhere would have much lower prices for exact same items. The restaurant was empty when we pickup the food.   Negative- for take out, they put the soups in plastic cylinder containers. It's fine for the tom yum soup but for the noodle soup, it doesn't work very well. They provide the noodles in a separate SQUARE  styrofoam container.   You can't throw in the noodles with the soup container because it would be really awkward to eat the noodle soup out of. I had to pour the soup into the square container for the noodles which was a bad noodle eating experience. For a place that charges $20 for noodle soup, you would think they understand from a consumer perspective of the logistics of eating the noodle soup. They don't.  Most places have bowl containers so you can put the noodles into the soup and have a proper noodle eating experience. Such containers can be bought bulk with a price of .20 cents a bowl. Maybe they have little experience with take out food and the eating experience with it.   Asian noodle soups tend to be around $8-12, for vegas pricing I'd accept $10-15. NOT $18-20.  Crab rice was $26--crab is not that luxury of an item in vegas so very over priced. Should be about $18.   Overall, really over price for what you are eating. Food is ok. You can get a much better food experience for the same price points at other places. I'll predict they wont survive here. The price point is not in sync with Bally's price point demographic and it would be silly for people from other casinos to come eat there.   Will not eat there again unless it was free or they lower their prices to a normal level.

2v5B6tHyzwzhvjwt65RpyQ.text: Food is absolutely delicious but the price you pay is a little silly. I got curry and had to pay extra ($6!) for the rice...was I going to eat it like soup?! The service isn't very friendly either, but the ambiance is romantic and soothing. It's a 50/50, but we'll never got there again.

h-nT3EAu99dZ9O5Agr_uCg.text: This place turned us on to Thai food. Thank you. Once you have tried Thai you will nevet go back to Chinese!

k4ZZ0cS1sIEOvqxb8bcDqQ.text: Amazing food the prawns where so fresh and delicious and the atmosphere was beautiful. My mouth is watering thinking of the dinner we had! Would recommend to anyone visiting vegas

LYdvRThmjzByPOu2r5CDoA.text: Disgraceful service, then they expected a tip after woulds? No choice for vegetarians, come to the 21st century and upgrade your menu.

1ARqhYs4M1Ci8dZX7rOfDQ.text: Great little restaurant tucked away behind the scenes.  The space is on the smaller side for Vegas, which made it nice & quiet.  A little oasis from the lights & noise.  The food was amazing Thai food!  We were able to order & make changes as needed to accommodate my Gluten-Free friends!

mofAy-X7uUnyg8J6Ho3VCg.text: one word: Soba.   I don't eat Thai often but the last time I went to a Thai joint and asked for my dish to be really spicy, it was hardly that. At Sea, I ordered the soba noodles with beef and asked for it to come as spicy as possible and that's exactly what I got! I was so pleased.  Usually restaurants' version of spicy is pretty watered down but I left here with my lips burning 30 mins later! I love to feel the burn, ergo, I'm in love with this place. It was an orgiastic experience for my taste buds. The Thai iced tea was good as well as whatever my beau had. No time for dessert :'(   Also, there was a guy there, the owner or manager (I'm unsure), that was very attentive and polite while I waited for my beau to arrive. The ambience is pleasant and seductive, dim lighting and interesting Thai inspired decor. I really hope I have time to come here again when I return to Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vhOJLW0i8cijB_1_Uv1vmg.text: This place is lovely. The food was wonderful too. Whatever crispy walnut shrimp appetizer we had was amazing. I ordered the spicy bbq chicken- they freaking lit it on fire in front of me!! It was so tender, I can't order thai bbq chicken anymore, it just can't compare.

6bBGpulsZMeKffLkEdwoZw.text: Great service! Great Thai food! They even had mango sticky rice and I hadn't been able to find it at any Thai restaurant since falling in love in with the dessert in Thailand and returning home. The server recommended the Green Curry with Soba noodles and egg. WOW! it was amazing, not on the menu but happy to create a new experience for me. We will definitely go back.

JtQLcuGHHr30vTQjBVodpQ.text: Slow, slow, slow service. Sit down ahead of someone else and they get served before you???? Really? 40 minute+ wait for rice and beef? That's a no go!!!

YW1hoeRidOEZ5LRKji8ElA.text: First, I have to say that I don't understand how a restaurant located inside a casino on the Strip could be so quiet.  My husband and I made reservations for 7p, but there was no need for them - we were immediately sat at a table, one of many that were open.  This place is a hidden gem to be sure!  I tried one of the Vietnamese rice noodle dishes.  Not knowing exactly what it was I had ordered, I was pleasantly surprised with a cold noodle "salad" (I was anticipating a hot dish).  My husband ordered the pad thai and chicken satae (his Thai standards) both were on par with our favorite So.Cal Thai place, so we were very pleased.

TQe2I9hlf2XSvEaUxyAOWA.text: I ordered the Phone.  As a Canadian I am appalled by how much cilantro and mint they add to the vietnamese food in the US. I dislike both. It wasn't stated on the menu so the first time my meal came out , I had to send it back. When it came out correct it was good. Not the best I've had though.  The service was okay as well.

AiqiqHepFewpXqEdDA5zWA.text: Excellent and attentive service. My husband and I both had the Shrimp Pad Thai for lunch. He liked his and thought it had great flavor, but I didn't feel the same and I can't pin point why. I love Thai dishes and went with a basic but felt it wasn't fresh in flavor.

dWgk-ZkpBDnbiZP1wWMgmw.text: We come here every time we are in Las Vegas. It is somewhat hidden in the back of Bally's casino but it's a gem. The Thai iced coffee is the best I've ever had (you can even get it for dessert as a float!). Other must-haves are the Caesar salad and the drunken noodles.

i6COwdcctrVohVmHl_Q4-A.text: Considering this is a "high-end" thai restaurant, and I actually enjoyed the food, this place deserved 4 stars. Why did I take 1 star off? Because it tasted like a hole in the wall [to yelper's standards] 5 star restaurant back home at L.A.'s thai town, just fancied up a little. The food was excellent, though, but for the prices were a bit high. Why still the 4 star rating? We came here on New year's eve night. Many of the nicer restaurants had prix fixe menus from $75 up and it was hard to find a nice place without one. I for one am not a fan of prix fixe menus. So we made a reservation here for 8:00 and didn't get seated until 8:30. That was annoying because we even split up our party of 14 just so we can get seated quicker. That clearly didn't work. They have to work on that if you ask me.  The restaurant is dark, and very, very busy. They also don't have a restroom so you'd have to go to the casino floor to use one. It's nicely decorated, but I've eaten at Tao at the Venetian, which is much nicer, and similar in pricing. They also give you chopsticks... uh, they don't use chopsticks in thailand, they use a spoon and a fork. You'd think a restaurant full of Thai workers would know better.  We ordered the phad thai, pineapple fried rice, pad see ew, and bbq pork chop entree. The 4 of us split it and it was all very good. Like I said, it tasted like it does at a popular authentic thai restaurant in l.a., but for twice as much. The service was slow at times, but it was new year's eve and it was a packed house. We always had plenty of water, and the waitress was good about checking on us, but she wasn't spectacular. She did bring my sister's request of chili paste and chili powder really quickly, which was nice.  I wouldn't come back here because I'm sure there's a thai restaurant somewhere off the beaten path in vegas which can make food just as good, and for lower prices. BUT i did have a great experience and was happy with everything we ate.

qyWA26pVQIDxRMJLxnxTfA.text: I stayed at MGM and according to my YELP iPhone app, this was the closest place for pho. I needed it to cure my hangover so we went.   Service: Our server was really friendly. There was one issue: he didn't speak English well. Whenever we asked for something, we had to try to say it again with our hands by pointing to things, making motions, etc. I'm not sure if we were just too much to handle, but I truly think he just didn't understand. At least understand the simple stuff, like red pepper or extra silverware.   Food: It was aiiight. Definitely not the best pho I ever had. That's okay, that really wasn't the issue. My problem was their lack of condiments. I love having everything in my pho, like all that Asian stuff! Siracha, hoisin sauce, chili pepper, etc. They just didn't really have that at our tables and when asked, our server was clueless. Unfortunately, my pho ended up pretty bland. Maybe this is because this is a Thai restaurant. But please don't charge me $12 for a freaking bowl of pho if you can't perfect it.   If I ever come back here it wouldn't be for pho. Maybe next time I want pad thai or something I'll try it out again, but that's pretty doubtful.

wQnIT4go7XBRXu-FxX9XjA.text: The service was good but their food wasn't. I had the duck dish and it tasted really rubbery and dry.  My husband had the seafood combo and it also tasted rubbery. We both ended up feeling sick the next day.

nnceAvptzeB7Hjpvse83iA.text: The best Thai restaurant I have dined in.  Our table shared the Crab rangoon, spring rolls, calamari and pad thai.  Everything was perfect.

EzG0KUbog4V1mmh2IfJheA.text: I don't know what was wrong 40 minutes waiting after we order and food never came, and waitress did not show up again neither. Of course we leave.

lOgJx_eBnO4qiIqeS8R8Hg.text: So good! We were in the mood for Thai and it was within walking distance so we went. The service and all staff were excellent! Very sweet and helpful and attentive. And the food was fresh and delicious and the portions were generous. Recommend!!

4miGGPun2L-Pn0TSGqIf6A.text: So good.  Perfect atmosphere and very authentic.  We had Pho and curry dishes.   Thank you for the great meal.

nWMe-SLfZZxcPGrOC4wEcw.text: I had a Groupon for this restaurant so we went to a show then came for dinner. It's sort of difficult to find-so look for BLT and it's to the left. Nice atmosphere and upscale unique decor. Warm entrance with candles lit against the wall and the maitre' de at the door was friendly and we were @30 min early for my reservation but he said no problem. He asked if we wanted to sit by the water so we did. Beautiful art/Buddha with lotus flowers I think floating..cool original wooden seating mainly for two ppl. But I did see a few ppl squeezed into one. He only reason I didn't give 5 stars is bc you will hurt your butt and back sitting there for too long wish they'd give you a soft pillow to sit on. Our waitress was extremely friendly and alert. Waters were always filled and service was excellent which is a huge thing to me. The food was good-It's just hard to decipher what dishes are what without photos lol. I guessed and asked her what size noodles were what but having more photos would be so helpful! I will bring more people back soon it's a nice romantic restaurant.

Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. If ur butt and back can handle it ask for the seating by the water.
Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful view of the Buddha and water fountain/wishing well.

1w2Tdo3vjnQjSlHOupDrGQ.text: I had the honey walnut fried rice and basil stir fried tofu. My boyfriend ordered and app, the papaya salad and I found a 2 entree 2 app deal for 49$ on  Groupon... a yelper mentioned it! I scrolled thru Groupon, purchased the deal, ordered another app and saved money on my meal. Thanks yelp!   The food was delicious and the dessert equally amazing. So happy they honored the deal!

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thai iced tea

dkE8o89kfiQERuKySfy5NA.text: I happened to fall into this restaurant just because I was walking by and Thai food sounded AMAZING.  I can't say enough about the great environment, amazing wait staff, and the manager/owner checking to make sure I was happy.  The food was sincerely the best curry I have had in a Thai restaurant.    Honestly, I read the reviews and people complained about prices of this restaurant.  Seriously?  You're on the strip in Las Vegas....  even Starbucks costs twice as much.    Forget about your wallet as soon as you set your eyes on the glitz and glamour of the strip.  I guarantee you'll lose more in gambling.  This restaurant may price gouge a bit but you walk away with a full tummy of great food, amazing service, and a smile

0SQdruZkkmaatFaLfwjOyg.text: I really enjoyed the food. I just think for $25.+, for pad thai, chow funn noodles as well as the green, yellow, etc. curries, they give such small portions for this price. We got the groupon deal so thankfully we didn't have to pay those pricing. The service itself was GREAT! They made sure our waters and soda wasn't empty. My husband got beef chow funn and the appetizer beef on screwers which tasted so yummy! I got the Malay massaman roasted duck curry (meh, I'll stick to my green curry) and I asked the server "is it spicy" for everything that I ordered since I can't handle ANY spice. He said my curry is the least spiciest and I won't notice any heat. Well, it's my fault to think that a Thai curry could have no spice to it bc my husband who LOVES spicy food said it was too spicy for him. I also got the spring egg rolls which was super good! So, I knocked off 1 star bc the food was too spicy and another bc the pricing doesn't match the  portion size.

WNv3PvcCf6BOlsaDT3Dg3Q.text: Good place to go when really hungry as portions were large and food service was quick!  The dining room was modern, clean, and somewhat peaceful.  I have had much better Thai food before, but I have nothing in particular to say positive or negative about the quality of the ingredients.  It's overall just okay.

uX07smVXXoBDG0XMNzOG_A.text: This is a pretty cool place. The atmosphere is accented with low lighting, and an eclectic mix of down tempo cool chill music that somehow works.   I had the Pineapple Fried Rice with Chicken and it was awesome! Very large portion which could easily serve two. And the Thai Tea was delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Z2RcVnxOTnjgLF6htKixDw.text: I heard of this venue from groupon, for which I purchased a 41$ voucher for two appetizers and two entrees for 2 people.   This thai restaurant was located in the Bally hotel and casino- somewhat really hard to find. We got there pretty late @ around 10 pm, but the staff was very accomodating and still took out order even though they were near closing time. Since we came in late, we ordered our entrees to go. However, the decor was breathtaking with a man made pond sitting in the middle of the restaurant with Thai statues.   Food: we started with appetizers:  Po-pia sod (2/5) fresh vegetarian roll wrapped in rice paper served in pieces and a chilli dipping sauce - I didn't find anything out of the ordinary for this dish -very typical flavours; Stuffed crab Rangoon (2/5)- crab and cream cheese filled fried Wonton- I really didn't enjoy the cream cheese, it didn't compliment well with the crab. Our main entrees: (these entrees were not served with rice which you had to order separately) Seafood combo (2/5)-shrimp, scallop, Tilapia curry- I found the scallops were not well cooked and seasoning was lacking. This was one of the more expensive items on the menu that was recommended by the waitress- I didn't enjoy it at all. Tofu Pad Thai (3/5)-came with flat noodles, raw mango strips and cooked red peppers. I liked that this dish came with noodles. Mango was a fresh touch to the dish in combination with the red peppers.  Thoughts: I thought the groupon was great for the quantity of food we got and in presentation but in terms of the food quality, I expected better. Average restaurant on the strip!

WOp-FVmcpeI9QDJ7KjR86A.text: Great food and was able to make a reservation but awful service. Our waiter couldn't take multiple orders at one time and it took forever to get our checks. Then he couldn't figure out how to split the checks so made us number them on the check and some things were still wrong. He also took a long time to come back for our checks so we had to flag down another waiter.

kfqOmCHl7HeEdYR2Af5V4g.text: Me and my friend were staying in Bally's and decided to come here for some late dinner. They have quite a good number of vegetarian options. We had spicy Thai herb fried rice and Penang curry with Jasmine rice. The flavors were amazing and the spice levels done just right. Ambience and lighting was very calming. Our waitress was super friendly and patient with us.

V2hBA9fZfc0VmmzRS6cxHQ.text: I am surprised this place only averages 3.5 stars. I have a theory that if order something like Pad Thai at a Thai restaurant, you are not giving the chef an opportunity to shine. My partner, Andre, spotted "Malay Massama Curry" on the menu with a description "CNN says this dish is one of their top 10 in the world." We had to try it. The menu gives you the option of having it with chicken, beef, shrimp or with an extra $7, we can elect prawns or roasted duck. Go with the roasted duck.  After a sweat-inducing walk to get there, we started by getting coconut water. This arrives as a whole coconut with a large hole for a straw or spoon. I was instantly hydrated and refreshed. I drank it throughout the meal.  The Malay Massama Curry was truly exquisite. We got ours with brown rice. Based on my culinary experiences, this dish rates in my top ten. Was it a great recipe and great execution? Definitely yes!

bDkeMI0Gh8JrTq97SGKnYQ.text: Oh my!!! The atmosphere is calm, colorful and plays fabulously with the cuisine and servers. The GLUTEN FREE choices are plentiful. I enjoyed the spring rolls then shrimp curry... wow! I highly recommend this restaurant.

CMyuzkQ0tJRpHBX4lou7Kw.text: best thai food I had in vegas. I went to eat by myself since I am came to vegas to work. I was staying at the linq and was craving thai food. this place is real authentic thai food. a bit expensive because its in vegas but worth coming back. I got a thai tea, pad thai and for dessert I got the mango and sticky rice and OMG that was soooo good.

kt7KruecEbSMy1_PNuo2oQ.text: Found this place via a Groupon. Located in Bally's Casino. Nice relaxing atmosphere. Food was very good. Nice size portions. We got the crab rangoon and calamari for appetizers. Both were delicious. I had the Thai fried rice with chicken which was very filling. My husband had a rice dish that was also very good.

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thai fried rice
Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab Rangoon and Calamari

thHDW2EvBflxcEJeOEzIww.text: Had  friends from Los Angeles (one of them happens to be Thai)  who stayed at Bally's over the weekend to watch Celine Dion across the street.  The name of the restaurant enticed them to try SEA instead of my personal favorite:  the ever unassuming and always under the radar:   Pon Ocha on Nellis Blvd.      I'll make it short and direct.  Having and eating Thai food here is akin to  craving Mexican food and going to Taco Bell and calling it Mexican Food!,   or to Olive Garden and calling theirs Italian, or to PF Chang's Chinese  Not only they're overpriced but the portions were "kid value meal"-ish.   Here, you'll be paying extra for the "after the fact"  realization that you made a huge miserable dining mistake and paying too much for an experience you wished you never had.

_VF0YsHbmlaHrR3yQEY93Q.text: We had a Groupon for two appetizers and two entrees, and made a reservation for the evening.  It was pretty busy when we got there.  They had a cute set-up inside.  We sat at wooden bench-like seats that were next to a little water area with floating flowers.  For the appetizers, we got the Chicken Lettuce Wrap and the Fried Soft Shell Crab, which was on a special menu, and that soft shell crab was amazing!  For the entrees, we ordered the Sticky Lemongrass Chicken and the Holy Basil Seafood Combo.  They were both delicious, and you can taste the great quality of the food.  Nice presentation and service was wonderful.

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy Thai Herb Fried Rice
Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pad Thai
Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Honey Walnut Prawns

G9YlD2hxI6ZramIqIaCdfQ.text: Absolutely amazing flavor. Excellent friendly staff. Just a delightful experience. Just had the massaman curry and green curry. Both were taste treats and large portions plentiful with the protein of choice. Would highly recommend this restaurant. Atmosphere is peaceful and beautiful in the middle of Las Vegas mayhem.

1-nacc1i9HHoP1Tmt8VNCg.text: I love Thai food and jumped at the opportunity to try a new Thai restaurant on the Strip when I saw it pop up on Groupon. Plus, who doesn't want to save a few bucks in Vegas whenever you can. The Groupon took about 40% off the regular price and gave us $100 to spend on four or more people. We ended up having five people and, of course given Vegas prices, had no problem reaching and exceeding that amount. In fact, my friend and I decided to share our plate of pad see ew to avoid leftovers and the five of us still hit $150 with four entrees, four drinks and a beer.  Of course, this happened to be the smallest portion of pad see ew that I've ever seen in all of my Thai eating days. Every other time I end up with enough leftover for at least one, if not two more meals, but this time I probably could have finished the whole plate. Aside from the size, the rest of the dish was perfect. Our waitress advised us to try the beef over the chicken and it was very tender and delicious. There was a perfect sauce to noodle ratio and I was very happy with the flavor. I don't care for Chinese broccoli but I liked that it was stacked on top of the dish instead of mixed in and my dining partner volunteered to eat the greens. At $22, I wouldn't say this dish is worth the price but it was tasty. My friends ordered a couple fried rices and the drunken noodles. It seemed like the fried rice dishes had the largest quantity of food.  As always, I loved my Thai iced tea, which was a bit pricier than usual at $5 but in line with Vegas prices.  The restaurant is small but has a nice vibe. It was relaxing until a very loud person was sat at the table next to us. Apparently, noise carries very well in here.   Service was good at first but then our waitress seemed to disappear after she dropped the check off. We were in a hurry so it was a bit annoying that it took her so long to return to get the payment. We had to rush back to our hotel to get ready for our evening plans.

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pad See Ew with Beef

uF4uDoDA15Z4gb25Q0snng.text: The food here is phenomenal! Excellent salmon And duck curry! If you want to test your slice tolerance this is the place to do it! The interior design of this place is just breath

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gg7mzQ4VvC6y85AvgHB0OA.text: Beautiful place! Great service! The award winning curry dish is the best we ever ate.

v4yVDhJRgfrcwOyX3HF4kw.text: Loved my experience at the Thai experience ! :) This was my last meal before heading out of Vegas and it was fab. Lip smacking spicy food, beautiful ambience and absolutely friendly service.  Thumbs up: pretty much everything we ordered :-D Thai iced tea (believe me there are tons of places that mess up something as simple as Thai ice tea), jungle chicken, Thai Basil fried rice.  The pad thai was a little below my expectation.  I was missing a hint of flavor. To all the Thai food craving gang you got to visit this place!

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XkLYTJ6MqnbvIXGGYWHRdQ.text: We just ate at this hidden gem yesterday, and it was awesome. We will definitely go again. For appetizers, we ordered the chicken satay, and a crispy shrimp with walnuts. Both tasted very good and we enjoyed every single bite.  For an entree, the duck massaman curry was ordered and the special seared salmon. The duck curry was Monnnnnay. It was so good, both the Hubbs and I were impressed with the taste. The duck tasted excellent with the curry. It said it comes with potatoes, specifically they are sweet potatoes, I was trying to find potatoes, as I love them and when I was unable to find one, my husband said it's probably sweet potatoes. Nevertheless, excellent dish The seared salmon sat on top of a mixed mango salad. The presentation of the dish was very nice and the salmon, although cooked well done, was still tasty. We were both very impressed with the food.  The ambience is also great. Quiet and very relaxing, and still quite elegant. I am very surprised at the low star reviews as I thought it was very nice restaurant!  Don't be scared and try this place, a bit pricey, but worth it! If we didnt order 2 apps and 2 entrees I may have had room for dessert  Service wise- no complaints!! Friendly and wonderful servers!

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy shrimp with walnuts in a mild sauce with the perfect amount of kick and chicken satay

Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seared salmon over a mango mixed salad and duck massaman curry. Great with jasmine rice, which does cost extra as no sides are included

Bx-P_BaKNxGXgRT86-r-nA.text: Everywhere I travel I am always looking to get a good bowl of Pho and I was extremely happy to find a place on the strip. Not only was it convenient but it was awesome! The options are simpler than a traditional Vietnamese restaurant but I was very pleased. A little pricy for Pho but you're on the strip. Slightly smaller portion as well but the flavor was excellent so I left a happy customer. Will definitely be back!

Qc3MgVhOvhN7HvWT5zTeGg.text: Great food, ambiance, and service. Ordered the short ribs, which were really good! I was expecting a few "racks" and got about 7, so my only complaint is that was too much great food to eat!  Would definitely go back.

0KkFsAIjJ95MB6FHGzlpqg.text: Dumplings, tom kah kai were way too sweet. Prawns in ginger/garlic were fishy tasting. Ambience is nice for a hotel restaurant and service was ok. I would suggest going elsewhere - even with a Groupon the value was not there.

Lqt68aT2yEuJSftgFFpTsQ.text: FYI: this restaurant closes at 2pm and opens again at 5pm for dinner. Kind of weird...especially since it's located at Bally's casino level...where everything operates 24 hours. Eh..but whatever floats their boat I guess.  Food was delicious. Portions were plentiful. Atmosphere set the mood just right. I really enjoyed sitting next to the pond area with lily pads floating. =) Cute!  Wouldn't go out of my way just to eat here, but if you're around the area or if you're staying at Ballys for your Vegas trip, I highly recommend you checking this place out.

jvCHq9iZ5l3rY-Iakta_Xw.text: What can I say about this place. Well first of all, this is an amazing place. My family and I went to this place since all the other restaurants were packed and this was like the only option we could go to. My mother ordered the popular Drunk Man Noodle and my father ordered the Grill Pork Chop, and I ordered the Pad Thai. First of all, the Pad Thai tasted excellent. All I can say is excellent. The taste reminded me of the food in Thailand which gave me a bit of nostalgia. Pad Thai was cooked to perfection. My father said the pork chop was good as well. Grilled perfectly on both sides. According to me mother, she said that the Drunk Man Noodles was better than all Drunk Man Noodles she's ever tried. Better than any Thai restaurant back where she and my father lives in California. Staff was nice of course. Our waitress was Patty. So if your waitress is her, your dining is experience will be AMAZING! Check the place while you can. I bet you will enjoy and never regret going there :)

79SUyMS4v9TYXkPhb4-n0A.text: This was the most amazing thai food.. a must visit when you come here.. transports you to Thailand !!! A must on your bucket list for some good food in Vegas

c0aP0dmAxU-6ma9jVeifUQ.text: I can't speak for the authenticity of the dishes offered , but my husband and I really enjoyed our meal here !  I will say it's not necessarily pure Thai, since it has other Asian fusion influence, but not complaining because it was so yummy!!  Prices are definitely on the high side , but using Groupon made it very reasonable, especially when considering the ambience and the quality and quantity of the food we received (Huge shareable appetizers of honey Walnut shrimp and calamari, followed by very flavorful and balanced Malay curry, and perfectly cooked drunken noodles with topped with roasted duck.  Our main server was very sweet, knowledgeable , and attentive, and I loved  how the whole staff  seemed to have the teamwork thing down pat and kept us taken care of the whole time without being intrusive while we enjoyed the ambience.  Tip: they also offer discounts at the tix4tonite kiosks which I think would be worth it for a larger party if you can't access a Groupon.   The restaurant seemed to have quite a few Groupon users though  and staff happily redeemed them and treated us with stellar service the whole evening.  I would subtract one star because receipt was confusing  at the end (waitress admitted the way it is set up was indeed confusing to many patrons and sincerely apologized ), but I still found the overall total more than reasonable considering everything so I decided not to mull over it, and rated 5 stars since I don't agree with the 3.5 star average here on Yelp!  I feel the overall average needs to go up to at LEAST a solid 4 so people don't miss out and are more likely to give this amazing place a try!;)

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Malay curry, level 3/5 spice . Still surprisingly very tolerable for someone who has low spice/heat tolerance!
Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Drunken noodles . Loved it with the mango on top!
Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari

w95QbD7_V0zkA5sDY9X9bQ.text: I came here around 11 pm after a recovery nap from day drinking. As you walk in, you're greeted by a stone buddha on top of a pond with floating lotus flowers. The decor is so cute, and the place is dimly lit. They even play good music - telepopmusik vibes. Super chill atmosphere.   I ordered the spicy seafood noodle soup (medium spicy), which was $22. The portion was huge, and it was loaded with seafood - scallops, shrimp, calamari, fish cakes, and baby octopus. It also had rice noodles, bean sprouts, peanuts, and green onions. Super delish.  My friend got the northern style shrimp tom yum with a side of jasmine rice, and he loved it. I tasted the soup, and it was very lemongrass-y, just the way I like it. My sister got the duck noodle soup, and she liked it, but thought it was a little too heavy.   The service was also excellent. Our water was always refilled and our waitress brought sauces and explained each one. I would definitely come back the next time I find myself in sin city.

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Northern style shrimp tom yum soup with side of jasmine rice $12
Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Duck noodle soup $20
Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy seafood noodle soup

-yzAk3T3fOw4Pz3_mB3Y7A.text: Very good and authentic. Everything is full of flavor and came out pipping hot. I can just imagine the big wok and burners they use in the kitchen. Definitely not your Panda Express Americanized Asian food.  Service was nice  and attentive.   Giving it four stars instead of five due to price. Duck pineapple fried rice was $26! But then again, everything on the Strip is overpriced.
