Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork taro roll. 4 pieces
Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tom yum shrimp soup

qCHnHSaL-iaQEo0kwJjxog.text: I am giving 1star for the dish that my daughter ordered. I wish I would not have bought there Groupon deal. Bad service.. waitress were just wanting us to leave asap.. picking up the dishes before we could finish our food. This is the first restaurant I found in Thai food where you have to order steam rice with your curry dishes. Would not recommend.

NXiXLOnK9ACnoz9urb6e9A.text: Very friendly and helpful staff although the place was really quiet at lunchtime. Dumplings in soy sauce and honey walnut prawns made for plentiful and delicious starters. These are very ample portions and entrees are too much for one unless really hungry. The seafood  tart surrounded by a sweet Chile sauce was very good and the spicy seafood soup was excellent. Not cheap but good food and worth a visit. One caveat. They don't have Thai beer on the beverage list and could not serve alcohol at lunch time. Very odd.

yx_HjfUR0ik6pTukL66HwQ.text: Just what I needed after staying up all night in Vegas, some bomb spicy papaya salad and spicy red curry with brown rice.  This hit the spot!

x_TNH-75SxnwO27T9ykZTw.text: What a great experience we had at this restaurant!! When my friend offered to take me there for dinner I was hesitant at first.  I'm a meat & potatoes kinda girl, wasn't really sure about Thai food but I'm so glad I took a chance & went. I had the Honey Walnut Shrimp for my appetizer and it was so so good. I had fried rice with chicken as my entree.  It was also very delicious. The service was superb in every way. Great food & service with reasonable prices makes it very easy to give this restaurant 5 stars!!

yFqQIzAIHtyuMvNJVTfhaQ.text: There are only two places on the strip with Thai food that I know of. Lemongrass inside Aria and Sea inside Ballys.    Can't knock the quality as I enjoyed meal. For Thai food it is pretty expensive but you are paying for location.   No joke on the spicy level. A 4 out of 5 here means business! Next time I think I will go with a 3.

njKXEM-XfzXCRzgfxzOyNg.text: Bought the groupon to save a little money but felt like we still paid too much for average food. Seafood noodle soup seemed to have zero seasoning/flavor. Did not get any sauces until we had to ask half way through.

GZnPbV6AhM-NpbnyEfWE_w.text: sure the food was above average but...do i really have to pay 28dollars for a plate of above average pad see ew...that's more than half the price of a great buffet..no\  at least waters were filled quickly and the waitress was cute though

UcGX-kkgvDlJAd9YtiatDw.text: I absolutely love this restaurant. The food is delicious and large portions. Beautiful ambiance, sit by the fountain if you can. William is the best waiter ever. I asked his opinion on what to get and he suggested the spicy soba noodle dish and I just loved it. My husband had the stir fried string bean dish with chicken and that was to die for as well. This was our second visit, on our first visit I had the pad thai which was very good as well. I cant wait to go back again.

UAZ3SOwtlscC41H4_CYIQA.text: I left my debit card at the restaurant. After my payment, i stayed in the restaurant for awhile.they should have plenty of to tell me that i forgot to pick up my card .however, they didnt inform me of anything untill i made two calls after i left. I called them twice about my lost card. They finally admitted that they have my debit card. This is disappointing. I cant believe they are so dishonest. I will NEVER recommend it to anyone.

9_xmnxxIZCsfgH_Y3mJ1yA.text: Stopped in at 11:00 on a Friday night. There were a few occupied tables, but halfway through our meal we were the only ones left. Sat by the water and had the three island appetizer platter to share, a couple of beers and the pho tai. Food was great, service was friendly. A nice change for late night munchies.

9ib9gvkVPf2wSjhUEb_jMQ.text: My husband and I stumbled upon this place while searching for food in frenzied Las Vegas.  We had been turned away at The Steakhouse at Bill's for a second time (that's a longer story and I refuse to think that place is in such high demand that we couldn't get a table at 7pm on a Sunday).  Anyhoo, we noted there was a steakhouse at Bally's and headed over there.  We noticed SEA right next to the steakhouse and were just drawn in.  From the moment we walked in, we were impressed by the service.  We were seated immediately and when we noted the quieter, calmer area in back, we were welcomed to sit there.  It turned out to be a perfect romantic dinner :)  In addition, it isn't crazy pretentious like many other nice restaurants in Vegas.  Great food, friendly & attentive service, and warm atmosphere.  Here are the highlights...  -- Crispy Coconut Spring Rolls:  Perfectly crunchy and delicious, accompanied by a Lime Mustard Sauce that was sweet, tangy, and gently spicy.  The sauce was so good, we dipped the carrot garnish in it and kept noshing after the spring rolls were gone! -- Thai Style Lobster Tail:  AMAZING.  The lobster tail was still in the shell, chopped into perfect chunks, then breaded and (apparently) fried.  I needed my husband's help to get the shell pieces off, but that just made the meal more fun!  The veggies were perfectly cooked and the sauce was like nothing I've had before.  Plus the amount of lobster was very generous.  Soooooo delish! -- Crabmeat Fried Rice:  Hubby ordered this and it was really tasty!  It was full of lump crab meat and veggies, all blended together in a ridiculously good blend of flavors.   -- Mad Dragon Friter:  This SEA version of fried ice cream was a perfect way to end our meal.  The crunchy coating was uniquely spiced (I have no idea what those spices were, but they were great!) and it was accompanied by delicate slices of mango.  Lovely.  Some people have said here that the service is "slow."  I disagree.  The service was exceptional and the staff left us alone long enough to get lost in conversation over our drinks, appetizer, meal, & dessert.  I believe this is the mark of a great restaurant...  I want time to enjoy my meal, especially when paying more than usual.  If you are looking for atmosphere, delicious food, and a special experience; you will get exactly that at SEA.  If you don't the like the company you keep, perhaps the service would seem slow... But don't take that out on the restaurant!

_i0ShHovt6pjszsX5sWEGg.text: We come Vegas 2times a week due to our job. Try restaurant everywhere of course. The high price here is not surprising to me. It's Vegas. And it's not the food court downstairs. Even the foot long subway downstairs is 10bucks. So I won't complaint it's expensive. The decor is very modern and cozy. We were seated right away. Service is very sweet and professional.  Everything I mentioned by now is 4-5stars. Food came out in 35minutes.  I ordered green curry hubby ordered pork chop.  The curry is so salty I finished every piece of the rice and 3glasses of water and left most of the food.  I will try to steak house next door next time when we stay here again.

b2U_fO5_UyVBvdoj0OFz1A.text: Food was fantastic, atmosphere was perfect. Didn't have reservations and still got to sit at the signature "floating" table! Would recommend if you are looking for something on the strip without the strip feel.

YHnxsxQOEqjzanGg4a7bJA.text: Service needs improvement. Ambience is good.  Rice noodles are rehydrated type, at least the two dishes we had.  They were stuck vs loose.  The Tamarind Sea Food Combo was great.  Had to remind them to bring the rice.  Option of white or brown rice.  Thai ice tea was very good, almost no after taste.  I will still go back to try out the more unique dishes.  I doubt I will try the common dishes,  Las Vegas is too expensive to eat what is available in other cities. Considering Las Vegas, prices are on the mid to low.

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tamarind Sea Food Combo.  Has a kick to it, mild.  Perfect for my taste.  Unique tamarind tartness.  Comes w/ rice.

_TTc0LQYEh7jskE68eEHoA.text: Was craving Thai food and this place hit the spot. The chicken pai thai and beef pai thai are delish! My hubby also got one of the green curries and he loved it.

Lfo-knRxCR8cnGwfOzQJkw.text: Classic bbq pork chop was good.  I try pork all over Las vegas and this was good juicy pork with sweet flavors.  They were able to make my Negroni cocktail without me telling them how which was nice, however they left out the orange peel.  I tried some of the dish off of other plates on the table and the calamari was pretty tough. Good atmosphere and service.

QZ5DHF3b_eVpiyqtkYYJTg.text: My girlfriend and me decided to have dinner at SEA and enjoy the Thai food. She ordered a sort of crunchy salad ( greens with fried seafood) and I ordered fried rice with pineapple. The salad was so spicy that she was not able eat it (hot!, burning!). The pineapple in my fried rice was almost non existent. Quiet environment and reasonable prices but we did not like the food.

tuwKA3qk0IwiZSrjSrZ7tQ.text: We have had pad thai, drunken noodles, marinated steak, and spare ribs here. Noodle dishes were better than the meat dishes but all around a good meal.

_nnL6a80HGtr_Vxy1ZwBAg.text: The ambiance is cool with the water pool and statue, and the pomegranate/mint/vodka drink was fantastic. We had a coconut shrimp appetizer, which was ok (might have been a little over cooked). I had a spicy green curry with shrimp, peas, peppers, and bamboo shoots, and my girlfriend had a special dish with scallops and vegetables. I liked the spiciness of my dish, but the rest of the meal was just "good". Given the prices, I wish it had been a little more special.

6CqM3KcsKw95glxKEbd8-A.text: It pains me to remember how we couldn't sit in the awesome Benches Floating on Water area because we were one too many for the 4-seater benches. Despite being turned away from utter tranquility, I still have a found memory of this place.  Food: eh, nothing that I can't get for a lesser price. Not memorable.  Service: good! my friend with a laundry list of allergies had all her needs met!   Decor: even though frugal ole' me spent $50 on this meal (and a LUNCH, at that!), I still gave it 4 stars which is a testament to good company and interactive furniture and decorations. We couldn't get enough of the transparent globe swings that hung from the ceiling!

qMHGFbX3uNN-cJdNqDqlVA.text: I loved the Thai coffee, Thai tea and spicy herb fried rice (Thai). Everything is uber pricey in Vegas and this is not an exception

mQsSuiDOgkJnurTymFqmiA.text: The decoration inside the restaurant was nice but unfortunately, the strong cigarette smell from the casino permeates in and ruins the dining experience. The food was ok and certainty wasn't worth the price. Disappointed.

SfswTHIvmwlZ4AvxJ7684Q.text: I was craving thai food while staying at the Paris and found sea thai on yelp so decided to give it a try. The only star I gave is for the decor and ambiance.  It's really modern and upscale looking inside for a thai restaurant. The food was beyond terrible. We ordered papaya salad spring rolls red curry and seafood noodles. Papaya salad wAs decent spring rolls were nothing great the curry was basically a soup that tasted nothing like curry! The noodles we told them to take away and ordered the pad Thai even that they could not make right! After a few bites and being disgusted we asked for the tab and left. So if your into real Thai food don't bother coming here because you will only be greatly disappointed

XeHC4P7k-BeAjLN4z5T0bA.text: The thai food I tried was decent (Pad Kee Mao, also known as Drunken Noodle), and the crab rangoon's were delicious. It's overpriced for the food, and I have had better Pad Kee Mao. The ambiance was nice, dim, clean, and romantic. I am giving them a rating of 2 stars because the staff gave extremely poor service. The waitress never came to check on us after the food had been served and never gave us refills. We had to ask another staff member for help and for the check, and the place was not busy at all

6m0nzk7aQXH_dcj1yAXvkg.text: Green curry excellent. I asked for Thai hot and it came out pretty hot... That's unusual in many places. Service was fast! Took about ten minutes when NY to go order when it wasn't too busy.

I4Ehzs9cW6W1VMGWk1GjWQ.text: Solid Thai food in a nice atmosphere. It wasn't very crowded, but still took forever for my water to be refilled.  We tried the Pad Thai and Panang curry.  Both were good.  Overall a nice place in Ballys, I enjoyed it!

MTNf5eY9WMc7KWOtDXuFHw.text: Wow, I didn't even realize this restaurant was at Ballys since it is kinda tucked away in a corner!  Everything we ate was excellent.  The service was great and very fast, and the ambiance is cool with surprisingly comfy benches set around a pond.  My husband and I both agree that the have THE BEST crab rangoon of any we have tried; if you like crab rangoon do not miss these!  The prices are really reasonable considering it is on The Strip, in fact we got 2 appetizers, 2 entrees and dessert and our food was about the same cost as a different place we go to by our house.  We will be back!

CSiy3Dcw3nUNE-n4RnsccA.text: This was our first visit to Las Vegas and we found the SEA Thai Restaurant pretty much by accident in a corner of the Bally's Resort & Casino as we were exploring the area prior to lunchtime. With its rectangular pond with unique wooden tables integrated around it - overlooked by a statue of Buddha - we thought that we'd give it a try for dinner. So we requested a table by the pool for dinner.   When we arrived that evening we were happy to find that our requested table was actually waiting for us. (This definitely does not happen in a lot of restaurants when a specific table or area is requested.)   We started with the coconut spring rolls, which were crispy and delicious (four to an order). My wife had the Queen of Siam Basil Chicken and I had the Bangkok Panang Curry with shrimp as a main course. Both were excellent and seasoned to our desired level of hotness.  The wait staff was friendly and efficient. As noted by other reviews, the prices are a bit higher than what is normaly expected for Thai/Vietnamese food, but as one quickly learns in Las Vegas, nothing is cheap on The Strip. And compared to other restaurants that we visited on this trip, the prices were actually moderate.  SEA is a restaurant definitely worth visiting. It's small, so I'd recommend making a reservation - and requesting a table by the pool.

h12St60VYUMzVNS3dOP-fA.text: Average thai food. I had the stir fried greens and rice (rice is separate from entree). My friend had the pad thai and it was way too saucy for me, unlike other pad thais i have tried in the past. I liked the decor and overall ambiance and I have to say that service was attentive. The actual restaurant was pretty small but intimate. However, At the end of the day, Its still overpriced thai food.

F2WITWvOVn9gYddIXgwJUg.text: We went there in beginning of April.  Found this place by accident when I was cruising  around casino, waiting for my wife. Menu looked interesting, decor looked fine - so, why-the-hell-notski :)  We got there for dinner and got a place by the pond (well, a little pool of water right in the middle of the restaurant).  A bit loud at first, even some unhappy faces (for some reason) but once we got an appetizer, Fresh spring rolls - just like in Vietnam :)  Than we got drunken man noodles and East West Shrimp. For shrimps it said "Load of shrimp" on the menu - they really mean it!!!  Drunken man noodles were fantastic !!! Shrimps were awesome!!! Taste was just right!!! Service was wonderful, waiter was on time, with no extra stupid checkups.    Only a bit weird thing was, their alcohol, beer, wine etc. is served from a small restaurant next door. And they will bring you a separate check :)  The best thing was, I cut myself tapping to the very nice techno bit in the middle of our dinner, which was pretty loud... but sure enough - some bi*h complained.... cause it went away in a second.  So... that is all for my experience...  VERY recommend if you like Thai / Vietnamese food and great service!

IRq5yZuc_-T3sXroagjYwQ.text: Overpriced, mediocre, terrible service.  Don't waste your money.  There were 2 other tables there when we were seated so they weren't busy at all.  We ended up waited more than 30 minutes for our food and they didn't even offer water.    I asked for mild pineapple fried rice and there were A TON of whole/half thai chilis mixed in (which are EXTREMELY spicy).  They also used a lot of pepper.  Overall, my pineapple fried rice wasn't anything special and definitely spicier than I would have liked.  Expect to pay about $16/entree, which is double the price anywhere else for the same thing (might even taste better at the cheaper restaurants).  Our bill was a little over $50 (not including tip) for 2 entrees and 2 alcoholic drinks.  For that price, you might as well save it for The Buffet at Bellagio across the street.

r4clzpyD6FkXur7_NfruJw.text: Found this gem located in Ballys late at night. Decor is contemporary. Service was very attentive and not intrusive. Food hit just the right spot. Price was very reasonable since its on the strip. Basically 18 bucks per dish. It about 13 for off the strip so it's actually a steal!

7Pa8P4MNd05emrh4dLLqsg.text: After 20 hrs of not eating, and well not being that hungry...we decided to get some food. Asian food sounded good so we came here. The decor was nice, with a fountain in the middle that reminds you even teh divey places in Vegas are done up nice. Most importanly though, the food was SOLID! I had the Pho and I thought it was pretty darn good. My other friend also had the Pho and thought it was good, and we aren't Pho beginners either...experts almost. I had the brisket and meatball pho for reference. Ask for the sauces tho as they might forget. Aside from Vietnamese food, the Thai food on the other side of the menu was also Bomb.com! My friend odered the chicken pad see eew and it I thought it was pretty darn good. Smokey and flavorful!!! Service was good, but it wasn't too busy either. It was a bit pricey for what it was...but then again its VEGAS!!!

L1gsZU_j6RJd58wThLMugw.text: Can we all agree on something here?  That, when in Las Vegas, you are going to pay more for the basics?  Booze, smokes, food, everything, it's all just a bit more (or a LOT). So when i can find a place that's open late and serves really good food, even if it's a few bucks more than i would pay elsewhere, I'm stoked.  We found Sea after arriving late on a business trip. I was looking for something resembling supper so i wouldn't be stuck eating a pre made cafe sandwich for $12. We asked a cocktail waitress and she mentioned the cafe (shocking) and almost off the cuff, Sea. I love me some Thai, so we rolled.  Seats are half table and chair, half blocks of wood next to a pool. If your back is fickle, ask for the table and chair.  So, the chow; i had Drunken Noodles, a dish i would have all the time at a local place in Pasadena while i was working there. It wasn't on the menu when i would have it, i though it was just something the chef would whip up based on what i liked. But lo and behold, here it appears on the menu and once brought to me, it was PERFECT. Flat noodles in a spicy brown sauce with basil, peppers and onions, chicken and garlic. Incredible.  The waitress was on the ball the whole time, the food was great and in Vegas terms, it didn't break the bank. All around win. When conference comes around, i expect to eat here nightly.

QU0q388vWRj4ZQCQaGJFrg.text: First time ever having Thai food and I'm now in love. Spice was spot on, service was phenomaneal, you cannot go wrong here.

xlHVgy0ejtrYNSd7RjONqQ.text: This first time I take dinner at thai rest in Las Vegas ,me and girl friend got 30% disc from tix for tonight counter just only paid $2 as they suggest got dinner before show(jubilee) ,we ordered volcano chicken ,patting green curry and Tom yam soup and dessert ice cream with fried banana  the taste was delicious ,little bit over price but luckily got 30% disc ,service was oke ,clean,nice decor . We love it .we will come back next time

GpenoFy5nj2szn5MNaE9gQ.text: This place is pricey for Thai food it it is Vegas so we expected the prices to be up there. The decor is very nice. The front of the restaurant has two hanging egg chairs which is cool because no one else has it! We ordered the lollipop chicken but it was a busy so don't get it. We got the coconut rolls instead and that was tasty!  My husband ordered the spicy pork belly and it was so hot and spicy he was sweating while eating it. I ordered the garlic chicken with mixed veggies. That was delicious!  I would recommend this place to others fruit are in Las Vegas and in the Bally's or Paris hotel .

enoQyKH1-E1WiZgl355T0Q.text: My wife and I had dinner here before going to a show one night, and for sure, this was one of the best Thai restaurants that we visited in Vegas by far. Service was excellent, from start to finish, they really make you feel special. The food came out fast and my wife and I enjoyed the Panang Curry, which is one of my favorites, the Spicy Coconut soup and their version of the Calamari. We will definitely come back here every time we get a chance and we highly recommend this Restaurant to anyone who wants to spice up their evenings...

-HsEjny8lsSfK1c_MHU3Lg.text: I was worried coming here because there were few people here at 7 and from reading reviews. But the service was great. And the food was awesome. I had the Malay massaman curry. Perfect spiciness. And the mango margarita was more of a martini but it was awesome. I definitely recommend this place. And sit by the lotus pond if you can.

v_VMw6N-PBI8-cfdTZVNkg.text: Tasty food, but unless you have s death wish, don't order anything spicy over level 3 on their scale of 1-5! I enjoy spicy food, but the level 4 Island Red Curry was a bit too much to really "enjoy". Also, due to the large, unheated plates, the sauce was pretty cool. They need to warm the plates before serving. The  chicken and shrimp dumpling appetizer was delicious. Beware... The Tamarind Bass is a complete fish, so is best if split between a group of diners.

CO4hhdbncd6GFkoZnWg0Hg.text: This restaurant is visually pleasing and has pretty good food. I have been here twice and have gotten pad Thai tofu both visits. I love it! It is a pretty neat setting if you have the option of sitting in the booths that are set flush with the small pond. The waitstaff is friendly enough, but my boyfriend was shrugged off when he pointed out that his glass was cracked and cut his lip.

uqPBHyDZN8bAEwvMMRQ5og.text: Delicious food, good service, reasonable prices, lovely atmosphere. Win, win. Plus we got a 30% off coupon from the half price ticket booth right at the Bally's marketplace. If you are staying in or near Bally's, definitely check it out!

OH7RMk1x5Tv6yU4_ysXltg.text: I loved the ambiance!! It's a LOT smaller than the SEA in Brooklyn but same theme. Really cute place for date night. Don't let the fact that's in Bally's steer you away!!! It's a classy/trendy little spot. Food was really good. The reason I gave it 4 instead of 5 is the fact that I got extremely sick immediately after leaving there. Even though that happened, I would still go back and give it another shot. I really enjoyed the food/experience.

ggcvXm59zStFgZjCiRIKAA.text: WOW! The best Thai food I have ever had! The Volcano Chicken was delicious! The Drunken Noodles, were like none other! I cannot wait to come back! The staff was super attentive...never had an empty glass of tea. If you are looking for a new Thai food experience, this place is a must to try!! You'll thank me later!

J0-7AeTCMb28Gkq_-0d8hg.text: Everything was fantastic! Great taste and great service! The hotel where it is located is a bit on the older side, but restaurant is fantastic!

iygwYgqMKxIDinebD1AGjQ.text: We visited this establishment  during our recent trip to vegas.  We had a travelzoo voucher so we decided to try it.  Its located in Ballys, sort of hidden away.  Well its in fact a hidden gem.  The ambiance is very relaxing a tranquil, very good from the high stress daily Vegas fight.  We started with two appetizers, i ordered the lettuce wraps and the wife ordered the tup tim fritters.  The lettuce wraps are the best we ever had in our life, so flavorful.  The tup tim fritters were good as well, but no match for the wraps.  For our entrees i ordered the malay massaman curry and the wife had the ginger and pineapple stir fry.  Her was good but the Curry was absolutely fantastic.  Im not a curry person but it really blew my socks off.  Wife enjoyed hers, but she kept thinking and talking about the lettuce wraps.  The entire rest of the trip the wife kept wanting to go back for some lettuce wraps, just as a snack.  But we were staying in that hotel and i like to try something different each time during the trip.  Next time we will definately be stopping by again for some lettuce wraps.  Oh and the travelzoo voucher was just the icing on the cake money wise.  A definite recommendation while in Vegas!!

Pn_QkZ1jft8S29A2uIN8ow.text: Good food although very spicy.  Good service and ambient.  Good for kids too, a bowl of rice is always a success with them

uaZQ1tx8MlrZwGCuLmo8Wg.text: I had a taste for thai food and was looking for a close place to the Bellagio hotel. I found this on yelp and was listed as $$ for food which is un True. I had the coconut crusted shrimp for appetizer and that was excellent. Price $13 a little high in my opinion. Then I wanted to eat Tum yum soup and still quite expensive as a bowl is $14, but I had a taste for it and when it came as I ordered it mild, it was Blane. Every thai restaurant I go to when ordering mild it should have some kick, but it did not. Broth was cloudy and had to pick out some inedible stuff in the soup that felt like plastic, but was probably lemon grass or something else. I would think if u are eating a dish that you don't have to fight it to eat it. My main dish was Massaman Curry, which I though was yellow curry, but I think it is peanut based. In any case very blan taste and not spicy at all when ordered mild. When I ordered that they ask you if you want rice and that's another price add on for $3.00 for a small bowl of rice. For crying out loud all thai restaurant will give you a bowl of rice with the order. Pepsi was $4.00 and they didn't have thai ice tea on the menu as I asked if they have that, and they said yea. However, didn't think about asking price as Thai ice tea is usually $3.00and they charges $5.00. Next be aware they automatically add gratuity of 18% on my bill called "party gratuity as I was only one person! All in all I spent $78.18 for a dinner that was not worth the price. Fair warning to all to avoid this place as they Nickle and dime you and food is not that great. It got great ratings on yelp, but wonder if there are so many tourists that don't know what good Thai food taste like. As I am from Chicago and travel quite a bit to experience many Thai restaurants. Hope this helps other to decide if they want to choose this restaurant, as I will not on my next visit.

lAcfDkoJkzX0LW7y7_hPng.text: We made reservations for my birthday at 730pm and when we arrived on time the Manager named "O" said that there was not a table because everyone else had a reaervation at 730. How is it possible that they would fill up all the tables and overbook knowing that someone would be left out. He proceeded to argue with us that we were wrong for expecting to have a table at the time we reserved... he was absolutely incredulent, unapologetic, rude and disrespectful. As good as the food is here we will not be back and would recommend that you spend your hard earned money somewhere else.

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States

exWIJUCK86UyMQ_aOx7fYw.text: Great food. Good environment. Amazing staff. Groupon deal or otherwise is expensive. The water in the middle is very relaxing and a great place to take a date. Side note..i lost a lot of money on the way in...keep your eyes on the prize!

VZ8Ir699--pbwudwBy9jXA.text: We do not typically eat Eat on the strip as we are locals; however, we were going to a show and figured we will try this restaurant.  Truly a fantastic meal. We had the Volcanic chicken, chicken fried rice, a garlic vegetable dish ( forgot the name but has bean sprouts too) and a beef curry. There were 3 hungry young men and myself and this was plenty of food. I highly recommend

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xx68d9NTv4S2X4M63bbB9g.text: What a lovely Thai restaurant in Bally's!  I enjoyed a lovely dinner at a table around the water and really enjoyed the chill atmosphere and simple decor.  I thoroughly enjoyed my dumplings and the Panang curry...beautifully cooked and presented.  Nice escape from your typical Strip restaurants, good service and tasty food!

-HT3yo4apFbIq57vYPBhgg.text: The first night we ate there we were impressed by the crab rangoon.  It was a nice blend of spicy, scallions and crab.  Some of the best eaten ever.  We also had the Island Red Curry and The Spicy Shrimp Rice.  Was average but the cost was ridiculously high.  $22 per plate and I do not mind paying that in Vegas so the overall experience was good.  The tables are old and chipped, very outdated to justify ambience, food and price but it was down to earth  Because the crab rangoon was so special, we decided to eat there a second night.  And of course started out with the crab rangoon.  The first bite, I thought, this is doughy, like it had been sitting out.  But then I though maybe my taste buds were off since I was so tired.  So I took a second bite and got a ball of ice.  So that means what I thought was so special was either a buy in or made and then frozen or they were going bad so they froze them.  No kidding, you just don't play with seafood like that.  The plate was sent back with forgiveness and the second order came.  Again, frozen.  When you give someone a second chance, there was obviously no pride taken in the cooking that night and we probably just hit it on a day when there was a high note but this seemed standard.  We showed the owner/manager the plate and had him touch the inside.  His face went sour and was so sorry.  I told him I was too but I am not playing when it comes to possible health issues, we were paying for nothing and leaving.  He did not try to make any good will gestures.  It left such a sick feeling in my stomach, we made several attempts to eat in Bally's and just got sicker by the minute.  It ended as a bad eating night and a belly full of hunger.  It was a good thing we had a fresh cupcake in the room.  Would I go there again?  NO!  The risk outweighs the first experience there and could lead me to getting sick.

f-Qepve8hGa9mE6YuTPe3w.text: I seriously dont know why this restaurant got 3& a half stars.  Our thai experience with my family was great.the food was great the service was superb.and the place was so cozy and lovely.  we ordered crab fried rice, chicken satay, seafood tomyum white soup, garlic prawns which was my favorite...it was a huge prawn.very very fresh and yummy...it was very very good. bbq ribs sweet and yummy.   The cozy cute place was very nice and decors are so ellegantly simple. I love this restaurant.

UzuuuogZDZG4E3lEM6WTFA.text: I thought this place was amazing! The food came fairly quickly, the service staff was excellent, the dining atmosphere is incredible and beautiful, the pricing is great, and the food was outstanding! I have no idea why this restaurant is rated only 3 1/2 stars. Also, there are plenty of options for those who are vegan or gluten sensitive. That was also a big plus for me.

096CX0w_5YW3SzEzXQ5u2Q.text: Great service and the food was spectacular! In a city where food is outrageously prices, this place was reasonable.  The portions are large and unique. Highly recommend!

hZELde3eM1uKY8lfRnb2Bg.text: Good meal and great service.  We had a Groupon so it was a great deal. I got the shrimp pad Thai, and my wife got a different noodle dish.  Both had great flavor.

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States

exGEQ3io8M5XPODhhXYASA.text: My friend and I made reservations to this restaurant for our second night in Vegas. We are both big fans of thai food and I must say that this restaurant did not disappoint. I ordered the iced pomegranate green tea which was unsweetened but I probably could've guessed that prior to ordering. I got the Pad Kee Maow which is the flat noodles which came with egg, onions, bell peppers, tomatoes, basil, and chili. I chose a 3 as a spice level out of 5 (5 being the spiciest). I love flat noodles and this dish was awesome. I would definitely come back and order the same thing again. The atmosphere was great. The restaurant's seating area is sort of divided into 5 sections and some sections more private and others to serve larger groups. I love this place and would definitely recommend it.

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pad Kee Maow!!

x34HVAkL_5eUjRBDiy5IaA.text: Amazing Thai right in the hotel I was staying at. Great place for a nice date night. I don't think an appropriate place for small children. Service was wonderful, never an empty cup.y table tried four appetizers, all were great!

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Peanut and Soy Sauce noodles, amazing

B7Q-t2qOlmqyam3GLrnEZQ.text: Came here with a friend - we had groupons and it was a fantastic experience at a good value. I absolutely love Thai food and had no complaints whatsoever about this location

CC-JpTpc_iUVdzplpSZViw.text: Lovely relaxing place to eat away from the hustle and bustle of the Las Vegas strip and casinos. Tucked away inside Bally's casino and hotel, it is a nice ambiance.  I sat at a table right next to a shallow pool with a Buddha statue at the head of the pool. The food was good, fresh. I got tofu with ginger and vegetables with brown rice.  I also got lemongrass ginger tea and an Old Cuban mixed drink. They were delicious!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ziqsvJa_YO9Sjh1GWfETtQ.text: This was definitely a hidden gem.  We had tickets to see Jubilee and wanted to do dinner before hand at Bally's.  Thought SEA would be a great change from what we are schedule to eat during the rest of our trip.  It is way it the back corner of the casino by BLTsteak.  Nice quite and tucked in.  Beautiful interior, with a central water feature.  2 minor issues.  This is a pricey restaurant so I would not expect for them to have the cheapest, crappiest chopsticks I've ever used.  My thai restaurant at home has significantly nicer sticks and the dishes are half the price.  Really no excuse for short cheap wood that don't separate.  A place this nice should have beautiful sticks.  The other is that we order a pitcher of tea and the "pitcher" is a tuberwear jug.  With the label on it.  Again where is the class.  I can see beautiful teapots on the other table but I have a $2 plastic jug. Mind you the tea was pored into wine glasses but really.  Ok onto the greatness...the food. Before appetizers we did the crab Rangoon and the honey walnut shrimp.  The Rangoon was good, what made it great was the sauce.  At first my dad thought they forgot to bring the sauce because he couldn't see it.  It is a cleanish cucumber sweet sauce.  Totally elevated the Rangoon.  The honey walnut shrimp were tasty with a light batter and lots of crunch.  I am addicted to pad Thai and I firmly believe that you can judge a thai restaurant by its pad Thai.  So I was really excited when I saw they had crazy pad Thai- a choice of duck or calamari.  I did the duck. And I have never been happier.  Part way through the meal I told my dad that I felt like a vacuum because I was just sucking it up.  The duck was so tender and succulent.  Just thinking about it again makes me happy.  Plus there were plenty of peanuts.

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. For a fancy restaurant you&#39;d think that they&#39;d have better chopsticks
Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Honey walnut shrimp
Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab Rangoon

N17e0Rcec8XZgIfF6vUHYg.text: I've got to say, this was one of my favorite meals in Vegas. I've never been to the one in New York, or feel very snobby about Thai food, so I give this two thumbs up, a satisfied tummy and four stars.   First of all, the interior design is incredible. It's almost as if you are dining inside a fountain with Buddha. The seats are level with the water feature, and a statue garnishes the very end of the pool.   We had a large group, so they accommodated us without a reservation in their back group seating area behind privacy screens. The service was simply amazing. They all treated us like kings. Very attentive and suggestive.   The food was phenomenal. They put all kind of good stuff in their dishes like basil and chilies. They've got a great wine selection, and very reasonable prices for what you pay in Vegas.

o8VsGWjfpTGW8bwgrj0UEw.text: We really enjoyed our meal here. We had the crazy pad Thai with duck and the Ginger and broccoli with shrimp. We can't exactly remember the names of the dishes but we do remember that they were delicious. The waiter was very helpful in giving us suggestions and was very attentive. Last time we were in Las Vegas we couldn't find this restaurant as we forgot our cell phones so we had to eat somewhere else. This time we checked to see where it really was before heading out to eat. This restaurant is in the Bally's Casino. The restaurant decor is relaxing and the place was full when we finished our meal. We highly recommend this restaurant and we will return next time we are in Vegas and want some tasty Thai food.

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crazy pad Thai duck
Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp pineapple and ginger

xG8pJIsMqw0fYv6fWOXrfg.text: This place has all the classic Thai dishes down. Whether it be curry or noodles or soup they definitely have it down. The setting is nice with the water pond in the middle. Only complaint I have is that it is pretty pricey. $22 for a soup or small portion of pad Thai didn't seem quite worth it.

5EPu82baDnpUxy3SqvMPyQ.text: I mainly eat home made Thai from the wife or in-laws so I only once in a while go out the house to eat it. An when I do, I never have high expectations. This place rock from the waiters to the whole look and feel of the restaurant. The food was amazing. Little on the pricey side for me to become a regular but I will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wifey likes the drinks

46xZWP6J-WD0b5C6rBHOYA.text: Poor service and mediocre food.  Due to food allergies and lactose intolerance we had a pretty specific order, and unfortunately our waitress didn't follow through with any of our requests. The pad thai arrived first, covered with peanuts, so that had to be taken back right away since my guest preferred not to make a trip to the hospital. Then the tom yum soup arrived, and surprise, surprise, they still added milk! Luckily my guests had some lactaid pills with them, so they popped those instead of waiting for a new order. This restaurant also charges you for rice- we ordered a large, the waitress brought out a small. We also got pho tai and garlic chicken, but like the other 2 dishes, they were nothing special. Needless to say, I won't be returning.

fe-ZD1DN7uBGcnBuOZ1eug.text: If we had stopped eating after our appetizers, I would have given this place 5 stars! Both of our appetizers were off- the - charts yummy!  They have the best crab Rangoon I've ever tasted...and the chili jam added another dimension of great to the plate! We also got the honey walnut shrimp, which was amazing!  Then came the short ribs, which really had an amazing flavor, but they were  dry and there was quite a bit of grissle to cut off.  Next came the holy basil seafood, which had a nice amount of  good seafood and basil in it, but no remarkable flavor. The menu states that it has a spicy basil sauce, but it was not spicy at all. It was very bland.  Also, worth mentioning is that nothing comes with rice. They charge you extra if you want rice, which I found strange, considering that their menu items are pretty pricey to begin with.  All in all, it was a fun evening, since we stopped in to see the dueling piano show on our way out, but I don't think I would make a special trip back there for the food.

G2IC_nby1urzcPyYCYEKhw.text: Delicious!! Used the Groupon with no issues.  My friend had the dumplings for an appetizer. Right after we ordered I went to the bathroom to wash my hands and by the time I came back he had already been served and had eaten all the dumplings because he said they were so good. I had the Malay curry and walnut shrimp. Food was delicious and served quickly. You could choose the level of spiciness. I don't like spicy at all and had mine at a #1 which was perfect for me. My friend had his at a level III and said that it was exactly what he was expecting. It is slightly pricey but in terms of Vegas standard it's pretty baseline. Definitely recommend. Great ambience.

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Restaurant

NpP4Rtd0-KGudjJ66XFnDg.text: The food is very good and I've been here each time I've come to Vegas. Love Thai food, I docked them a star because they have no beer to go with the food. They wear shirts advertising "Chang" beer, ironically they have no Chang beer Leo beer or any other Asian beer. How hard is it to carry one of these to go with the good food.

sDEPwt3dEe2P-37n1gIQQQ.text: The interior of the restaurant is spectacular. It's very serene and calming. We bought a groupon and it's totally worth it considering the entree prices. We kind of ordered family style so we could try all the dishes we ordered. We made a reservation beforehand and ever seated us away from the main dining area. Our room had a TV in it. Service was good as well even while we were tucked away.   The rib eye salad was incredible. The dressing matches well with the fresh greens. It had a hint of spice which I really enjoyed which I didn't expect. And the meat was cooked beautifully with lots of flavor while still tender.  The fried calamari was my next favorite. It had a dipping marinara sauce that was kind of sweet... maybe something like honey was added to it. It worked really well with the crispy calamari. Beware of the fried chili pepper because it will be very spicy!!!  The pineapple fried rice was great as well. But I could tell that they didn't use fresh cut pineapple. It seemed like canned pineapple. It was still enjoyable.  The Tom yum soup had lots and lots of seafood. I only wish the base was a bit tangier and spicier. It was a lot for an order of the soup.   Our table ordered the Pad Thai and the drunken man noodles. I thought they were okay... nothing crazy amazing about them but I still ate them.

yYQ0-5KmBOgysOPuULfLuA.text: This is pretty much a speakeasy. Vegetarian friendly!   If you're indian and you're with your family, they'll love this place.    Every dish was so delicious, great portions, great price, aesthetic on point, and  the location is pretty central. If you're craving affordable thai food that has high quality, this is your place baby   Location - This is located in Bailey's  i believe and is near the restaurants, near the food court

tU0Hz1-biaMs-TxQRSB3tA.text: Veggie Spring Rolls..delicious! Duck Confit with noodles prepared perfectly..seafood combo tasty and perfect spice..and with a Groupon it was well worth it

2mgmx1ldMcqG9jjiDA2K5g.text: Four stars for everything but price.  It's funny they say fusion because it's not.  It's a Thai place with a slightly nicer than normal pond side table experience.    With that said the portions were generous.  I would say a couple could do a salad.  An app.  And an entree and share for about 60.  The seafood was particularly good.    There are tons of Groupon offers  though so buy one before you dine.  You basically get an app for free if you do.   Chicken lettuce wrap was best app for 15.   It's expensive but not outrageous if you are craving Thai and in the area.

Cu3o9KqsHzmPsIxFnu55sg.text: This place almost has it all: attentive staff, beautiful views, and of course fantastic food. I've been to Thailand and I can say, SEA knows what they are doing. Homemade noodles and sauces, and just the right flavors. They do cater to a more American palate when it comes to spice level however, so ask for it hot if you like it Thai spicy! My only True complaint is the price. It's a bit expensive for what it is, but of course it's on the strip, so not much can be expected in that way. The pad see ew was fantastic as it is it fairly difficult to find homemade rice noodles. I would definitely return!

jlrtyTilhQGFRLAYplHxYQ.text: We were staying in Bally's and used a Groupon for this restaurant.  We absolutely loved the variety of the menu items and everything we ordered was fresh, made with quality ingredients. It seems like you need to know to look for this restaurant as it is a little hidden within the hotel. That made it easy to get in for a reservation though which was to our benefit. Well worth putting this on your list!

qEiUoga0U-IFV9CKFZHwrw.text: Decent food, horrifying prices. We came here only because we were seeing a show around here. We were craving Thai food, and this seemed nice. We sat down, to find mood lighting and a fountain. This is when we started to question our decision to come here.   Their prices were astonishing, but not in a good way. It was 9 dollars for a bowl of rice! Rice! I ordered Chicken Pad See Eew, and it came in a small portion. It costed over 20 dollars for a noodle dish that was mostly vegetables.   For 6 dishes and some rice, it was over 250 dollars, disgusting. Only come here if you are really rich, or extremely desperate for Thai food.

vxBw13XFAhB4yC5xkjdKHg.text: We waited about 10-15min before anyone even came out from the back area, other people were dining as well and I noticed they had empty waters etc. After finally being greeted and seated I was very confused as the first sever marked my groupon as redeemed even before I had ordered. Not used to that. Then another lady came and took our orders. We tried two appetizer dumplings, seafood pho and the volcanic chicken. The appetizers came out with great presentation and had really great flavor! Very authentic. My pho had a TON on actual meat and amazing broth. The volcanic chicken was a little less impressive in my opinion but was still good. After we finished the server brought or check with the groupon applied, I informed her the other sever who sat us down had already redeemed the groupon. She disappeared for awhile and came back with a corrected bill. Overall this place was nice and had a cool atmosphere but I think it was a little overpriced and the service was lacking. If i was in town again I don't think I would come back.

Q3Ph49Wy5Ht94oiTkMJ6Rg.text: I stopped in on a whim. Service was reasonably quick. I had chicken satay and fried garlic prawns. The food was excellent. The chicken was tender and juicy and the peanut sauce had some chunky peanut bits in it and the right level of sweetness. The prawns were monstrously huge, but perfectly cooked with a nice crunchy coating and a nice sweet sauce around the plate.  Fair warning, the menu looks a little pricy, but from what I can tell, it's justified.   Next time I'm on the strip I'll make time to come back.

UKMA5gQc31xgVynMFh9pEQ.text: I came here because it was relatively convenient. I ordered Pad Thai. It was easily the worst Pad Thai I've ever had.   I will also point out that if you are gluten intolerant, you should avoid this restaurant. Their menu is conveniently marked with gluten free items. That's a plus. Unfortunately, they've marked items that are definitely NOT gluten free (e.g. egg noodles, which are made from wheat) as being safe to eat. Then they marked items with rice noodles as being not gluten free. It's pretty clear these people do not understand what gluten is, so you cannot trust any guidance they might give for eating choices.

nRt28GM1pTEzNMGgEuRKlw.text: Loved this place 3 years back. Came for dinner again today and it was still excellent. Great flavours and delicious food. What a pleasant change from whatever else one can find at the strip. Ps. Do try their massaman curry, you'll love it!

KsKMniNhxvZu6CmO366Q5Q.text: Found this place on Yelp. We didn't make reservations but it was a Wednesday night in April so we just walked in. We were seated right away. The ambiance is simple yet elegant. They have a cool reflective pond with built in tables around it. Fairly traditional menu. Almost everything was under $30. The waitress came to take our drink order shortly after we sat down. Then took our food order. We started with the Coconut Spring rolls (4) and I ordered the cashew stir fry with chicken and my SO ordered the massaman curry with chicken. You can order your spicy level from 1-5.  5 being Thai spicy, so we both ordered a level 4.   The coconut spring rolls tasted fresh and crunchy. Very hot (temp). Let them cool first! I thought the dipping sauce had fresh flavor but was not very flavorful (if that makes sense).   My SO though that it might be dragonfruit sauce.  The massaman curry had a flavorful curry broth with chunks of potato and onion and a fair amount of chicken. Very flavorful, really liked it. On the spice level, it was a little on the mild side.   Cashew stir fry was also very flavorful but had no spice, even though I ordered a level 4. We got some sauces on the side which were really yummy and spiced things up a bit.   We didn't have room for dessert (so sad) but we really enjoyed eating here. I recommend this place if you like Thai food.

XfuXhay5SkfPM5Xy4EiwkQ.text: Limited Thai food options on the strip, not far from where I'm staying (Planet Hollywood). Price is a little higher than most Thai places, but the taste is delicious. Ordered the cashew nut tofu, very filling and the amount of cashews and tofu used was on point. I'll definitely be back! Averages around $30 per person.

mvseJJ957DpYAg4zWtIbow.text: The server was helpful and friendly.  She recommended the new appetizer, Golden Crab roll and it was great. I had the Black Noodle with duck and it was very tasty. My companions ordered the duck confit and the Bangkok Panang Curry at a 4 hotness.  Both dishes looked wonderful. The curry was a little hot but good. The duck confit was declared wonderful.   The reason I didn't give this 5 stars is the music was awful. Oldies played too loud. Some softer Thai music would have made it 5 stars.

l8ScJeuwXo2Ftr38bU9Fbw.text: Their website, Groupon AND their door state that they close at 12 midnight. However, the time was 10:45p.m. when we arrived. The place was empty, but after waiting to be seated, like their host desk asks, I went looking for someone to help us since we had been waiting for about 10 minutes without any signs  of being helped or even acknowledged. When I found somebody they told me they were closed. When I told them online and their door say they close at midnight, the waiter said, "Oh, yeah, but it was slow today so we closed early!" SOOOO... Now I'm stuck with a Groupon for a restaurant that made such a bad first impression that I dont even want to go to now! Ugh! Definitely a "Thai Experience" to remember. What a waste!

KiOFDHk2G8ZrfTayRVlUwg.text: This place was so good! First night in Vegas and didn't know where to go, so I figured I'd take a stab at a Groupon spot. It was deal, but I'd have gladly paid full price.  We got the soft shell crab and calamari appetizers and the entrees were the Thai basil beef fried rice and the ginger scallops stir fry. It was so tasty! I asked about sauces and they were kind enough to bring out three. The peanut sauce and the Thai chili sauces were amazing. The portions were large so we had plenty to take home and enjoy later too!  We may very well go back again during this trip. The service was so attentive and they were really kind!   Definitely stop here for great authentic Thai food

xIFhJANJF_3kYRLE1dTD8w.text: I went here for dinner months ago, before seeing The Killers in concert. We had a Groupon deal and had a fantastic dinner with wonderful service.  We both ordered the Pad Thai. I know there are other options that might be more authentic and less expected, but I love pad Thai and theres was great. The servings were more than we could eat though.  In normal circumstances, I would take home the leftovers, but we had a long night ahead of us.  I wish I had written this review earlier, because I remember having appetizers that were delicious but I can't remember what they were.   I would definitely go back, even at full price.

fvhZMclCYGRJFLrZSK1DWA.text: Went to this place with my family during our last night at Vegas. It's all the way in the back of Bally's casino. I was a bit overwhelmed that we had to traversed up the escalator, into this building that isn't super well lit, and down the escalators again to reach like a shopping strip and the casino. Then had to walk all the way towards the back to find this restaurant tucked in the back and around the other restaurants. Oh and they don't have bathrooms, so you have to find your way around the maze of the casino, but if it's easier, just walk along the walls and you'll find one.   We got a Groupon if $69 for $100 worth of food, which was great since every dish is about $22. We ended up ordering 5 dishes (1 noodle, 1 rice, 1 veggie, 1 curry, and 1 appetizer), 2 side dishes, a couple of drinks, and it was enough for a party of 6. Mind you though, the portions were rather small but we managed to get ourselves full. Perhaps because we weren't really hungry? They also charge 20% tip for parties over 5.  Overall the food was okay. The curry and the egg noodles were probably my favorite. I did think that it was overpriced for the quantity and the type of food. They say they're a Thai fusion place but didn't see any "fusion".  The servers were nice and came to check up on us often and the restaurant had a calm ambiance, there is a pond in the middle with lotus flowers!  Would come again if the Groupon is available.

Eyt53kgAOO2gbiWBL2zvxQ.text: I've visited the original Sea in Brooklyn, NY so while in Vegas I had to stop in to check out the new location inside Ballys. We purchased a Groupon for 2 apps and 2 entrees and it was well worth it.   We had coconut shrimp and the chicken/shrimp fried dumplings for apps. Both were very tasty though the coconut shrimp had a little too much breading and was fried a little too hard. But enjoyable nonetheless.  My husband's sizzling mixed seafood combo was very good although couldve used a sauce to compliment the dish. My short ribs and mixed greens salad was great! I received 4 huge pieces of ribs and a nice sauce to dip on the side. They were seasoned really well and very juicy.

vlwreYvBT_bweTgDZH2nAA.text: Order Queen of Basil with Chicken. Big portion, it is quiet different than Chicken or Pork with basil leaf original but it is acceptable. Service is lovely, restaurant decor is nice.

bKj1-izZNHtxWNm9wrb79g.text: So my experience here was in my book...5 stars. The service was super friendly, and the food was excellent! Sure it's pricey, but SO WHAT, your in Las Vegas- that's to be expected. I either put the extra $10 bucks towards a delicious meal or give it to a slot and get nothing in return. For me, it's as simple as that

Pat, you have done a wonderful job!!!  I really recommend to try Crab meat fried rice. You won't regret.

wqrkQ0UZOiR7Q96zvGvuRQ.text: Wish I could have tried the food to rate accordingly. Unfortunately for me, I chose to drive down and walk through Bally's to be turned away an hour before closing because "it was slow." How 'bout you post closing times earlier and stay open if you're busy. Way better, late-night, thai food across the street at Thai St Cafe anyway.

Io1KVP20fc_ze-yIUWPCFQ.text: The food was decent. Having a China town around the corner I was not too impressed but hey: it was ok food. However what ticked me off big time is an automatically added 20% gratuity for a party of 2. Haven't seen that in a while. I get automatic gratuity for larger parties, makes sense. But for a table of 2?

FD88aDu24KfWEjxpJ_BgxQ.text: We used the Groupon for two people, which with a 20% coupon ended up costing $39 for $78 worth of food. We made a same-day reservation and had a seat next to the pond. We both thought the restaurant was beautiful. Our server was very attentive and always within sight if we needed something.   My husband got the panang curry and loved it. I had the chicken pad thai and also loved that. I'm not sure if we went on a better night than some of the other reviewers, but my husband and I were both thrilled with the experience. We did not order drinks so cannot speak to those.  We are heading back to Vegas in September and just purchased another Groupon for this restaurant. Looking forward to it hopefully living up to the first experience.

5uLBadfq6pmWOuyitQWrBQ.text: My favorite restaurant in Ballys. Been waiting to come back here since my last trip to Vegas. The dumplings and pineapple fried rice are the best.

bXcvCiAnrcyYgc55oUBm4g.text: Wow, the food is excellent! Truly spicy if you want it that way and everything was delicious.  Good service as well, highly recommend

T5gObi1ZDNnP-eS3hnnrvA.text: Delicious food great atmosphere no long waits like some vegas restaurants. Make sure the buy the groupon

PFL9o2j7kflA2Tolh6m1oA.text: This is the most average Thai place I've ever been to, and I've eaten in Thai restaurants in New York, New Jersey, and California. I had the Panang Curry (my Thai litmus dish), and it was tasty, but too salty. My boyfriend had a fried scallop dish, and it was also too salty. The drinks were okay. This is not the most authentic Thai you can get in Vegas. The food is overpriced, the service is a little slow, and the atmosphere is so-so. If you want a real Thai experience, check out Lotus of Siam.

-Kp4M1hq9qSDD4keFIfnUQ.text: Three big reasons this place knocked it out of the park, IMO: 1) I had an incredible spicy seafood salad with squid, octopus, shrimp, scallion, cilantro, some kind of funky-lacy-semi-rubbery mushroom that I'd never seen or tasted before, lime-hot pepper dressing, and a few other things.  Without a doubt the best salad I have ever tasted, just bursting with fresh flavor. 2) With that, as a perfect complement, I enjoyed coconut shrimp that was sweet, crispy, and cooked just right. 3) Finally, my dining companion had  Pad Thai, which he said was boring.  This is a True sign of Thai cuisine perfection, because anyone with taste buds and some dining experience knows that Pad Thai is basically a boring dish.  It's Thai comfort food, and usually, when prepared in the traditional way, is less exciting than a good meat loaf.  The restaurant was also very elegant and pretty in an understated way, and our server was very friendly and efficient.  This place is on my go-to list for Vegas dining.

kkHrIkvzE7YFYoSyi-ChMg.text: Great customer service!!!!!   Okay I recommend to get the Drunken men noodles, it has a mix of mango, tomatoes, green and red peppers and the noodles is not your typical string noodles they are thin wide if hat makes sense. If you are in Vegas and are in the mood of Thai food come here it's inside the Bally's hotel all the way to far end of the floor. I hope this helps.

hXKd4savYVcygFj8bfM8aQ.text: I was skeptical, as I eat a lot of Thai food... a lot, but I was pleasantly surprised!  The staff are all super friendly from the moment that they greet you at the door until you leave. The food is very good! I had black noodles  (pad see ewe) and they were great! That is saying something,  because I am picky. My husband's drunken noodles wete also great.   My only complaint is the price. I order Pad see ewe all the time.  It usually ranges between  $7-$12, depending on where you are. When we got our receipt,  we were floored. It was $21 per plate! That is a ridiculous amount. I'd give 5 stars if the price weren't so high, in fact, I may change my rate to a 3, because the price was that astronomical. It was no different from great Thai food in my neighborhood,  even the higher end restaurants. Why, then, did I pay double?

bBxvmIZz-kayDxEftQDJkQ.text: Worst food experience at Vegas at a pretty steep price. To top it off, both me and my husband fell sick after eating here.  The chicken satay was bland and cold. We asked the chicken massaman curry to be spicy and what came was a flavor less curry with dollops of red chili powder mixed in from the top. That probably caused us to fall sick. The fried rice was barely passable.   Even the service was slow and lackluster. Please stay away from this place.

pngY0G_g8XfOpZR-RS7avg.text: My cousins and I decided to try this restaurant out as it was inside of Bally's and we wanted Thai food. We made reservations. We specifically told them that we have two wheelchair bound individuals and will need extra space. They sat us in the middle of the restaurant with many tables surrounding us. Not giving anyone much room to move around. If someone was sitting behind you-- you could touch their backs. Minus 1 star. While we were waiting for the rest of our party, we had asked for the bill split per table-- they said they would accommodate that.   As we all placed our orders, the restaurant got a little busier. We slowly started to feel like the waiters were not as attentive as they should have been. When we all got our food, we noticed that several of our dishes were incorrect but with the length of time to get our food most of us just dealt with it. Minus 1 star. I have a food allergy and they did not list what they used as garnish on the dishes. When I received my dish, it had mangoes on it--I am allergic to mangoes, and asked them to cook a new batch. Which they did and the food came out promptly. Minus only 1/2 of a star.   The food was subpar for the price we paid for it. The best tasting items in my opinion were the appetizers. No one was wowed by any of the mains. Many of the group struggled to eat their food as the found it to be bland or too spicy. They did not ask each individual how spicy they wanted their food. Minus half a star.   When we asked for the bill, the host and a waiter both said they would get it to us shortly. 15 minutes go by and we still don't have a bill. We finally ask again for a bill and we receive one large bill. Once we received it we notice it was not split the way we asked them to but we're already irritated with the service that we didn't bother. Minus a star. We changed the tip from the automatically charged gratuity as we felt the service did not match what we felt it should be for a "gourmet" restaurant.   This was honestly the first restaurant via Yelp that a lot of the reviews said it was poor service and subpar food and I actually agreed with it. Sorry Sea, you were not the Thai experience I was expecting.

wuEieVEDxEKHJBUGSkDrtA.text: Hangover cure? Vietnamese Pho.. Was told that there was a restaurant in Caesars Palace. My feet weren't really in the mood to walk that far. So I started searching Yelp & landed across this review! Which was great because I was about to settle for Tacos. You get what you pay for! The service was amazing! The Pho Thai Chin, was pretty plain.. But all in all it was really good especially when you are craving for it! The deep fried meat & veggie spring rolls were more then just good! It was awesome! Totally would recommend it!

RidbcPI98A0_6235LnRFSg.text: Good food and good friendly services. Definitely coming back when we come back to Vegas since we love the Paris Hotel.

MhaheG2kchDHlwrIAVaBUQ.text: Taste is amazing! Had the Red Island Curry and it was the best I've ever had. Volcanic Chicken also very good. Don't like that rice does not come with any of the entres but a minor detail. Must have spot in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CLgXzqqLP95NDDKoqSlzXA.text: This is a decent little Thai place located in Bally's Hotel/Casino.  It's not the cheapest meal you'll find in Vegas, but it's competitively priced at least. I'd say the menu is 40% seafood, 40% "landfood", and 20% noodle bowls or soups.  So there's a decent variety for everyone.  I had the Pad Thai with tofu ($23).  I ordered spice level 4 out of 5 and it wasn't very spicy.  It has the usual ingredients, rice noodles, bean sprouts, peanuts, peanut sauce, etc. that you would expect to find in a traditional pad thai dish.  The tofu was cooked to a slightly nice crisp, so it wasn't soft and mushy - and they included plenty of it.  The Holy Basil Seafood Combo ($28) was a very decent serving size.  It included steamed tilapia, shrimp, scallops, squid, and plenty of mussels, drizzled in a spicy basil sauce.  Rice is not included with either of these dishes - a small order of jasmine rice is $3.  Bottled domestic beer $7, bottled import or craft beer is $8.  All in all, it was a very nice dining experience.  Courteous staff, not too loud, and not very crowded.  One final note - if you have your credit card tied to your Yelp account, they offer 3% cash back to your card. But Yelp changed the rules somewhere along the line and you now have to click "activate" on the business page before swiping your card.  So obviously, I didn't get the discount.  It used to be automatic - all you would have to do is use your connected card.  ProTip - if you find one of the several ticket sales joints in Vegas called Tix4Tonight, buy their yellow discount card.  It's $3 for the one that covers discounts on the buffets, but I got one that just covered discounts on restaurants and it was free.  I was able to use it here to get 20% off the total bill.

JpNI3UYa_U0OZC5p9ll_Ng.text: Came here for lunch a week ago.   They had just opened.  It was beautifully decorated in an Asian style.     As we walked in, there was no one in the front.  But quickly, we were greeted by a sweet young lady with a pleasant smile.  She sat us near the beautiful statue at the middle water feature.  The bench seats don't look like benches.   It's a great design and very comfortable.  There's a certain feeling of tranquility initially.   Then when they turned on music (not loud which is great), it doesn't match the decor.  I was hoping for some Thai music in the background but it was soft rock.  We ordered... Thai iced tea Crab meat fried rice Island red curry (vegetables)  Although we didn't order much, the portions were big and we didn't finish our lunch.  Everything was fresh and delicious!  That delicious smell of the food was intoxicating.   Although we were full in the end, we kept reaching into the plates for another little bite.  Yeah,  that good!!!  The crab fried rice was incredible.   The fried rice portion was on the bottom and the lump crab mix with the rice was placed on top of the rice.  I liked that so we don't miss the crab.  The crab was very fresh and delicious.   Our server Ray Jai and the young man that brought our food were both very attentive, pleasant and professional.   We'll definitely be back to try other curries but will definitely order the crab fried rice again!

X8tU4XRR3h_AF9fCO3Waxw.text: Wondering about the level of Thai food in LV? Look no further. The chicken was moist, the lettuce was crisp, the appetizers and entrees were spot-on perfection. This might be in Bally's, but the food quality is 5 star!

eCymJTni___tIwGGauX6Xg.text: My aunt and cousin were visiting and they were staying at Bally's where this restaurant is located. I wanted Asian food so we ended up here. I would recommend making reservations since the place is small. When we arrived around 7.30 pm, we were promptly seated as the restaurant wasn't packed. As mentioned earlier, the restaurant is located inside of Bally's and it's kind of hidden away from the casino's crowd and noise which was a plus.  The decor is chic and the little pond in the center is extremely soothing. The menu shows a broad range of entrees and appetizers. The server made several adjustments to our orders. We had a Seafood hot pot, another seafood dish and an Eggplant dish. The food was very delicious, fresh and flavorful. It was overpriced for what it is but that's the price you pay for dining at The Strip. Overall, I am impressed with their ambiance, food and service.

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States

X5uiPbHTXbPI2S681MvxEA.text: Don't sleep on this restaurant! Just had an amazing meal! The ambiance is gorgeous and has a pond in the center that you can sit around. But the highlight was the food. We had shrimp pad tai and chicken curry dishes. Sooooo delicious! The restaurant is located at the back of Bally's and you can definitely miss it if you're not looking for it. We will be back and hope others will patronize it as well so they will be in business for a long time!

-XWg7R-vOyebIfZVgNUftw.text: We made a reservation for late dinner on a Saturday night. When we arrived we were promptly seated as the restaurant only had a few diners. The restaurant is located inside of Bally's and it's kind of tucked away. With all the happenings, lights, music, crowds outside the restaurant, I could see how one could easily just walk past it without noticing it.  We had a drink each and ordered the honey walnut shrimp and the coconut spring rolls as appetizers. For the main dishes we had pad thai and pineapple fried rice. We shared everything.  Overall service was prompt and the food is decent but slightly overpriced for portion size and taste. Overall dining experience was ok. Technically I would give it a 3.5 stars.  If you're on the Strip nearby and craving Asian Fusion I would come here for takeout, but not necessarily dine in. I wouldn't go out of my way to come here.

eFZqn0bv2Cp0ScgqPXGkew.text: Came here for one of my birthday dinners and I was sooooo happy I did ! I was not disappointed! I loved  it. The food was amazing probably one of the best Thai places I've been to. The service was great they were attentive and fast, food came out quick to which was cool. Our meals were so amazing! So much flavor and they were nice and hot. Definitely would recommend to everyone and will be back !

IlgVxEKqKPx2gnJ7qh9LUg.text: Been here a few times and always consistently good. Not a huge place so be sure to make a reservation. We were greeted by friendly staff and immediately seated. Be sure to get the fried calamari..it's crispy and tender. I especially enjoy the tentacles  The pork dumpling skewers are delicious and I really like the sauce. We also had the shrimp and drunken noodles and the chicken curry. Both were good but not exceptional.  This restaurant is a bit pricey, but it is located on the strip at Bally's casino. We had a Groupon this time, so it was nice to save a bit. There are other places in Las Vegas that are less in price and better tasting, but this place is very convenient. I would definitely recommend and will go back and try a few other things!

eCfBTAqq_X70d-mo1u2Q8Q.text: Very good host, very friendly and very conservative. Food was amazing and the staff was friendly.

Wi6vUaEy83GixaHHV4h6tg.text: This is our 2nd groupon/visit in 2 years. Great value, especially if you're staying in Bally's & don't want fast junk food. I made reservations for lunch which turned out not to be necessary as there was only 2 other tables dining. The server wasn't sure how the groupon worked so we had to wait for the manager to explain it to us which took a bit of time considering they weren't busy. Food was good, service was good once we got beyond the logistics of the groupon. Ambiance/decor was nice w/ a fountain in the middle of the restaurant. 4 stars. We will be back next time!

7nCnF65y67LyrRU8_xVuXg.text: The food was delicious, I got the salmon and my husband got the duck, both were so perfectly cooked and the sauces underneath were to die for. It is my favorite restaurant in all of Vegas that we've tried. The service was also top notch, they help each other out the waiters and waitresses when it gets busy. So no one is waiting without service. The ambiance is also beautiful and different as you're sitting by this pond as you eat. I will be visiting again before we leave.

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A pond in the middle of the restaurant

P5VXxAV5STmj7_IF6Ubucw.text: We opted for salads and a shared entree. The ambiance is warm and inviting. Had I known about the Groupon deal in advance I would have taken advantage and made the dining experience worth while.  The decor is chic and the little pond in the center is extremely calming. There were several moments during our meal that we stopped talking to simply admire it. Kinda hypnotic now that I think of it.   Our Spicy seafood and rib eye salads were lip smacking delicious and the perfect size. Just enough to tease your appetite without making you too full and unable to enjoy the entree. The flavors really complimented each other. In the future I'd skip the entree and order 2 Spicy Seafood salads.   The entree, the Eat Your Greens stir fry, was a salty miss. We had to send it back after our server walked by several times and noticed we weren't eating it. It was way too salty and I initially didn't want to send it back bcz I hate doing that. The remake was ok but clearly watered down (literally). I think it was a premade sauce and there wasn't anything they could do about it.   Overall, it's a great dining experience but I'd suggest the groupon that's mentioned in the reviews bcz it would give more value and an opportunity to sample multiple dishes.

bVq3md_1hEuAgglumHIYjw.text: This restaurant is a hidden gem. Bally's and Paris have some good ones, but  Sea is a wonderful surprise. We bought the dinner for two Groupon and made a reservation. I had the lettuce wrap and my wife had the spring rolls as appetizers. For my main course I had the  Mixed seafood....and wow...so much of shrimp, scallops, fish, calamari...just amazing. My wife had the Duck Confit and loved it. Great value, comfortable, not loud, and great service. Overall, great experience.

sKF-V1t6GHrH6U_pDcmJvQ.text: Our family come to Vagas a few times a year. It was our first time at this restaurant and it was our most regretted decision ever! Pricy, small portion and salty! However, doesn't tasted too bad or we are just too hungry! Our first and also last time going there though!

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. An honest review to help my fellow travelers find a good and avoid a bad experience!

ni7T5Z-c9JoP5tlD2p93rg.text: Crab Rangoon is always excellent. Service was fantastic.   Portions are very large, diverse options for food choices.

g4pUGKdixv8FLU8NKUuxGw.text: Both times I visited Vegas, I visited Sea and I've got to say, it's comparable to the SEA Thai in New York!   It's conveniently located in the center of the strip inside of Bally's hotel, 1st floor. When you enter the restaurant, there's seating for about 50 guests or so (it is rather small so make sure to make a reservation). They immediately sit you down and are very efficient with taking the orders right away. Try to get a table next to the Buddha sculpture; it's the best view.   They've got a broad range of entrees and appetizers! My friends all got pad Thai and I got the beef ribs and my friends fought to try some of mine. NOT TODAY SATAN. These ribs are all mine. They were so juicy, tender, and it was a huge portion for just $27! The waiters are very sweet, they surprised me with a dessert platter for my birthday dinner there!   My only criticism is that the entrees are more on the expensive side for Thai food, but that's Vegas for you. Otherwise, 10/10 would recommend.

XsCHyc_XqS3I9F_mUurWpw.text: We eat at the Caesars family of hotel restaurants regularly and this is probably one of my favorites. We enjoy the Drunken man noodles, grilled short ribs, papaya salad and red curry. Be careful that you don't get a high spicy rating because it is spicy!

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Shrimp Fritters

RWPSLW8Fk6xtJEILVsrnIg.text: I enjoyed my food here. Yeah, the prices are a bit high, but you're in a Vegas hotel... I am not surprised. I really liked the soft shell crap curry and appetizer. The soft shell crab is huge, and crispy.. full of flavor! I would come back here again.   My only complaints are that they are understaffed and that the kitchen is very slow. They also forgot a few dishes, leaving some of our friends staring at our food. Otherwise, food tastes good.

08Q-F1x5RHcI8ec36DtD8A.text: Really good Thai food with a peaceful and enjoyable ambiance when dining.   Food was served quick and service was on point.  Def recommend if you're staying in Bally's/ Paris hotel.

lsiNMY62mc0rO0ZE1gYDJQ.text: Oh my!  This place is excellent. Food servicer was great. She went through the menu and explain spice levels. Glad she did. Nothing worst than overly spicy  food which can't be enjoyed. Food was served temperature correct. The setting of the restaurant was nice and calming. The water feature is nice but the space is tight. The location at Bally's was convenient to excess.
