8nOfbQ4GiAkEmvxZyTSRAA.text: Really tasty thai food, and lovely atmosphere with great service. The prices are a bit high, but it was nice to get away from the casino vibe and enjoy a calm meal. I will definitely go back.

S5u8CvBcCKw3uom_p5lpsA.text: Took my family here for dinner too... (besides the nasty and expensive buffet).  This place was very expensive for the foods that they serve.  Not sure why people like this place.  I'm so tired of all these fake paid reviews.... You better off go out of the strip to China town or Asian plazas for some real asian foods and save a lot of money... =(  I hate yelp now...

juJjp4m2LQcAF6RBCOrqHw.text: Decent Thai food, albeit overpriced (but it's Vegas, to be expected). Was a bit disappointed that they asked how spicy I wanted my food and instead of cooking it in that spice level just gave me a side of the spicy sauce. Drunken noodles were good though.

cuV4ef6o2CXnYKnE2bA6xQ.text: This place was pretty good! They have Thai and Vietnamese options. I always try the basics when I try a new Asian restaurant. I ordered the Pho Tai (rare steak) and my hubs ordered the Chicken Phad Thai. Doesn't get any easier than this. EVERYTHING was delicious! My Pho came with a VERY GENEROUS serving of broth, noodles and rare steak. On the side I was given bean sprouts, basil and jalapenos. I had to ask for a serving of their chili sauces, and they were a perfect addition. I couldn't get enough. I was stuffed to the brim and still had leftovers. My hubs loved his phad thai. Perfect combination of sweet, spicy and peanutty-ness. The ambiance was very mellow and chill. Very modern Asian feel. Our booth was in a corner so had to slide all the way over to get some privacy from the booth right next to us. They had some fresh roses placed on the tables and fake candles to add to the mood. Seating was comfortable. BUT this place is a little PRICY. Ok, a lot pricy. My Pho was a whopping $15, and my hubs Phad Thai was $17 even though he asked them to hold the shrimp in his dish. I think if someone requests to withhold a major ingredient the price should be lesson (like an easy $2 less or something). It's located in the Bally's Casino and Hotel next to a Steak House and Cantina. Would probably not go again just because of the price. I can get delicious thai or vietnamese food anywhere else for half the price that I paid here. ENJOY - 'cause I DID! :)

knYxKUxZ-z-DgWxCRuFrgA.text: We were vacationing in Vegas, and had a craving for Thai food.  This was pretty close to where we were staying so we tried it out for lunch.  I would say the food was delicious.  We really enjoyed it.  The only reason it doesn't get more stars is the service.  We ordered appetizers, and the main meal came out first.  We also felt the service was not so attentive.  It wasn't really that busy when we got there, and though it picked up a little bit later, I don't think they really came around to see how we were doing,  if we needed anything else.  Also, it was quite expensive (for Thai food), but the ambience and environment were nicer than other places we go for Thai, so that's the tradeoff.

ld2MkuLldDa0ETSveYFYiw.text: This place should get a good review just for the pomegranate mojito alone. Holy. Freaking. Delicious. It was another really late night in Vegas, we took a cab back from old Vegas and decided to have them drop us off at a random spot on the strip to find some dinner. It was close to midnight but Sea was open and there was a decent crowd in there still. The decor is beautiful and tranquil, much needed, especially after spending the evening in old Vegas. The service was quick and pleasant and the suggestion for me to try the pomegranate mojito was perfect. The menu was a little confusing at first until I realized one side is the Thai side and the other is the Vietnamese side. For dinner I had spicy noodles with chicken. It was OK. I asked for medium spice level but it really tasted like there was not spice at all. I was in the mood for something spicy so that was a little disappointing. The prices weren't bad at all and I left with a satisfied belly.

_tbhFqgQyF6LbofkxfXqwg.text: We ordered 2 dishes - one came warm, the other came cold. The rice also came cold. We told the waitress and she took the food back, only to return with both luke warm.  The manager stood on a chair to put candles on the wall, but never wiped it off. Everything was overpriced. Any other restaurant would be half the price. Nice people, but very unprofessional. No, I will not return.

ePp8SRBD7OfqtAhbUG1dkQ.text: absolutely lethargic, inexcusable and pathetic service, take ur money somewhere else, after 20 mins of waiting t the table there was no sign if service, even after complaining to the person in charge nothing changed, seriously expect people to shell $16 per dish with this sort if sloppy service..one of our worst experiences at a thai restaurant ever.

sC3vPbzJKuSuYegxOnbecw.text: We tried it based on Yelp reviews, and are we ever glad that we did!  My husband ordered the Pad Thai and asked for level 3 and the Papaya Salad at level 5 - "Thai hot".  I ordered the sauteed vegetables with garlic sauce (came with rice on the side) at heat level 3.  We loved what we ordered, although I will admit that next time I will order heat/spiciness level 2 for myself.  I have to commend them:  the spiciness was not just "hot for hot's sake", but had real depth of flavor.  I will also say that the mango smoothie we had for dessert was the perfect calming point for my palate.  The restaurant was peaceful, lovely.  We were at a bench/table.  One really neat feature:  There was a large group dining in the side area and there are pivoting glass divider panels that the staff used that really cut down on sound transmission.  What a great thing to have.  I agree with other postings, it is not inexpensive, but I thought it was good value for the quality of food, service, ambiance and location.  We will return the next time we are near Bally's

6rBr5T5YSjbiHAVW5_HOug.text: Wow.  Great ambiance, food and service.  I don't give 5 stars unless its truly deserved.

aY84sRS9nFUvhSR-56yUpA.text: I actually thought this was really good! I had the basil chicken. Yum! My husband didn't think his pad Thai was hot enough, even though he asked for five in spice level. He ended up asking for Thai peppers. He was happy then. He is used to thai hot so....

LiypG1zgbDBjQ10I3saBjg.text: I took a group of 11 to this Thai restaurant this last Sunday, January 15th around 6:30. We were all in the mood for Thai and since this restaurant was able to seat us we were happy.  When we arrived at the table we were short a seat and asked for another one as there was an entire table in our area that didn't have a seat at it but it was connected to our row of tables. We waited 10 minutes for the seat while one of our the people in our group stood and talked to everyone. We then asked for another seat again and nothing came for another 5 minutes. We then just took a seat from another patrons table once they said they weren't using it.   It turns out we were probably better off going to In and Out Burger. The food was "ok" if you ignore the fact that they switched the spice on my dish and gave me 5 stars instead of one and my friend received no stars. After we covered my friends dish in hot sauce I asked for a replacement because they switched the spice.     The waiter said he would, then asked if I would like some chicken dumplings while I waited and I said that would be great. I then didn't see the waiter for a bit. He finally came by and said he didn't bring my dumplings because I received tofu with my meal, he wasn't sure if I was a vegetarian. Except that I did say I would like chicken dumplings. After he walked away I then motioned for his attention and asked what else I could be compensated with since my meal was still not there and my party was almost done eating. He asked if I wanted a drink, I said yes then I waited 10 more minutes. I then asked the waiter where the drink was and he said he'd check on it. He found the drink at someone else's table. He then remade my drink and instead of a mojito I received an ice syrup drink that was disgusting.  On top of all of this, my final meal was not all that great.    Once we all put our cards in to pay for the waiter, I asked for change or to tell me if we were short cash. He already had an 18% gratuity on the bill. He then returned 5 minutes later and said we were square. I did the math and we were actually over $50 dollars of the owed bill.    So, in the end here is what we experienced:  1. Bad service 2. Weak drinks 3. Hard to find seating. 4. Non-responsive staff 5. Bland food 6. Could not get the spice right 7. Did not compensate for mistakes 8. Overcharged and was dishonest

kd3NHaCLfWcWxXN3i9XwHA.text: Techno-clubby music (loud too), smoke from the casino, and high prices are jarring notes to this otherwise decent restaurant in Bally's casino. I've had the red curry and the pho ga. Both were good, the curry having a good amount of heat as requested, but the 18$ for each entree was on the high side of what it should have been.  The pho ga broth seeemed overly salty and oily.  If you have to eat here, its OK, but if you have a car, go visit a real Thai place.

7f6p6XwZNdssFD6vojhoBQ.text: Had the duck curry - mediocre at best.  I guess I'm spoiled by all the great Thai food in SoCal and Minnesota.

Tritb5OXKuMRCdct87WPiQ.text: Like some of the other reviewers here, I thought the appetizer set the bar high and the entree did not quite reach it.  We had the coconut spring rolls and they came with an amazing sauce.  They really were quite delicious.    For an entree I had the ginger/pineapple chicken, and my wife had the mango dish.  Both were good, but nothing special.  The service was excellent, and the decor was very nice.  The title for 3 stars is perfect, it was A-OK.

vsBkPZ8ChMVz0Mh_XA0-5g.text: Food came out 30 to 40 min later and the whole fish never came. Took forever to sit us as well even though no one was in line.  Pad tai taste worst than middle planet

xvBVw3A_3uetgztj0YjJTA.text: Food....mmmm...yum.  the decor...so cute!  i loved the water features and the bubble chairs!  The food was great and the service perfect.  Very attentive.  We stopped in for a quick lunch before exploring Vegas.  We too ran into it by accident.  score one for SEA!

MxaAsKpzlXOxThY8brN3rQ.text: Nothing to write home about! Poor service and the herb fried rice was just ok. Will not recommend this place. There may be other better options...

2CZAQORiEZt55uQEPT2E1A.text: no recommend the pangnan curry, a little bit salty for me, but their lobster is pretty good! i also ordered the combo seafood, but so so~the atmosphere is excellent

m5_77kIVMil4ZUyqVf-GxQ.text: My husband and I both got curry. He got the red curry and I the panang. The dishes were both very tasty, can't complain about the flavor. However, although the chicken in the center of the dish was hot, the sauce was spread out over a large plate and so was quite cold by the time it reached our table. Also, desert wasn't all that great. We got the golden banana roll, which was somewhat dry. Additionally, it was served with a raspberry sauce, which was incredibly salty! When we asked the server if the raspberry sauce was salted, it turned out she didn't know anything about the dessert at all and went to the kitchen to ask. She returned, saying that the sauce is NOT salted, that the cooks tasted the sauce and said it was fine. This is impossible, as the sauce was saltier than cup-a-noodle soup! I think they may have made a batch with salt instead of sugar. Next time we go, we'll skip dessert!

0c4DrY0-OHUbdt1CrXcZyA.text: This place was a nice surprise. We were looking for the steak house next door and Sea caught our eye. The place is small but the ambiance is nice. Wooden booths sit level with the indoor pond. The duck lettuce wraps were tasty and plenitful. We ordered our entrees spicy and they came out with no spice.  I thought thai food was supposed to be spicy to begin with? After sending the food back, it was finished correctly and had plenty of spice. Great taste and more than enough to fill up one person per plate. The service was good. The server was very polite, attentive and knowledgable of the cuisine. The manager even stopped by to check on us a couple of times. The bartender delivered our drinks and was very helpful with suggesting cocktails. Overall, this is a good place for beginners in ethnic food. Not too spicy and great taste with a helpfull staff.

hSSe2bA7rbPl-HA6kCSEDg.text: We ordered coconut soup, Pad Thai and steamed rice. We were disappointed with the quality. The coconut soup was okay. The Pad Thai is probably the worst I have had. It was overly spicy and oily.

oR19EW9vM9n0YNLoSZfpxQ.text: I love this place.  The atmosphere is beautiful and swanky.  The food is excellent. The servers are very nice. Each time the experience has been great.

jtZlN6Rm134rXoC9eAV_8w.text: The worst Thai experience ever. The food is awful and way over priced. You can get better Thai food and cheaper else where. The waitress lost our cc and the management didn't even offer us anything for our inconvenience. I normally don't write reviews but I had to warn others. Dine at your own risk.

6wbTiWrgk8W0NRgid01few.text: Noodles and crab Rangoon were good. Service is slow and the staff looked/seemed stressed out. Kind of pricy too.

4LZ8pHIxjVbGUzvPwh25Tw.text: Nice place with a decent, somewhat cliched environment that mimics a lot of newer Thai restaurants in other cities.  However, my meal was tasty and perfectly spiced.  I had a bowl of Tom Yum and some shrimp curry for my entree.  The service was friendly and quick.  Would definitely go back if I were in the neighborhood.

LFC04qbFOeR32WGqhREn-g.text: Went during lunch on a Saturday and were the only people in the restaurant which should have clued us in. Don't get me wrong, the food was "okay" but for the price and service, not worth it. They kept bringing us the wrong drinks and then added extra dishes to our check that we didn't order. We think it was from the one other couple that came in after us....anyway, I got the drunken noodles and asked for medium spice, but I swear it was mild.

8x4ZbKoIdinvf_S_d8AUjQ.text: Quite good. Expensive but so is everything in Vegas so I would definitely recommend it. Got the drunken noodle with chicken and house Red wine.

bofw8GVaiBRPoNf0JN5bOw.text: We got there around 10:30 pm, and were promptly seated. Very cool ambiance, and some unique seating arrangements, but by the end of the meal, sitting on a hard wooden bench really hurt my butt. We each ordered 1 well drink (rum & coke, gin & tonic), and specified house liquor. We shared a soup appetizer, pork belly with baby bok choy, and phad thai. The food was all very good, but everything was expensive. The main dishes were $18 each, and we just about crapped our pants when we got the bill and saw our house-well drinks were $10 each. That is insane. If we ever go back, we've learned our lesson not to order alcoholic drinks. On the plus side, the servers were very good at keeping our water glasses topped off, which is good since we order everything at a spicy 5-star.

9pGvToFwvI_q_sHy-oSp_w.text: Very nice ambiance here. On my first visit was a little date night but I loved the food so much I had my birthday there. There's a private room that you can reserve. Seated 15 of us. Food is tasty and authentic.  They even have a water feature that goes through the middle of the restaurant.  Would recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VgMWXGhtNW0bt1W9OoVOhA.text: Definitely not the best Thai food I've had.  The appetizers were great, and portions were large here, but I thought my entree: Pad Thai was lacking flavor.  I would go back though, for the appetizers!! I had the steamed dumplings which were delicious!!

tW8Poocaz8kYRwgMJOIxzQ.text: The Thai Experience? Hmm. I think not. I think it is a little pan-Asian-Americanized. I also think it is the wallet-emptying experience, unnecessarily so.   I had the prik king (~$28) which was not what I would call generously sized. I ordered it "Thai spicy" and I wouldn't even say it had a kick. I wanted a glass of green tea, but it is only served by the pitcher ... at $10. Food was mediocre.   I was also sat behind the screen, which is where they seem to sit people they want out of view. The lighting back there is harsh and is right next to the kitchen. The vibe is entirely different there. I was dining alone and I guess that marked me as an undesirable one that had to be seated away from the many empty tables out front. Also back there was a group of 80+ year olds and later a Middle Eastern couple that eventually asked to be moved to the front (maybe they didn't like being sat next to the single guy).   There are better Thai options on the Strip and even better off the strip. Save your dough.

3UbnmljluUY-YR-UWkneRg.text: The food is good but definitely overpriced. The ambiance is great for especially near the water area.  Service is awesome as well. Very attentive and friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ginger and garlic calamari. ;)
Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Satay. Meh!
Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sticky Lemongrass Chicken is the bomb.com!

GPYAejXLS8_TJ2B7QDWEAQ.text: Nice ambience, love the seating arrangement besides "Buddha in the water". Love the tom kha soup, creamy and delicious with veggies. The Siamese fried rice was flavorful and cooked spicy as I requested.

lx3ciIY0NeWEu_gvBeMoJQ.text: Very easy to find being located inside Bally's Hotel and Casino. Staff was extremely nice and accommodating with our group of 5 which also included our 1 year old son. For appetizers we ordered the cream cheese ragoons and the vegetable egg roll which were both extremely good. For dinner we have the vegetarian Bangkok Panang Curry, Pad Thai, and Fried rice. All dishes were up to par and did not lack taste.

SyKIdAQ2TIp9o66o7H7dqQ.text: OH man, perhaps it's because I went to Thailand for 3 weeks this summer and I'm spoiled, but this just was not good.  It wasn't even good for cheap Thai and it was PRICEY.   I got the Drunken Noodles and they were a sticky, gooey mess.  The portion was teeny and at $25  I wish I had more.    The ambiance is dark and quiet and it's quite hard to see the menu.

N7VjBPiLiJIb4qwOWfQ1yA.text: This was definitely the best meal we had in Bally's hotel! The garlic butter shrimp and crab claws were AMAZING.  My daughter also said it was the best teriyaki chicken she's ever had! I enjoyed a delicious cocktail called a cobbler.   One con is that rice does not come with many of the dishes.  I was charged $9 for a small portion of rice.  Great ambiance.  Eat near the pond.

d9N87_aFAHZ5jJZzY8EJeQ.text: The jungle Curry and the lemon chicken we're great. The place is beautiful inside. Nice and quiet

WF4ylELk-2rh4HzdKA4ObQ.text: The food was great And the waiter was informative. The lighting was a bit dim but it was not too bad it's am intamate setting perfect for a date. I was in a group of 4 and got sat at the table next to the water. There wasn't much arm/leg room for us it was a table meant for 2 other then that everything was great the food was delicious and flavorful

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lO-g1Axp4ziqKQAv6pMlrA.text: The portion have gone down in size. It no longer comes ready to eat. You must mix all the spices and everything together. Very disappointing we come every year and the service was horrible this year.

ikGVjXzDRKdwDSY_rAM-aA.text: Hipster Thai. It's not the most authentic restaurant in the world but the ingredient quality is unmistakably good. Average food, but an elevated experience because the service is pleasant and attentive without being overbearing, and the atmosphere is modern and chic, with a beautiful reflection pool in the middle of the restaurant.  We ordered the 4 Seasons roll (great crunch), the chicken satay (average), and for entrees, Asian Jungle curry and Eat Your Greens stir fry. The curry was the better dish of the two, with a nice warmth from fresh peppercorns and an earthiness from basil. The Eat Your Greens, while the veggies were flash-fried to a perfect crispness, retaining much of the snap and bite, the sesame oil disappeared in the garlic sauce, and despite my request to make it "super spicy," there was absolutely no spice whatsoever, and the amount of chili sauce required to get a little heat out of the dish distorted its flavor with its vinegar and salt.  It's a nice atmosphere for a date night - quiet, set away from the casino floor - but the food is definitely watered-down compared to spots like Lotus of Siam or Komol. Come here if you can get a Groupon - but I wouldn't pay full price.

TT4OxLtcbQ9RDzIp48ddSg.text: This place was an excellent find. My gf and I went here on a Saturday night around 8:00pm and got a great seat right by that relaxing lily pond. The wait staff was very nice and we got to use our Groupon, which was a great deal. Food was fascinating and delicious. Will definitely be returning during our next trip!

CFpmh6bsg-AiY4wuzNMDxA.text: I really liked the food. The honey walnut prawns were good, but different from the usual. The chicken satay was great! The volcano chicken was also really good. Minus 1 star for my crispy duck skin confit. The duck skin was chewy not crispy. Other then that dinner was great!

Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Volcano Chicken

JAp5W4DEIaN5LlU3V4wVfQ.text: Nice classy and modern decors. Romantic with the dim lighting. Great and fast service. We came here to eat twice in one week during our stay here at Bally's.   The food we had did not wow me. I heard the Tom Yum soup was good, but I didn't get to try. The Pad Thai was ok. The beef Pho was way too salty and sweet. Big portion, but expensive ($17).   I don't think they gave me any bean sprouts and lime the first time I ordered the pho, but the second time they did.   I would come here for the ambiance, but as for the food I might have to order something else to try again.

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef pho and pad thai

BfC6SSpSZq6_42iBzoNgeQ.text: Very expensive to the tune of about $40/person by the time you're done. However the plates were huge. There were 8 of us and every dish was delicious. Service was excellent.

F_s5EOyewmkMGXbidliDOA.text: The green curry was VERY good!  The setting is quiet, peaceful, a perfect break from the Vegas madness.  I would definitely to back!

iqG4HM1WDWgoOL-aEUEEOg.text: I was surprised by the 3.5 ratings. I am thinking the spice level is what people are not liking. The food quality was great, excellent authentic flavors which were on the high spicy side. The place has great ambiance as well.

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sitting area
Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic vegetable with shrimp

PWmBKnq98oavJZlVVlC2yA.text: I was looking forward to this restaurant because when someone puts the word Experience in the title you think its going to be awesome to the third power.  Well for sure borderline but not quite authentic.  Sometimes I hate that I compare foods to where they originate from because it can ruin the "experience".  I mean overall it was not bad just very generic.  I ordered the papaya salad which should have a little kick to it and with fresh shrimp, this one had dried inedible shrimp and zero kick.  I ordered the prawns and glass noodles, the prawns were delightful but the glass noodles just tasted like they were mixed with a little soy sauce.  Also tried the calamari which was very good.  The Thai tea was good as well.  I though it was odd that there was not an offering of Thai chili, I requested some and was brought back some in a glass cup.   The restaurant is cozy and has a really nice atmosphere, the servers were gracious and helpful, pricing is a bit ridiculous but so is most pricing of restaurants now in Las Vegas strip area.

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RdQqp41QWBk2UJN95_pClQ.text: Nice atmosphere, as you would expect on the strip. However, the food was just ok. The massaman curry was really turmeric heavy. The pad see ew had a good sauce but the gai lan was blanched instead of stir-fried with the noodles which made for flavorless gai lan. The duck confit was very good. I had a discount for a Groupon deal, so based on what I paid the value was fine. The reason I selected this deal was because the photos on their website lead you to believe it will be an "experience" with out of this world food with spectacular playing. None of the plating was particularly special. Needless to say I would never return to pay the exorbitant strip prices. I'll stick with my fave spot in Henderson.

eCtuZVUsyXnDNOjVmh5n1A.text: The environment is awesome, the Tom Yum soup is very good, the salads are all pretty heavily dressed, and the salmon I got is drier than other salmons I had before.   You can get the coupon from the coupon place on the street so everything 30% off.

CSUC4OUqimsTWLaJ8yloqA.text: Thai dishes are good but I found Vietnamese dishes better. The quality of food is good but i'm taking one star out as This is not the best Thai restaurant in town. Good portion of Vietnamese Noodles.  The atmosphere is nice. Very nice place to dine. But the seats in the middle of the restaurants are very comfortable. there are no backrests. If you are two people, it might be good to sit there. If you are more than 3, i don't recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qH7Suav_3iKG9LXiGdU04w.text: So, we(my fiance and I) walked from Harrah's Casino to Bally's to eat here. So when we got there at 4:30pm there was a sign that it will reopen at 5pm so we decide to walk the casino and look for a place that we can order him a burger since he rarely eat asian food. We placed a togo order for him and walked back to Sea Thai. So we get back at 5pm they seat us and came took my drink order. We were there before the other parties but the wAitress decide to tAke their orders first then came to us like 10 mins later to take my order. She asked me if I would like the New Years Eve Dinner Special for $45 I said ok. I asked my fiance a question about the food and the waitress says to me Rudely..."HE CANNOT TOUCH YOUR FOOD HE HAS TO ORDER HIS OWN!!! WE DONT DO SHARING IN HERE!!!  I was like wow. She says I wouldn't be able to eat there if he wasnt eating. Wow!! She then advise me to order it to go. I told her I was planning to eat there while we were waiting for his togo order. She took the menu from us said sorry and walked off. I have never been so angry in my life! I did not want to cause a scene because There were people in there trying to enjoy their dinner. I can't tell you how the food was but my waitress ruined my dinner!!!! I guess they get so many tourist that they don't care about losing any.  I wont be back.

IiCCKQnLWjvf9kxpCuasVw.text: I stayed at Ballys during my stay in Vegas so Sea was right down in the lobby for us We came here for lunch because being from NYC we've both had Sea in Brooklyn. For the fellow NYers who might be reading this. Its the same thing, just a smaller version. Its nice for lunch, no one is really there. Its quiet and nice to relax after a long night or grabbing a bite before heading to the pool. Unfortunately I dont remember what I ate but Im sure I liked it. I do remember drinking a Pomegranate Margarita which I loved!

In4KlH3WWaV2HxYNRPIY0w.text: While the food and the service were good, the restaurant smelled bad and I was unable to get Thai beer because they had to get beer from outside the restaurant (it was weird).

Ykdt8Y3G6p4PxGGI70p8rA.text: The food was really good! I'm not a big fan of Thai food...but I likes it. The place was clean and the service was good. The have no liquor license, and the location is odd. The prices were a little steep, and the portions were a little light.

cu3odUGLn1SsLikrm0RhGA.text: Ordered takeout from our rooms at Bally's. Service was prompt and very nice. Coconut shrimp was amazing. Pad thai, not so much. It was good, but it wasn't anything to write home about. Just average. Had an odd smell too...

2n4dD8lMVKqnm9VZpfohiQ.text: Let me begin with that I have been in the hospitality industry for many years and I understand the business very well! I have been a server, bartender, and even managed restaurants. I am usually very understanding of issues that may arise, but this dinning experience was the first time in my life I have went to a manager to complain ever! I was unhappy with my food and the server said that he would take my dish off the bill. I was eating my husbands food because the beef In my pho was chewy and uneatable. When the server cleared the plates without asking I still had chopsticks in my hand eating off his plate....since I could not eat my own food which no one offered to fix, even after my comments about the food not being up to par ( also that wasn't the first time he tried to clear our plates while we were still eating). At the end of our meal the server stated that he would take my "RARE" STEAK PHO off the bill. Upon receiving the bill to my "surprise" considering the service.... this item was still on the bill. I went to the host stand and asked to speak to a manager, I explained to him what had happened and to my surprise the server came up and had the nerve to argue with me about the situation in front of his manager. The manager was good in the sense of telling him to apologize and pretty much just agree with me. That isn't what I was looking for but it was the right move!(from the in the biz prospective, you never argue with a guest once a manager is involved! That is what they are there for!) I have never in my personal or working life experienced such an unprofessional dinning experience from a server (IHOP has provided better service to their guest). I personally work at an establishment that receives many Yelp reviews. I am almost always mentioned by name (which I couldn't tell you our servers name,because he never told us) in multiple 5 star reviews due to my friendliness, attentiveness, and proper service! I have never felt the need to go to a manager in regards to a server before and I have never had one argue with me in front of management! This is why I am giving this establishment a 1 star review, if I had ever pulled a stunt like our server did I would be promptly unemployed!!!! There is no excuse for what happened and that server is lucky I understand the biz because if he had to deal with the cliental I deal with he would be cleaning bathrooms at the local Walmart!

hh6janhdGlp5ije7Axd2Fg.text: A smaller version of the original locations in Williamsburg and Meatpacking (NY) yet this restaurant still managed to encompass the delicious cuisine, abstract decorum and overall coolness of the others. Nice!

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OxSdsHxLq5bZ4K_ZYSIVpQ.text: While in Vegas, my better half was looking for a Pho fix.  SEA at Bally's was the closest and we were happy with the decision. Yes, it is extremely pricey for what it is, but that's Vegas...  Thai cuisine on one side of the menu and Viet on the other.  BH had pho, which he said was good. I went with one of my Thai standbys, drunken noodles which was good and spicy, as requested.  Dinner for two: drinks, appetizer and 2 entrees was $90 after tax and tip.  Service was pleasant, no complaints there.  (TIP:  ask for the sauce tray which includes siriracha and hoisin sauce)

oHBE16F_EPcitekTQuPffA.text: Nothing special, slow service and they are still waiting for their liquor license. For the price I can think of better options for food.

4pp9vJd3DgxCtXaYfAWetg.text: This food was horrible and ridiculously expensive. This place is one of the only places on the strip open late and it is only for people who are drunk and don't give a damn. Just be smart and eat before 10pm. Otherwise you have to deal with the bottom feeders of restaurants like this one.

_fkHfQS3scJqDIV9_gcVGQ.text: Amazing food! Drunken noodles were amazing! Go to a half price tix booth and get 30% off

mhs0jjLNTDNG086htPUuxw.text: It is inside the Bally where we were staying! YES awesome! This food was so fricken good. We(7) did family style and ordered about 6 plates of food. Everything was so good and very fast service as well. At the end of it all I paid 33 dollars plus tip for alot of food. I am just fine with that! Just try it for yourself....

p77n8IzeStdghx3oEJZzGg.text: Great food at semi-reasonable prices for Vegas. Generous portion of veggies. Everything freshly prepared. Brown rice available. Great choice for a healthier meal. Eat in or to go.

vV_C5nlvCC8ly72pHQiJvQ.text: Food was ok, very slow service. The tom ka was probably the best dish we had, broth was surprisingly good, and pretty generous amount of seafood. The pad siew on the other hand was soggy and over cooked. unfortunately, the seafood pot had hardly any seafood, maybe they made a mistake and put most of it in the tom ka? The chicken satay was on the dry side. We chose this place because it was convenient, and not a very long wait.

NfLIkqXvjqJzMpuNq7E5EA.text: The atmosphere wasn't the best, almost nightclub vibe to it, but the food was good.    I'm a Vietnamese food especially Pho guru.   The pho didn't come with the sate, chili paste, etc so that is a negative.  They did had the sprouts, lime, basil, etc.   The service was extremely slow for being one of the only ones in there.  I expected better service for $18 for a bowl of Pho.    I would go back again but expect to wait a little for food.

T1CHMCmnRVQTC5orF5_q-A.text: So I came here twice. Not that i had a first bad experience, i just didn't think I'd be back again but when youre staying at ballys, and you're craving noodles, and you're too lazy to leave the hotel, and the Chinese panda express-esque place in the food court is being rude and ignoring you.. I guess you'd somehow find yourself stumbling to the same Thai restaurant again.  So the interior and decor is absolutely beautiful!! My boyfriend and I sat by the water pond thing which felt very intimate and romantic. Kudos on the interior design. We ended up having a lovely dinner that I can only partially remember because let's be honest.. I'm in Vegas.   We had the mediocre-tasting pad Thai that cost $18. If this wasn't Vegas I'd be outraged cause who would really want to pay double the price for half the portion you can normally get at a Thai restaurant? But, like I said, it's Vegas and the interior was beautiful.   We also had some fried shrimp and chicken balls as appetizers for $8? It comes with 6 pcs with a yummy dipping sauce. I enjoyed it better than the overpriced pad Thai so I ordered it again the 2nd time I came here. Definitely worth it!

ojCjv-69flqDtDXPf7HdJQ.text: Food was delicious. A little pricey for the portions but it was high quality and very good flavor. Seems to be a little hidden so it wasnt too busy, in a good way. I'd come back again for sure but not a place I would eat often.

MbxL9rFVRWlTGtB4dFz5eA.text: On our last night in Vegas, before driving home, the Boyfriend and I were trying to decide where to eat.  We were tired and hungry and sitting in the hallway to the parking lot of Paris.  We turned around and saw a poster for SEA directly above our heads.  Something in my mind clicked and I realized that this was the sister restaurant for SEA in New York which was featured in Sex & the City but also, more importantly, for one of my favorite scenes in one of my favorite movies of all time: Garden State.  "umm...we're a Vietnamese restaurant?  We don't serve bread?"  "Can I get something to chew on?  F***, bamboo.  Whatever."  So it was decided that we would go to SEA for our final meal that weekend in Vegas.  I'd never had Vietnamese food before, so I stuck to my old standby, shrimp red curry and sticky rice, from the Thai said of the restaurant.  The shrimp was well cooked and the curry flavorful.  BF went for a Vietnamese noodle dish with steak.  Mine was very very good, however, the Vietnamese dish was outstanding.  I totally wished I'd gotten the same thing.  The noodles were delicate and the steak supremely flavorful and tender.  The atmosphere is great--I absolutely love sitting along the water, facing the statue.  I thought I would just explode quoting Garden State throughout dinner.  My one issue was that the lighting was dim and pleasant, but that there was no curtain separating the glaring kitchen lights from the rest of the eating area, some what taking away the dream light atmosphere.  Best of all, it didn't totally break the bank and was a truly delicious and memorable meal.  I love finding places like this along the strip!

TQcrs_aQKBp22sdzxiHujA.text: Enjoyed the meal.  I tried something different than I usually get which was the Geyser Shrimp.  Rice noodles with shrimp and veggies.  Very tasty.  But if you want it Thai hot, you are really going to have to emphasize that.  I asked for it Thai hot but got normal hot so had to add the spice myself.  Others in the party had the rice plate with pork and something else which was really good and a shrimp/bok choy dish.    Service was fast on the food, slow on the drinks but that was in part because there was one server for the whole dining room and the bar was actually outside the restaurant in the casino.  Had the banana/wonton/cheesecake dessert.  Pretty good - tasted mostly of wonton and bananas.  One drawback was the loud techno music -- at 6pm.  Would have preferred something more soothing to match the wonderful decor and escape the 'ping ping' noises of the slot machines.  Reco going to Half Price tickets to get a 30% dining voucher as well.  Came in handy.

B-ALuM3ZmCXgy0PSM-2WxQ.text: Ordered take out yesterday. Very tasty. Tried the ragoons, as they got great reviews and I was not disappointed. Also ordered the Bangkok Panang. Great flavor. Could have been spicier in my opinion. I ordered medium and it was barely mild. Great flavor, and crunchy vegetables. Had to order rice separately. Weird. Also asked for plates, but when I got to my room there weren't any in the bag so I had to comprise. This place is inside Ballys. I would eat there again. Kind of pricey, but it's Las Vegas.

rhfD9hlThoGX9z5xRe0-NA.text: Awesome food. Outstanding service. Very relaxing atmosphere. Will be going back for great Thai food. Put this on your Vegas list.

nFvUKriuisPBFZ0x3uvQPw.text: My girlfriend and I ended up here after I bought a groupon and we were both surprised at how good the food was and everything we had was excellent and just the best flavors and cooked to perfection. We had a seat next to the water and the Buddha and it was a little loud but the atmosphere and the food were beyond our expectations and will be going back.

pYJsUPF2I7fQMWlvNS-0Zw.text: We were craving Vietnamese/Thai food tonight.  I wanted to go to eat Pho but there aren't any that are on the strip and the thought of getting a cab at dinner time and then trying to get one back didn't sound pleasant.    We had been to Ballys earlier in the day and saw that they had a Thai restaurant there.   We looked at the reviews for Sea Thai on Yelp and they were decent.    We took the monorail back to Ballys from Harrahs and got there around 730.  It wasn't busy  (Wednesday night) so we got a table right away.  They sat us next to the water which was kind of romantic.  The server came promptly and asked us if we wanted drinks. We just got waters because when you are in Vegas why pay for alcohol when you can get it for free when you gamble.  For our meals I had the garlic shrimp and my fiance had the pho.  The meals were great.  I was kinda irritated that I got five prawns for 34 bucks and my fiance's bowl of pho was 19 bucks. I mean we had plenty of food, it just seemed expensive for Asian food and that was the reason I didn't want to dine here in the first place.    My fiance said that I have to think about the location of the restaurant, they have to be able to cover the rent.  He also pointed out the decor, most mom and pop pho or Thai restaurants are not decorated as nice.  I guess if you think about going off the strip to have dinner, you have to pay for a cab. Factor that in with your 6 dollar bowl of pho and your 13 dollar seafood dish and you are paying almost the same amount.  Yeah , they are higher priced than your typical Asian restaurant but the food is way better than the Pan Asian place in the food court.

uQh0uxVKjNhTIAWeHzYItg.text: OKAY - so not the BEST Thai food I've ever had but the restaurant is lovely.  Too bad it's located in a smelly casino on the Vegas Strip.  Fried calamari was decent - not too overdone but the sauce was delicious!  I had the pork chops and my son had the duck confit.  Portions are decent sized but the prices are BIG, overall the food was quite good.  $8.00 for edamame when it should only be $3.00, crazy.  You are definitely paying for the location.  For example I would normally have the Pad Thaii in addition to a main dish  but for the price of over $20.- I would not pay.  Besides when I saw the reviews for blah Pad Thai, I refused.    Service was terrific but as I mentioned having to walk thru a smelly smoke filled casino to get there is a turn off.  Yes, I'm in Vegas and don't gamble or smoke but I do eat.  It was a treat to go to an upscale expensive restaurant , but I would do go again.

428EDDlyaLSWjVuN0bye9w.text: If I could give 4 stars for service I would but i have to give a 3 as the food itself was lack luster. The crab ragoons had very little crab in them. That said the sweet and sour sauce was outstanding. The Pad Thai was mainly noodle without the typical extras that make it texturely satisfying; bean sprouts, peanuts, etc. It also lacked any heat at all. Overall, nice atmosphere, good staff, but just ok food.

z3sMKX7-vBoFFSqgUSQ_sQ.text: Excellent food, good service and nice atmosphere! Very well priced for Vegas! Must try the drunken noodles!

Bz9x8C-5rLtlo-hiabAZVw.text: A bit pricey, but I love the ambiance here.  There location is pretty bad and easy to miss but if your on the stip and especially staying at Bally's make this a place to not miss.

eFhHzMckHPxqMymQOsWlng.text: Great experience!  Friendly, well verse, professional staff. I had lemongrass chicken which was amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemongrass chicken

VwxMFdQy8Pq1PcEtsRMp8w.text: Ate here twice in two days because it was so good.  The first day, I ordered the Pad Thai with duck.  Portion was huge but very tasty. The second day, I ordered a green curry dish based on the waiters recommendation, and it was one of the best meals I've ever eaten.  Service is outstanding and really helps make the experience.

elJUHj6PiJzUHCm0Ktf2ag.text: The environment is awesome! And the soup is the best I ever tried in Thai restaurant. Pretty special experience in LV

RBvoWEjZljkiuzgF9NXYnw.text: In my humble opinion, this is one of the best Thai restaurants this side of the Rockies... I ordered my favorite dish Pad Kee Mao and was not disappointed. The spicy thin sauce covered the thick egg noodles and just al dente (can you use an Italian word when describing Thai food?) fresh vegetables sang in my mouth. I ordered veggie egg rolls encrusted with toasty coconut as a starter. These little delicacies were served in a sea of sweet, slightly lemon sauce. It is a beautifully decorated place with special touches of design. It is tucked out of the way at the back of the Bally's Casino. Worth the walk through the slot machines!

hoyI-WfCd6YWTGfv1dxjmw.text: After strolling the infamous Las Vegas Strip from the Sign to the Paris Hotel, we were ready to sit down & eat. Being that we are huge fans of the Original SEA Restaurant in Williamsburg, Brooklyn, NY, we were excited to experience the same in Vegas. Right? Wrong! SEA in Brooklyn is NOTHING like the SEA in Las Vegas. When we entered, the ambiance was the same. Oh! It's also located inside of a hotel lobby. So, we sat down near the indoor water & the server greeted us with a kind attitude explaining to us the menu. So, the first difference is the food, Brooklyn's SEA definitely tastes better than Las Vegas' SEA. The prices in Brooklyn are also more affordable (which makes SEA in Brooklyn so popular). I hate to have to compare but how can you not when the SEA in Brooklyn is Famous? So famous that they made one in Las Vegas to mirror the original. Therefore, I'll be sticking to the original SEA.

FNIbQY_Htz0jNdD6z2fO5w.text: The food was delicious  The service was great and the atmosphere was perfect for my small family birthday celebration

ZVjQ6AglhvaxZGHv6WyVAw.text: We went here as part of a Groupon promotion, it was good value with the voucher. Food and service was quick, I did find it interesting that they added all means up together then put the voucher in as the value and we were still required to pay tax and then tip, it just seemed interesting that the charges the tax on the whole value because we had not come across that before. Taking that into account it was pretty expensive, was happy with food and service but probably won't be back because of the price.!

06MqWn3uJula2WeRlao1Kw.text: The food was great!  The portions were huge.  The service was good but it was freezing in there!

dCpqc3s2DIwZ24-Nqr60wQ.text: Solid food.  Like the rest of the Strip they try too hard with the decor and then charge you an arm and a leg.

eI-B0sKSgBA70V492KSw9A.text: Sea Thai should be renamed Wow Thai. For starters we ordered chicken Satey and chicken & shrimp steam dumplings. For main course we ordered shrimp jungle curry and ginger scallops. None of the main course comes with rice, we have to order that separate. Food was simply fabulous, just right amount of spices. Veggies were real crisp announcing their freshness and scallops were tender and sweet.   Proper service was a major accompaniment.  Ambience was very nice, simplest furniture with modern take. Highly recommended. Little pricey though. I would recommend buying a dinner coupon at Tix4tonight, cost $2 each person for 30% discount on the entire bill.

BlNiUIOw03GAD0KruO5HVw.text: SEA Thai is a hidden gem in the otherwise seedy Ballys Casino. We love Thai food and were attracted by their Groupon special. We have tried many Thai restaurants in Las Vegas and this was one of our best experiences. We requested a seat by the reflection pool and the ambiance was wonderful.   We tried a calamari and a shrimp appetizer. Both of these were delicious and are large portions. The calamari was nicely breaded and had a nice dipping sauce that was not too sweet. The shrimp were tempura breaded and plentiful.  The appetizers were good, but the entrees were the star of the meal. We tried one version of there duck fried rice. It was rich, delicious and full of savory duck meat. We also tried a seafood hot pot soup which was served in a flaming hot potato volcano. The soup was full of seafood and was delicious!  Overall we were very happy with our experience and the groupon makes the prices acceptable. Recommended for a romantic date.

p4j7KjvN1jFK13yCimDFQQ.text: The atmosphere is great romantic setting, every good service and fair price for entrees. I had the drunken man noodle with duck, real good.

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States

krsR6p48ZG8DM65Bx6q2NA.text: The Vegas sea is nearly identical to the New York one, only with higher prices. The New York one has a better aura and scenery though as it is more entrancing. The food here is good, not amazing, but the server was super friendly and I really loved that. Their fried rice dishes are still the go-to here, along with their noodles so those would be my recommendations. The place is inside Bally's Hotel lobby all the way to the back so just a heads up if you're there looking for it.

WrZ7Uw4arJybVnifoBEgtQ.text: Place is a little pricey but your paying for the great food, wonderful service and the ambience. I love their papaya salad.

MLPYiG-1fotP16k_tBfOqw.text: Went to SEA on a Thursday night around 6. Not real crowded but active.  Got the yum Tim appetizer and it was good but a bit light on quantity.  I got the pad Thai and it was good but a bit sweet.  Good flavors and noodles were cooked perfectly.  Friend got the hot

T_AqX76Sz22rx1KqSrvPAw.text: I visit sea every time I visit vegas. I have been there with a group, and with my partner.  The service is great, and the food is delicious!

cvnZyCdDGEctifO2ACfQtg.text: We got the soft shell crab, prawn curry, honey glazed walnuts, and pad Thai.  We enjoyed the food.  Luckily they have fresh chili in fish sauce.  The flavor is good already but by adding the fresh chili it bring more flavor.  The decor is nice and customer services were friendly.

4Scj9vvfR3fbE349-NBJ5Q.text: Ordered a  Mai Tai for my first drink. HORRIBLE!!! Sent it back. Not sure they knew what a Mai Tai was given the drink they brought out.  Served in a regular glass, med. size with 1 lemon garnish. Color was off as well.   Loud kids playing on the swing up front. REALLY!!  Waitress was super sweet. Food was really good. 2 thumbs up to the cook.   Won't be back.

Gm2OxrQoXjTkjo5BIApZKA.text: Yelp says they are open now but they are closed. 3:30 PM on Thursday 7-27-17. We returned the next day for dinner. Chicken Pad Se Ew. Sorry, not much flavor. Bites of chicken the size of raisins. The fresh salad  rolls were different than what I  am used to but they were very flavorful. Very expensive for what you get. I know everything in Vegas is overpriced for what you get but you would think they would at least try.

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pX9fyzsLNsaUzobJbQO7vA.text: Mika was so amazing! This place is just like Brooklyn. The crab and shrimp were great suggestions.

bHJAXsm_2VM6GylHydmyrA.text: I had a wonderful dining experience at SEA. My family and I were staying at Bally's and decided to have dinner here. The classy and zen-like atmosphere is what made it special. Each of the tables surrounds a pond that stretches across the middle of the restaurant.   The food was top-notch and the portion sizes were good. The presentation was also beautiful. For one our appetizers, we ordered fresh spring rolls, which all had different lengths and were laid vertically in a plate filled with dipping sauce. The only negative aspect of the food was the high prices.  The service was good but not excellent.    This is a great place to go to for fusion Asian food, especially if you are staying nearby. However, I feel that a decent portion of what you are paying is for the ambiance.

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh spring rolls

hlnjK4RJm5F8rr_WX2BVaA.text: This place sucks now!   2 years ago they had a Vietnamese menu with pho, vermicelli, rice plates and bun rieu. They changed their menu and we asked the server about the old menu, he said (in broken English) the chef "went away" (we thought he said "ran away")... And that's exactly what we should have done when we heard that there's a new chef! RUN AWAY NOW!!   They still have Vietnamese pho but more Thai now. The WORST pho ever! My sister found a hair AND a bug in her soup! She asked them to take it back and they took forever for another one, she wasn't hungry after waiting another 30 minutes for pho. My other sister found a hair net in hers but she decided to just eat it. The pho was lukewarm, the broth was salty and since it wasn't even hot the meat didn't cook and it stayed raw. My friend asked if they could just microwave her pho for it to be hot and cook the meat, again it took forever. How long does it take to microwave it? The only good dish was the drunken noodles, which wasn't exactly hot as well. We also got the seafood soup and it was cold, and too sweet. It's like they let it sit out... I don't think the chefs in the back are actually chefs, they probably hired a chef school drop out... I mean, pho soup should be hot, not lukewarm.   You probably wondering, why are we getting pho on the strip? And not go to china town... We didn't have cars and were hungover and SEA is across from our hotel, trust me, paying $21 dollars for nasty ass cold pho with hair and bugs was not what we were looking for... This place should close down, it's a disgrace to Pho restaurants out there. I'm ashamed that I ate this.

gqUir-QfZmdj2LXtHNjGaA.text: We had a reservation at 5pm. We sat down immediately and were given service quickly. The food , service and overall experience was 5 stars. The meal price was comparable to most high quality restaurants, was expected.

eDVjmzUOLTjyZJpTbDs-HA.text: Great service, food was very fresh,seafood was fresh and done to perfection.  Seasoning was flavorful but not overpowering.  Vegetables had a good crunch .  Just a great meal at a respectable price.  Well worth looking into.

pmA6hBiICciF0z2tOkXJFw.text: This is one of my favorite places to eat in Vegas & I always make a point to bring a group of friends! Amazing food & great atmosphere!

QxBBIGW4XQYWcJvnr0EaNQ.text: It's hard to believe that we tried almost every other Thai restaurant in Vegas before we made it to SEA. I'm not sure what stopped us, although we haven't stayed at Bally's for years, and SEA is tucked in behind the casino floor in kind of an out-of-the-way spot.    The food was so good we went back twice on the same trip.  The service can be a little slow at times, but I'm not rushing through the meal anyway, so it didn't matter much. But the servers are friendly, even if there is somewhat of a language barrier at times, but that's nothing new for many Thai places.    One odd thing is that the rice is an extra charge, which is the first time I've seen that at a Thai restaurant.    But it's good food and it saves you a cab ride to Lotus, Satay, Krung Siam, Le Thai, Komol, or any of the other comparable Thai places in Vegas.

29cv0zgENzVBicrg5qo-_Q.text: It's was ok not the best Thai food in town. Doesn't really taste like Thai food at all.  About the only good thing with this place was the service which was exceptional. Dessert was good too.

8lg17TfFvwh8PuSQnX3w2Q.text: Service is very fast and friendly. I had a few questions before i ordered and the waiter did a good job explaining things. I ordered the basil chicken. I was worried it might be spicy but he asked me 1 to 5 how spicy i want it.  I think that was nice. And my wife ordered the short ribs. The food was really good. Food was a little pricey but it tasted good. The restaurant had some really good decor.

VUg1mpkCxIqfRmBUroM5sQ.text: This place is visually appealing. Yet it seems that was it.  Calamari was rubbery. The fritters over fried. The pitcher we ordered. Was so watered down, we asked for sugar to sweeten it up, 10 mins later someone who was not our waiter finally helped us out.. dinner, oh boy I don't know if they just threw it together to get us out, " we where the last ones there" but come on, out of four of us adults, none of us enjoyed it at all. My salad was half onions. Maybe it was just a glitch, but $200+spent,  for a plate full of onions, and over cooked steak, half Roma tomatoes in the rice, is not what I expected.

wUm3TUmOhDBsYLMewpJA_Q.text: We went here for daughter's bday.  Decent service, aesthetically the place is ok.  Cool little pond in the middle.  But the food is overpriced, lacking in flavor, and the place is smoky.  Like we smoked a pack as we ate.  Massaman curry is avg. fried rice avg. Rangoon's avg. salmon average.  Pad Thai below avg. Lucky we had a groupon but still way too much $ for very basic food.

Z0FgddgJTOKUDt_FKH4axQ.text: We made reservations here and arrived a little late, but they had no problem seating us! :) We orders the pad Thai and pineapple chicken. The experience oozed racism from the bartender and the fact it was supported was saddening.... Enjoy. The food is edible.

CuaPNPIEo1EPZ1C4NBHfEg.text: So, with respect to my previous review something changed for the better. The ambience of the place remained nice, and other things improved. earn it its lonely star. Service was okay if a bit slow, drink menu still had nothing really Thai to offer, but the menu itself was improved and my pad Thai reasonable even if not excellent.  The prices are still high for the quality IMO

yLYR4j5acObd_KbxxpmTMQ.text: Totally amazing!!!  I love curry and this si definitely the place to eat it at.  Perfect level of spiciness engulfed in creamy yet mild coconut flavor.  I will definitely be back

uG7F9zHAb9ABaidVIYrxbg.text: I love Thai food. I love insane amounts of spice so I won't comment on the spice level except to say if you're like me they offer 1-5 and the 5 was mild at best.  The food was good. Not great. Service is great and the atmosphere was comfy.  Be prepared for the prices because ouch - but considering prices on the strip these days I guess that's nothing new anymore.

ypmYhCNiYAE1V16CH8G01w.text: This is place is grossly overpriced for the quality/ taste you receive.  I have never paid more than $15/ entree for Thai food so when they charge $22-28 a platter, I was expecting some stellar, grade A stuff.  It was very bland.   Seriously not worth the money.  Thank God I had a Groupon but even paying 50% off it was still not worth it.    Never order the Holy Basil Seafood Platter.  Basically boiled Seafood.  We ordered:  Crab Rangoons - Ok, Pick up Stix caliber Chicken Satae - Ehh Chicken lettuce wraps - blah Calamari - Very generic, nothing special  Chicken Cashew - YUM Holy Basil Seafood - NO GO.  So bland Sweet Potato Curry - Gross Ribeye Steak Salad - YUM, very spicy Drunken Man's Noodles - Good Thai Iced Tea - Good  Service was EXCELLENT.   Drinks refilled. Seated Timely.  Food came out quick. Just the food itself wasn't great.

PRGKlzS4WVbtHfOmbv0rUg.text: The food here is great..I'm really picky about my Thai food. I recommend the pad Thai. The wait staff and everyone there is nice.

nvakAgAMbRiNokcdV7tjoA.text: Very very good! We mainly went here because my sister LOVES Thai food, so naturally we had to find a Thai place. We weren't disappointed!   I like the layout of the restaurant and the tables that are around the water. The staff was great and the food was very very good!

BDcst8NakrN3Zhl_3lccYw.text: Food was delicious! No complaints there.   The portions were generous but I did knock a star because it was definitely overpriced.   The staff was very friendly and it was a nice setting. The lighting did mess with my eyes a bit.

41VFUL6uGfO7LibNh1DbuQ.text: Absolutely a gem on the strip! You can't go wrong.  But be careful if you like spicy and ask for spicy!!

UO373l-nA2lEegB4XNgVLQ.text: We were looking for thai food after walking in strip for hours and SEA  was the closest...we opted for it even though the rating was not very high....so I was pleasantly surprised when I entered the place...   Ambience - 11/10. I sat near a pool with Buddha statue, floating candles & lotuses.   Starters - By far the best spring rolls and sauce I have eaten  Entree - cashew nut gravy and fried rice. Loved the mild flavour of rice and the cashew nut gravy as well.

h1AKduWwTsczyyLiaw13XA.text: We had a very nice experience here for dinner!  It was date night and my hottie brought me here for din din. We got a Groupon Voucher to suit our budget. Made a reservation on Opentable and was seated right away when we got there. The interior decor of the restaurant was amazing, very zen with a small koi pond, and floating lotus flowers. There was a small bamboo swing and buddha statues situated throughout the restaurant. The whole feel was very tranquil and peaceful.   Our waitress was very nice and explained some of the specials to us. We ordered 2 dishes to share, the prices are a bit expensive but it's to be expected for a high end place on the strip. The food was pretty good, and the service was attentive. I really just like the whole vibe of this place.   Bathrooms are outside of the restaurant in the casino. It's bit of a walk to the restaurant from the parking structure. Overall, I would recommend this place!

JuaAwTOuTjzc7GXYafFpZA.text: by far the very best thai food experience in vegas. used to go to lemongrass @ aria but food isn't as authentic as it is @ sea! in addition staff is so absolutely helpful and friendly! had pad thai with fried tofu and sticky rice and mangoo. 10 out of 10! will be back for sure! thank you
