xghQ0wN50Dw6ZdYl2_shxw.text: The food was delicious but for me the atmosphere made the night. It was easy to forget you were in a casino while sitting next to the pond

7_wD_g37VPgqSKcx2mnCDw.text: Intimate restaurant, quite dark not very well let. unique table set up with water fountain the center of the hotel. We enjoyed everything we ordered. Service was excellent. Will be back.

LB5hhm38maC7nrUwgBxQUA.text: It is my second time here and from what I recalled from my first trip (company paid) and it still seemed very expensive. It has been a few yeas but it definitely went up a few $. My partner told me about a Travelzoo deal $50 for 2 apps up to $15 each and 2 entrees up to $28 for lunch. They were really nice when we brought it up and was patient with us since we purchased it while we were there.   We got the fried shrimp appetizer with a spicy mayo type of sauce. Good quality and batter was tasty. Also got the steam dumplings, big portion and good quality.  For entrees, they did have some specials, the plates varied from Vietnamese, Korean, etc. Kind of threw me off since I thought it was a Thai restaurant experience but it's more Asian Fusion. We got the pad see ew chicken, big portion good quality chicken but the greens were ok, not well seasoned. I got the masasam curry which said it was rated top 10 dishes. They asked for spice level 1-5, a 2 was very mild. The dish was ok but had a good portion of beef. None of the entree came with rice so we order a side order for $5. They bring it in a cute pyramid shape however, the portion was super small, not equivalent to the curry.   Other things to note, the service in my opinion was excellent. I think we spoke to everyone in the restaurant. Ambiance is very cute, try to sit on the benches along the water. Thai tea is very delicious!   Overall, we did have to pay extra for the rice, Thai tea, tax, etc. after we tip off the original amount the total came to $80 (with Travelzoo deal). In my mind, yes we did save money but $80 for a Thai lunch is expensive for 2. $28 entrees is a bit excessive for lunch. I felt they could have done a lunch combo platter or 2/3 course meal. Plus, after the meal, I immediately didn't feel great.   3/5-hit or miss but overall not a mind blowing Thai experience.

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Masaam curry with beef
Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp appetizer $15

Df2_4fCv2fHLBCEMD7-ppg.text: Stayed at Bally's and my hubby and I were looking for Thai food.  Was actually recommended by some random stranger while we were at Indigo Lounge .. he recommended their crab fried rice.  I'm a fan of Thai food so I actually tried their papaya salad, calamari, pad ke mow "drunken noodle" and hubby had their Thai boat noodles.  Hands down, very authentic Thai food!  Their papaya salad is so good!  We went back there on our last night in Vegas.  Check to see if they have Groupon deal.  That's what we did the second time.  I highly recommend this place for you Thai food lovers.  Definitely authentic Thai cuisine/chef.

yhKZEozfqX1agBI5tAC6YA.text: I was a little saddened that my virgin meal in Vegas was an average Thai experience.  I found the service disorganized--several played hostess, several waited on you, several filled the water glass.  My hostess spoke little English.  It was a tag team of sorts, that I found chaotic in an enchanting room that should bring one peace.  They had fun low-appearing tables around the indoor koi pond but did not even invite me to sit here tho there was open seating.  I think it was being saved for couples--as several of us singles were placed along the sides.   It took a seriously long time for food to come out.  I ordered Bangkok Panang with Tofu.  It came out with chicken.  But because of the lonnnng wait I did not want to wait again for the correction.  I ate it and did not get even an apology when I told them.  (They were willing to take it back.) I found the restaurant far too dark as well.  When providing a spicy dish one should keep the ice water coming-they had trouble keeping the glass full.  Due to the poor service I skipped dessert.  My bill was still mid $20 with tip--for a dish not quite as good as I can get at home for $10.  This place is not meeting its potential.

1bE-syQIY1AO79EGLtSoaw.text: I love the atmosphere and the ragoons and that sauce was delicious . The cashew Chicken was fantastic but the fried rice had huge vegetables including giant raw onions and tomato. I was not happy and it took time to get the main entree . Not sure why ... they weren't chopping any veggies or cooking them.  The Thai iced tea was delicious.

9k368n80C5S9xMPFok0Kag.text: Great Service and Great Food!  The head chef from NYC is now in Vegas so the food taste just like at home.  The Pineapple Fried rice was delicious! The Tum Tum Fritters were great! but the Walnut Shrimp AMAZEBALLS!!!  only thing missing are the Sea Wings.. they don't have them in Vegas..

Py7AV0582gxxz-9Xp-d4pA.text: Located inside Bally's. First time eating here and it was fabulous. The service was great and the ambiance is nice. We had the pad Thai and sobo noodles. Spiciness was perfect and the food was full of flavor. If you are in Bally's I would recommend giving it a try.

c9HyjV91ylt1IIPOflfAhQ.text: We literally planned our evening around the time Sea Thai claimed it closes, which is at midnight. Arrived at 11:30 after racing from Planet Hollywood, only to discover it was already closed. State properly your hours.

0YZ_5nPI1xQMNovgLT1utA.text: It was packed and service was ok .. one of the waitress was too rushing ..decent food though .. seemed overpriced like many of the things in Vegas ! Wud check out some other place next time . Good decor inside as well.

-l4seunEhwsfflxW8nLDmw.text: The Pad Thai is delicious!  Friendly and fast service. The restaurant is clean and beautiful.  You will not be disappointed!

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pad Thai!

TXxMfTMCcdbuhv9iTjQe9g.text: Decent restaurant serving Thai and Vietnamese dishes.  The menu has broad selection of noodles, soups, rice dishes, curries, and pho.  You can choose from chicken, beef, tofu, and shrimp with the various noodle and rice selections.   We had lunch and was seated next to a nice indoor lotus pond with a stone Buddha and paper lanterns hanging from the ceiling.  Wife ordered the chicken pineapple fried rice, which was cooked well and had decent "wok breath."  I liked it more than she did.  The rice wasn't dry at all and I liked the saute cashews, scallions, eggs, and pineapple chunks that gave acidity to balance the savory.  I ordered the spicy SEA noodles, which came as a pile of wide rice noodles mixed with shrimp, tofu, bean sprouts  and squid.  It was surrounded by a pool of dark soy sauce with a vinegary aftertaste, similar to tamarind.  The flavors were bold, but the sauce overwhelmed slightly. I probably should have gotten the Drunken noodles or spicy seafood soup noodles.  Still, good place to grab lunch in a dark intimate setting.  Good service too.  Just watch out for over-sauced dishes.

_XgPsu9AzCx4bHXfrn5ijQ.text: One of my worst eating experiences in Vegas. The servers are not attentive, never make trips to the table and the food is mediocre at best ( my food was cold, mild when I asked for spicy). Even when I asked the server to make the correction, she screwed up a second time around.   The drinks are nothing great to write home about either

aPhkG2-8i_q0OnIVF7vGwg.text: This place feels like you're eating at a spa! Relaxing, zen decor with a center water feature. Food was really good, prices were reasonable, portions were sizeable. Definitely worth checking out!

ZwBVMVXH30sVoFz1b7HBOg.text: Came to Las Vegas for the weekend and after seeing the menu to Sea, I had to try it. We went early on Sunday morning right when it opened. Jessie took care of us and he was polite and awesome.   The food . . . awesome as well! It's hard to find a great Thai place. Even in Las Vegas. The ingredients were fresh, the customer service was great, over all, next time I'm in Las Vegas I'm sure I'll stop by and grab a bite here.

uMQn-H_tHe15lqzwzapDrQ.text: Pretty crappy. My husband was excited to go here because he passed a poster for it. We went before seeing a show. The decor is pretty and relaxing and the seats by the pond are really nice. It was quite beautiful until straw wrappers started floating by. We got the honey walnut shrimp appetizer and all I can say is it defiantly was not honey walnut shrimp. It was something spicy and terrible. Both of our meals weren't any good and the server was extremely slow. We had to get other servers to help at times. I got a Thai Iced Tea that was disgusting. I took one sip of it and left it sitting on the table. The server never asked about it just sitting there. Our bill was well over $100 and we walked away hungry and disappointed. Get off the strip and don't go here. Total letdown. One star for decor.

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2HIeYwwCIjub4f7bmfJSUQ.text: Good Thai food for the price. The place is gorgeous. Staff was super friendly.   The only thing I didn't like was the water. It smelled and tasted like a swimming pool. Make sure you ask for bottled water.

2ejKnPieqpItm_NjsowRmw.text: The food here was very good, to start with. We had pad Thai and a Penang curry. Both were very well prepared and very tasty.  What was disappointing was the service. We expected a wait at the door, given the weekend of the CES conference and that's what we got (despite being near 9pm). But after maybe 20 minutes we were seated next to the pond inside, which was nice.  Unfortunately, our waitress seemed disinterested in us, instead paying more attention to other tables while taking our orders. We later had our food come out (bit of a delay, but again expected) but delivered without cutlery, so we had to sit and look at our food until we could finally grab one of the waitstaffs attention to provide us with cutlery.  After we had finished our mains and asked for the check, we again waited another 15 minutes for it to be delivered - at this point the restaurant was barely half full.  It redeemed itself with the food, otherwise the experience wasn't great, especially considering the price.

0b4-tKFGli6agLnjsfp-7A.text: The fact that this restaurant seated us just before midnight earns them an extra bonus star-- Great service and really good food make it a solid four-star. We called and tried several restaurants on a friday night and were basically shut out at the eleven-thirty ish hour. When SEA answered and sounded delighted to have us come, we were more than pleasantly surprised.  Patty, our server, was kind and friendly and sold the mad russian on a special saki that they had at discount and actually dissuading her from heating it up. This one she said was best served cold. Bonus points added. Nothing special about the beers my sister and I had, but we really enjoyed the pond side seating we had with the floating lotus flowers. What we had: Crab Rangoon Fritters Golden Crab Roll Crazy Pad Thai Scallop Stir Fry All of the food was very good and we enjoyed a great meal so late at night. As far as we could tell, they made no short cuts on food or service. Well done!

TfIVSbZIjERdHItpxHjISA.text: I had the roasted duck drunken noodles, spice level 3/5. It was very good. If you are in or near Bally's and want Thai food do not hesitate to visit this restaurant.

AU6Iafme7a1yCYp6Y52maA.text: Let me start with the pro's the service is great. Everyone that works there is very nice. The first word that comes to mind after leaving this place is overpriced. Never have we ever paid 80 dollars for 2 entrees and an appetizer at a Thai food place.  With no drinks !!  I understand that it is vegas and that it is in Bally's which can explain the price. The fritters were very good. However, I absolutely hated my entree. I ordered the pineapple/ginger sauteed chicken dish. It did not come with rice, rice was a extra charge (which is a 1st for us). I couldn't enjoy the dish because the taste of ginger was sooooo overwhelming. I didn't want to bother attempting to order something else so I literally just picked at it.  The 2 entrees and appetizer came up to 70 dollars which was Just insane to me. Add in tip for a meal that I didn't enjoy 80 bucks. We have a sea Thai nyc in Brooklyn. I thought it would have been similar or affiliated , but I don't think it is.

inogZoS0JHkrua4zpZ8wlg.text: We wandered around a bit, and Yelp didn't say it was INSIDE Bally's.  We wandered a bit, but it was solo worth it!  The atmosphere is private but casual.  The meals were amazing!  I had Rama the King with chicken - it was perfect.  My coworker had Drunken Noodles and gave me a bite - again, it was amazing. Glad we stuck it out to find the place. Price was reasonable too and the portions were generous without being too large.

-4ugQA0mBEdkCBQ8Gp4_xw.text: I'm here with my wife right now and I'm taking the time to write this post to say that the food is excellent! We recommend the the spicy beef salad and the Tom yum Kun. Service was also excellent! Got seated right away and all our food was on the table in less than 10mins. Ambiance was fitting and the lotus pound in the middle of the restaurant offers a peaceful experience.    Exquisite!

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States

IOvwRUc6axx73nVxUTl0cw.text: On our third day in Paradise, Cary was craving thai food and found SEA through yelp. The restaurant is really pretty inside and we got to sit in the area of the fountain and the statue. We had ordered calamari to start and the pad kei mao (drunken noodles) and the herb fried rice for the entrees. THe food was really good but because it is Vegas, I think they really lacked out on the heat. When I asked how spicy the food will be, I heard "oh really spicy!" We ordered both entrees with 4 stars because we didn't want to be idiots and order it too spicy if it's already "really spicy." Like I said, the food was good but the heat wasn't there and the price is ridiculous! 18 bucks for a plate that I know I can get for half the price somewhere else.....   The service was alright, not the best. I had ordered a thai tea upon sitting at our table and NEVER got it. We had to ask for water and out waiter never came around to our table after we had ordered our food. The place was packed but it wasn't busy since I can see the buss boy and waiters and waitresses standing around chatting. The noise level  here is pretty loud considering that the restaurant is right next to the lounge area in Bally where they have a stage for performances, singing and dancing. I think I will try to find another thai restaurant that's cheaper, more attentative, and have heat the next time I'm in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Drunken noodles and herb fried rice.

9vfW_NuCQyytsczkPaA9uQ.text: I liked the short ribs! And the red curry with duck was great, too. Because we liked the food we had on the first night, we went back to this place another day. That time, the pork chops weren't as great as the short ribs. The drunken noodle was not as spicy as we requested. We still like the short ribs and red curry, so we give this place four stars. But your experience depends on what you order.

MYG932IqBiExg-CUVYLZpw.text: This place is absolutely amazing and totally worth your time to try! We decided to try it because of a Travelzoo deal and we are happy to report it is one of our new favorite places to dine in Vegas. Nestled inside the Ballys casino, it's a pleasant little space that totally takes you on a tranquility rush. It has dim lighting and a little water fall that you can dine next to. The customer service was excellent which made the entire dining experience a pleasure. And the food was to die for! If you're looking for a good Thai place look no more!

wo8u4X2u8r5rcwXg9xWWqA.text: Delicious, authentic Thai food. Top notch service. Highly recommend. If you are a Thai fan...don't miss this experience!!! Atmosphere and dinner were just so on spot! Loved it!!!

uytoJ3bKzBv_qDQ3pKGWWA.text: Service 8/10 - out server was very attentive ^_^  Papaya salad 6/10 - it was big and good just not spicy enough(yes we even asked for it to be spicier)  Chao Tom 4/10 - very bland but big  Bun rieu 3/10 - this is one of my favorite Vietnamese dishes but I've had better. It's really not great in taste it has more eggs then anything. And wayyyy to much fried onion. Broth didn't taste like it is suppose for bun rieu broth.

byfR-cmXMknjhuzBZ6N_8w.text: Great food! The walnut ginger shrimp were very good!!! The service was good. I am one happy camper. I dont have anything that i would change (that's saying a lot).

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Very intimate.  Love the Asian decor.

QQ7pfH9XDI8Ur8wAMt62TQ.text: Awesome food and atmosphere.. Great customer service. I wish i could of stood in the water and took a photo with the buddha statue.. The 3 appetizer was great with satay chicken and thai peanut sauce, dumplings, and duck!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hell yeah volcano chicken
Photo of SEA: The Thai Experience - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love it

N6le1RveTnPxaV8SLqmtsA.text: been here twice now.  the food is tasty and on the sweeter side.  the presentation is nice, and the portion size is appropriate - not too much, not too little.    if you can get away from the strip, i'd highly suggest lotus of siam.  however, if you stuck on the strip and need a quick fulfilling bite of thai food and don't mind the cost, this hits the spot.  had the pad see ew tofu and the panang chicken with brown rice.  both were satisfying.

oIBhG57Jslfd7GrRiYZ9Tg.text: This place is located in Hotel Bally, really high end for a asian joint. I love how the seating which creating an illusion your sitting on the floor like Japanese style  If you craving Pho, this is the spot.  I had the Pho with Steak & Beef balls however it was so expensive like $18-20 a bowl.  The broth was really good however my rare Steak tasted wierd - not in a good way.  I was really hungry  so I dipped the meat  with the hosin/sirracha which help cover the funky taste.  My friend ordered the Duck Soup and Love it!  He is a lite eater and I couldn't believed he finish the whole bowl (It was that good)  I would comeback again only because it's the only pho in this area.

gzedwkj9KaTmymH6_DzoZQ.text: I liked this place just fine, but I think the decor and ambiance out shown the food in my opinion. There were a lot of fantastic items on the menu - in fact so many it was hard to choose! I had heard that the spicy soba noodles were a hit, so I went with that. It was good, but not great. Although there was plenty of shrimp on it, they were all butterflied, and nothing was over cooked. I suppose it was just that explosion of flavor that I love from Thai food that was missing.   Combine that with the Strip prices - I spent $40 on an entree and sake, and I left feeling like it was an ok experience for the price.

gxrYI5RZPWY2NXUFygsymQ.text: The best Thai restaurant in Vegas! It can be a little tricky to find (it's somewhat hidden in the Bally's hotel/casino), but the food is phenomenal.  Me and my girlfriend like to split and appetizer (or two) and an entree, and it is the perfect amount of food!   We can't wait until we're back in Vegas because this is one of our go-to restaurants!

vrKTvNEAIPz6Ok8ZMuZpKQ.text: Was really hoping for amazing food and left feeling just either way about it. Ordered miso soup, and the pad thai. Both were appetizing but nothing too special. I did get their sweet mango coconut rice for dessert, and that was very delicious. Don't think I would go back just because there are so many other options in Vegas to explore.

KBECH2MEhdAAw_WTPs1vfA.text: We just ate dinner here and while the atmosphere was nice (we sat by the pond in the middle of the restaurant) and the food tasted great, the full menu advertised on Caesar's website was obviously old and was at least 4-8$ cheaper, so we were shocked to see the prices in person after getting a table. I was hungry for Thai so we stayed. I picked the shrimp tom yum (soup), which for $16, was closer to being reasonably priced, compared to the $22+ for meals. In all, good food, high prices.

cPu5HoAUpwR9m1YuKKEpkA.text: Stumbled upon this brand new restaurant adjacent to Bally's Steakhouse this past weekend.  What a hidden gem in the land of overpriced strip food.  Feeling slightly under the weather, we ordered a bowl of pho. The chef must have been tutored personally by ramen girl's soup nazi because they have got this down to perfection.  The vietnamese spring rolls are also some of the best I've had.  Only disappointment was the pad thai which was swimming in too much sweet sauce.  But the prices more than make up for the one dish not too our liking.  The dishes are reasonably priced by Vegas Strip standards.  We ordered 2 dishes, an appetizer and a bottle of Sonoma Cutrer and the bill was under $100.  The ambience is cool with comfortable wooden booths next to a water pond. The service is exceptional  When the word gets out about this restaurant, it will be crowded because there aren't a ton of tables.   If you find yourself on this side of the strip, definitely seek out Sea.

7u5NC9SeSaQZZ3mIDw_GZA.text: Enjoyed the food, ambiance, and service. Food came quick and was very flavorful. The seats by the water are a nice relaxing way to have dinner. We completely enjoyed the experience. Nothing bad to say about any of it.

mFRNKRQLII9t_tHPWAVECQ.text: This place is a hidden jewel in the mess of Sin City. Definitely a welcome change from the heat of the weather, noisy beeps of slot machines, and the omnipresent chaos of obnoxious young people. (I'm not going to apologize for what I just said, so deal with it. I will, however, apologize for the obnoxiously rude and annoying ways of my generation which I am regretfully a part of.) On with the review....  Tranquil, quiet, serene. Almost felt like I was stepping into a spa. The decor was lovely. There is a wooden seating area (I don't think it was bamboo) surrounding the fountain, where a large buddha figure greets you at the head. The whole ambience was very relaxing. Definitely something I haven't experienced in Vegas before.   The food is delicious! We ordered Vietnamese vermicelli bowls, pad thai, green curry (the rice came in a cute little pyramid shape!), and one other scrumptious dish that I can't remember. Probably some variation of fried rice. In any case, all were excellent and robust in flavors. Our waiter was shy and quiet, but very polite and helpful. I think anything we ordered here would have been just as tasty.   Definitely coming back here again. I especially like that it was open at an odd hour of the day when most restaurants take their siestas (i.e., 3PM) so we didn't have to wait in starvation after hours of working at trade shows. I don't know how they did it, but they really brought some classiness and elegance into Vegas. Thank you, thank you.  .

b_NqxeGKDjmmbwBZnMbkoQ.text: A True life-saver. With 2 hour plus lines everywhere else, this literally saved the day - was our wedding anniversary, and great food and ambience to boot. Got seated by the zen pool. Love this place. Would definitely go back.

dmk3LjPZujQu_K1evRja9Q.text: Sea Thai is hidden away in a nook between a Margarita joint and yet another steakhouse in Paris, right by the hallway when you come through when you walk over from Bally's.   The atmosphere and service were both just a pleasure. Seating surrounds a rectangular pool with a large statue of the Compassionate Buddha, with a screen behind it with a lotus flower graphic on it. Lighting is dim, tasteful and the atmosphere is contributed to by candlelit wall sconces.   Unique wooden tables for 2 surround the pool, with more traditional seating along the walls.  We especially appreciated, being Vegetarian, that every meal had a tofu option. In Vegas, that's a rarity!  The only thing that kept this from a 5 star for me was that the food didn't actually taste Thai! I just assume that they removed the spice form the recipe to cater to the generic palate's of the average visitor. Don't get me wrong though, the food was very good and I'd go again...I'll just remember to ask for spicy next time!

hol6GJaDi988kMg8kcAGnQ.text: Very pretty atmosphere. The food is very good and the staff friendly. It is one of my favorite places to eat in Vegas.

QfpqhUwHyYsBNvvlVnU03w.text: Love the ambience. I ordered the papaya salad and rib eye salad and both were amazing. I look forward to eating here again.

Wc3JpARBu1w4ET6fOXLxQg.text: The pho wasn't great - I don't recommend ordering it.  It was like eating spaghetti....they didn't give me the right utensils! You also need to ask for sriracha. You shouldn't have to ask.  However, the spicy soba noodles were FANTASTIC!  Staff is nice but they all wear walkie talkies which completely ruins the ambience.
